product_title: Le Hobbit : Un voyage inattendu [Ultimate Edition - Blu-ray + DVD + Copie digitale - SteelBook Gollum]
review_body: Comme il a été dit précédemment, Warner est le pire éditeur dans notre pays, et ce depuis au moins le DVD. Entre packaging immonde et contenu des disques indigne du format, il faut tout simplement fuir leurs éditions proposées à la vente. Encore plus pour Le Hobbit où Warner compte nous prendre une fois de plus pour des pigeons avec leurs multiples éditions sans piste HD. Leur but, tout simplement se faire de l'argent sur notre dos, en tant que client on ne demande pas l'impossible, juste que les grosses sorties Blu-ray soient soignées comme le font beaucoup d'autres éditeurs ! Alors SVP attendez au moins un coffret trilogie, on est pas à l'abris non plus de versions longues alors s'il y a bien un Blu-ray à ne pas acheter ces mois prochains c'est bien celui ci !  Edit : toujours aussi nul, Warner n'a rien écouté de ce que réclamaient les fans. Ils peuvent garder leur édition baclée.
translated_review: As it has been said earlier, Warner is the worst editor in our country, from at least the DVD.Between filthy packaging and unnecessary record content, it is simply necessary to flee their proposed editions for sale.Even more for the Hobbit where Warner counts us take once more for pigeons with their multiple editions without HD track.Their goal, simply make money on our back, as a customer we do not ask the impossible, just that the big Blu-ray outputs are treated as many other publishers!So please wait at least one trilogy box, we are not at the shelter no more versions long so if there is a Blu-ray not buying these next few months it's good this one!Edit: Always so nil, Warner has not listened to anything of what fans demanded.They can keep their edition bacled.

review_body: highschool musical geht in die zweite runde und überzeugt wieder im vielen songs und tollen choreographien.    es stehen diesmal die sommerferien an und die große frage: wo bekomme ich einen job, um ein wenig geld zu verdienen?  nachdem troy ein job-angebot im countryclub der evans erhalten hat, sagt er unter der bedingung zu, dass auch andere schüler dort beschäftigt werden.  so wird gabriella die pool-aufsicht und troy arbeitet in der küche.  das dies natürlich nicht sharpays plan war, kann man sich schnell denken. sie wollte nur troy dort und sorgt mit allen mitteln dafür, dass sich troy nur noch in ihrer nähe aufhält und es gabriella dort richtig schlecht geht.  und (wie sollte es auch anders sein?) steht ein wettbewerb an, eine talent-show, die sharpay bisher immer gewonnen hat und das hat sie auch diesmal vor - zusammen mit troy.  währenddessen beschließt ihr bruder eine eigene show mit den anderen schülern auf die beine zu stellen.    während des ganzen films werden den anderen schülern immer wieder steine durch sharpay in den weg gelegt. da ist natürlich zusammenhalt gefragt, um das durchzustehen. aber gehört troy noch zu ihnen?    um nicht noch mehr zu verraten, sollten sie sich den film selbst ansehen. überzeugen sie sich durch die songs und die choreos und verfolgen sie die entwicklung, die besonders troys charakter, in diesem teil durchläuft.
translated_review: High School Musical goes into the second round and convinces again in many songs and great choreographies. This time, the summer holidays are on and the big question: Where can I get a job to make a little money? After Troy has received a job offer in the Countryclub of the Evans, he says under the condition that other students are busy there. This is how Gabriella is the pool supervision and Troy works in the kitchen. Of course, this was not Sharpay's plan, you can think fast. She just wanted to troy there and cares with all the means that Troy is only in close proximity and there is Gabriella right. And (how should it be different?) Is a competition, a talent show that Sharpay has always won and she has it this time - together with troy. Meanwhile, her brother decides to put his own show with the other students to the legs. Throughout the film, the other students are repeatedly placed by Sharpay. There is naturally cohesion asked to get through. But is TROY still to you? In order not to reveal even more, you should look at the movie yourself. Convince yourself of the songs and the choreos and follow the development that goes through particularly troy character in this part.

review_body: Eric Clapton hat mit diesem Album ein sehr gutes Produkt für seine Anhänger hinterlassen, doch aus lauter Häme über das vordergründige Schlagwerk des Phil Collins  wollen sie es nicht wirklich zur Kenntnis nehmen. Auch ich meine, dass ein bisschen weniger Getrommel der Produktion gut getan hätte. Doch überwiegt der gute Gesamteindruck der Songs, wie den rockigen Shes Waiting, See What Love Can Do, Forever Man, oder den knochenharten Same Old Blues und Just Like A Prisoner. Aber auch die ruhigen  It All Depend On, Never make to Cry sowie die restlichen Titel sind ein hörenswertes Stück Clapton.
translated_review: Eric Clapton has left this album a very good product for his pendants, but from louder Häme about the superficulous impact movement of the Phil Collins you do not really want to take note.Also, I mean that a little less drainage of production would have done well.But the good overall impression of the songs, like the rocky She S Waiting, Lake What Love Can Do, Forever Man, or the bone-hard Same Old Blues and Just Like A Prisoner.But also the quiet IT all depend on, Never Make to Cry and the rest of the titles are a listening piece of Clapton.

review_body: Eight years on and the very talented Maxwell is back.  He has a new look and a slightly new sound and this initially made me nervous because in my view if something is working then don't tamper with it.  But I guess with maturity comes evolution and the result is a fairly short album but one that grows each time you play it.  As you would expect from a Maxwell CD, the tracks are dreamy, smooth and soulful and I would be hard pressed to choose a favourite.  I also think its genius to end the album with a funky instrumental, which should feel out of place but works very well.  I'm pleased this is the first of a trilogy because I very much look forward to parts 2 and 3.  A welcome return!
translated_review: Eight years on and the very talented Maxwell is back.  He has a new look and a slightly new sound and this initially made me nervous because in my view if something is working then don't tamper with it.  But I guess with maturity comes evolution and the result is a fairly short album but one that grows each time you play it.  As you would expect from a Maxwell CD, the tracks are dreamy, smooth and soulful and I would be hard pressed to choose a favourite.  I also think its genius to end the album with a funky instrumental, which should feel out of place but works very well.  I'm pleased this is the first of a trilogy because I very much look forward to parts 2 and 3.  A welcome return!

review_headline: Un album de reprises enthousiasmant à défaut d'être indispensable
review_body: Contrairement au commentaire précédent je trouve cet album bien plus interessant qu'il n'y parait (à défaut d'être indispensable).     Faire un album de rerpises peut prendre plusieurs chemins différents: soit l'artiste reprend les titres en les réinterprétant de manière personnelle jusqu'a en brouiller les pistes ou soit en faire un covering mimétique. Il ne fait aucun doute Phil Collins ai choisi ici la seconde option. De ce point de vue le projet est sincère. Mais plus encore il donne un sentiment de fougue et de jeunesse retrouvé par un artiste dont on attendait à vrai dire plus grand chose. Si sur la longueur le disque se fait quelque peu répétitif il n'en contient pas moins son lot de réussites. Parmis lesquels on retiendra l'interprétation (fidèle) des chansons et surtout la façon dont le son des sixties à l'heure du numérique est ainsi rendue. Dans son entreprise de reconstitution Phil Collins peut remercier les Funk Brothers (célèbres muisicens de l'écurie Motown injustement oublié aujoud'hui et dont le talent fut systématiquement exploité par le tyran Gordy).     En premier point (positf) il y a le son: chaleureux, rond, ténu aux arrangements certes ficelés selon une recette éprouvée mais aux couches instrumentales plus complexes que l'apparence trompeuse ne laisse présager. Le retour de Phil Collins à la batterie fait plaisir à entendre tant il montre aujourd'hui encore le talent subtil et la finesse de son jeu.     Deuxième point positif la voix: non Phil Collins n'a pas perdu sa voix. Elle est juste moins puissante et moins haute avec l'âge mais nous gagnons au change. La subtilité et le détachement des mots l'emporte sur les vocalises lesquels ne m'ont jamais convaincu chez le musicien.     Troisième point égalemnet positif: le choix des chansons. Les Temptations, Stevie Wonder, Les Supremes et Dusty Springfield se partageznt le gâteau. De ce côté là rien à redire.     Néanmoins et il faut bien avouer que certaines interprétations laissent à désirer: le Blame It on The Sun de Stevie Wonder ne tient pas la comparaison là où la chanson demande une puissance profonde que Collins n'a manifestement jamais pu rendre. Par contre sur le délicat et mélancolique Never Dreamed You'd leave in Summer il est parfait sachant doser les effets de voix avec grand talent. Si le sautillant Uptight tient la dragée haute au jeune Stevie de l'époque il n'en va pas de même du Heatwave des Vendellas.     Mais la dernière piste de l'album laisse un parfum de mélancolie contenue réellement bouleversante: sa version personnelle de la chanson qui donne son titre à l'album empruntée à Dusty Springfield est rellement magique. Elle corroborre l'une des principales qualités de l'album: sa sincérité ce qui n'est déjà pas si mal au vu des dernières productions discographique du chanteur millionnaire.
translated_review: Unlike the previous comment I find this album much more interesting than it seems (failing to be indispensable). Making an album of enriches can take several different paths: either the artist takes up the titles by reinterpreting them in a personal way until the slopes or either make it a mimetic covering. There is no doubt Phil Collins have chosen here the second option. From this point of view the project is sincere. But more still it gives a feeling of passion and youth found by an artist whose truth was expected to say more. If on length the disc is somewhat repetitive it does not contain its share of successes. Among which the interpretation (faithful) of the songs will be retained and especially the way the sound of the sixties at the time of the digital is thus rendered. In its reconstitution company Phil Collins may thank the Funk Brothers (famous Motivens of the Motown unjustly forgotten today and whose talent was systematically exploited by the Gordy Tyrant). In the first point (POSITF) there is the sound: warm, round, tenuous to the arrangements certainly ficted according to a proven recipe but the instrumental layers more complex than the misleading appearance does not sue. The return of Phil Collins to the battery is pleased to hear so much he shows today the subtle talent and the finesse of his game. Second positive point The voice: No Phil Collins has not lost his voice. It is just less powerful and less high with age but we are gaining change. The subtlety and the detachment of the words prevails over the vocalizations which have never convinced me to the musician. Third point Equal description: The choice of songs. The times, Stevie Wonder, the Supremes and Dusty Springfield share the cake. On this side there nothing to say. Nevertheless and it must be admitted that certain interpretations leave something to be desired: the Blame it on the Sun of Stevie Wonder does not hold the comparison where the song asks for a deep power that Collins has obviously never been able to make. On the other hand on the delicate and melancholy Never Dreamed You'd Leave in Summer It is perfect knowing the effects of voice with great talent. If the hopper uptight holds the high draga to the young Stevie of the time it is not the same from the HeatWave of the Vendellas. But the last track of the album leaves a scent of melancholy really upset: its personal version of the song that gives its title to the album taken from Dusty Springfield is real magical. It corroborates one of the main qualities of the album: its sincerity which is not so bad in view of the latest discographic productions of the Millionaus singer.

product_title: My Little Pony: The Elements of Harmony: Friendship is Magic: The Official Guidebook
review_headline: A la fois objet de collection et d'informations
review_body: Sceptique au début, je n'osais pas l'acheter de peur que le contenu ne soit trop médiocre. Finalement j'ai craqué, je n'ai pas encore tout lu, mais il y a beaucoup d'anecdotes, de commentaires de scénaristes, animateurs, . (Ainsi que Lauren Faust et Meghan McCarthy) Si l'on veut connaître dans les détails les personnages principaux, l'histoire sur les éléments d'harmonie ou encore le monde d'Equestria, tout y est, il y a largement de quoi se documenter et connaître tous les secrets de ce monde haut en couleurs.  Listing de tous les background ponies, résumé de tous les épisodes, lyrics de toutes les chansons, et le plus beau sans doute, des dessins de préproductions.  Toi qui me lis, si tu es un brony qui se respecte, fonce, et si le contenu te déçois, la bouquin reste un bel objet de collection à afficher.
translated_review: Skeptic at first, I did not dare to buy it for fear that the content is too poor.Finally I cracked, I have not read yet, but there are many anecdotes, comments from screenwriters, animators,.(As well as Lauren Faust and Meghan McCarthy) if we want to know in the details the main characters, the story on the elements of harmony or the world of Equestria, everything is there, there is largely what isDocument and know all the secrets of this color high in color.Listing of all the background pounds, summary of all episodes, lyrics of all songs, and the most beautiful probably, drawings of preproductions.You who read me, if you are a Brony who respects himself, goes down, and if the content disappoints you, the book remains a beautiful collection object to display.

product_title: FENIX TK41 800 LUMENS WATERPROOF to 2m CREE XM-L LED TORCH LAMP LIGHT ALUMINIUM
review_body: I've owned the TK40 flashlight for several years now. It is wonderfully bright on the medium setting, more than adequate on the low setting, and almost dangerously brilliant on the high setting. It uses 8 AA batteries in a removable magazine, and I wish the battery magazine was better made. The body of the torch is a solid handful of machined metal that oozes quality. The new TK41 design moves the switch from a single button on the end to 2 buttons on the handle, which will make it more usable. I hope that they have not changed the medium beam angle that the TK40 had which was just about perfect; I want a flashlight, not a floodlamp nor a laser pointer.
translated_review: I've owned the TK40 flashlight for several years now. It is wonderfully bright on the medium setting, more than adequate on the low setting, and almost dangerously brilliant on the high setting. It uses 8 AA batteries in a removable magazine, and I wish the battery magazine was better made. The body of the torch is a solid handful of machined metal that oozes quality. The new TK41 design moves the switch from a single button on the end to 2 buttons on the handle, which will make it more usable. I hope that they have not changed the medium beam angle that the TK40 had which was just about perfect; I want a flashlight, not a floodlamp nor a laser pointer.

review_body:
In my opinion, this is brilliant. Sahara has everything: great action sequences, a steady, easy plot, comedy and romance. It really is Indiana Jones and James Bond rolled into one, in the desert.
It follows two marine salvage experts, Dirk (Matthew McConaughan) and Al (Steve Zahn) receiving permission to go in search of a legendary warship that disappeared at the end of the civil war. there they meet with a member of the World Health Organisation called Eva (Penelope Cruz), who is searching for the source of a disease spreading through Africa. When Dirk and Al are nearly killed by soldiers (enter a great boat action sequence), they realise Eva is in serious trouble. They help Eva in her investigation, and eventually come across the problem. There they have to save the day and stop the bad guys before the entire world is contaminated.
With action sequences thick and fast, there are definitely a few memorable moments, such as the boat chase, using a crashed plane to fly through the desert, allowing the story to interact with a civil war and the final 3/4 hours of complete carnage are just a few things that make Sahara a must-buy.
Just one problem: the are no extras. so if you love watching makings-of, etc, etc, then you'll be disappointing at the lack of it. but, if you what to spend two hours watching a high-quality action movie that will keep you hooked to the end, then buy it. Now.

product_title: Swatch Once Again White Dial Black Strap Mens Watch
review_body: This watch was selected because of its clear face with easily read numbers - this is no doubt true.  However the complicated double position winder for setting date and day has refused to work properly and I am about to return the watch to the makers.    The plastic built in strap has proved uncomfortable.    All in all this second birthday present for my wife has not proved to be a success - she wanted a watch with clear figurs - that was OK but otherwise a failure.

review_headline: Nicht Fleisch, nicht Fischer * aber einigermaßen amüsant
review_body: Eigentlich habe ich mit der Neuverfilmung eine Art \"Musketiere 2.0\" erwartet, also innovative Kino mit hoher Geschwindigkeit (so etwa wie in den neuen Star-Wars-Filmen, wo die Fechtduelle in den neuen Filmen auch deutlich an Fahrt gewonnen haben). Leider weit gefehlt. \"Die Drei Musketiere\" ist Mittelmaß. Und zwar in jeder Hinsicht.  Gelungen sind dabei: * der vielsprechende Ớpener; hier dachte ich schon, dass das in eine gute Richtung gehen könnte * die Idee mit den Luftschiffen (Cyberpunkt bei den Musketieren. Mutig! Aber warum nicht) * die Szenen, die ein wenig an Matrix erinnert haben (Mylady hat hier ihre guten Auftritte)  Nicht gelungene Aspekte überwiegen: - der Auftritt von Til Schweiger zu Beginn. Eigentlich wollte ich hier schon ausschalten. Schweiger ist - wie immer - schwer zu ertragen. Warum tut er a. sich, b. dem Zuschauer diesen Auftritt an? Kino zum Abgewöhnen. - die Story: wenig innovativ; aber, noch viel schlimmer, nicht konsequent zu Ende gedacht - einen Großteil der Besetzung (Total-Ausfall Schweiger, der Memmen-König, Udo Walz als Richelieu; das passt alles nicht) - das Geschwindigkeit. Herrje, die Musketiere sollten doch voll im Saft stehen. Aber nein, das ist einfach nur tröge. Nachhilfe bei Michael York, bitte! - die Ausstattung; aus meiner Sicht: lieblos, zu wenig authentisch; das Studio schreit an allen Ecken und Enden.  Popcorn-Kino der schlechteren Sorte. Es unterhält zwar über kurze Strecken, fesselt aber letztendlich nicht. Eine vertane Chance.

review_body: Durch eine Empfehlung in der Zeitung bin ich auf Zaz gestossen - eine wahre Entdeckung. Schöne, eingängige Chansons wechseln sich ab mit jazzigeren Stücken, kraftvolle, sichere Stimme, die noch viele verspricht.  Es muss nicht immer Englisch sein! Gute, teilweise witzige Texte. Zaz wird von hervorragenden Musikern begleitet, die perfekt zum Gesang harmonieren.
translated_review: Through a recommendation in the newspaper I came across ZAZ - a true discovery.Beautiful, catchy Chansons alternate with jazcled pieces, powerful, safe voice that promises many.It does not always have to be English!Good, partly witty texts.ZAZ is accompanied by outstanding musicians, which perfectly harmonize singing.

review_body: Having only recently purchased \"Garden' I have had scant opportunity to savour its brilliance, though brilliant it obviously is. I am a long term fan of the voices of the 'Big Three' of folk-rock from the late 60's/70's (Denny,Prior and McShee) but must now add Celia Humphris to that list - her voice has the same etherial quality found in the work of the other three. It is a little unfair to compare the rendition of Glasgerion with Bert Jansch's - Trees do a good job, Bert's is beyond compare. It is a pity that Trees split when they did, their two albums show real potential - a potential which might or might not have been realised. I tend to think that they might have gone on to bigger things, certainly the bonus tracks on 'Garden' - recorded in 2008 in the absence of the original masters of material not previously issued - shows that the surviving members have lost none of their skills in the nearly 40 years since this excellent recording was originally issued.

I am a long term fan of the voices of the 'Big Three' of folk-rock from the late 60's/70's (Denny,Prior and McShee) but must now add Celia Humphris to that list - her voice has the same etherial quality found in the work of the other three. It is a little unfair to compare the rendition of Glasgerion with Bert Jansch's - Trees do a good job, Bert's is beyond compare. It is a pity that Trees split when they did, their two albums show real potential - a potential which might or might not have been realised. I tend to think that they might have gone on to bigger things, certainly the bonus tracks on 'Garden' - recorded in 2008 in the absence of the original masters of material not previously issued - shows that the surviving members have lost none of their skills in the nearly 40 years since this excellent recording was originally issued.

review_body: Depuis le quintuple album live sorti en 1988, Springsteen n'avait pas enregistré officiellement de disque en concert. C'est chose faite, avec ce concert de New York, enregistré avec un E Street Band reformé, pour une tournée juste pour le plaisir de jouer les vieux morceaux. Le résultat dépasse nos espérances.    Le format CD permet au Boss de rendre compte de l'ambiance de ses concerts, avec de longues plages, et cette manière d'enchaîner les morceaux sans souffler. La set list surpasse tout ce qu'on attendait. Les classiques intacts (\"Born to run\" , \"jungleland\" , \"Badlands\") ou revisités (\"The river\" , \"Born in the USA\" dans une version solo acoustique mémorable) des morceaux tirés de \"Nebraska\" réarrangés rock'n'roll. Springsteen ressort quelques vieilleries qu'il dépoussière à coup de Télécaster (\"Lost in flood\" à tomber, \"Out in the street\" juvénile et sautillant, \"Murder Incorporated\" rageur, explosif, \"Ramrod\" gouilleur et bordélique). Et surtout, Springsteen nous offre deux inédits : \"Land of hope ans dreams\" longue incantation proche du gospel, et \"American Skin\" sans doute sa plus belle chanson depuis 20 ans, où le Boss hurle son désarrois et sa colère devant le meurtre d'un gamin par des policiers. A pleurer tellement c'est beau.    Bref, une fois de plus, le Boss se donne à fond, dans un album pur rock 'n' roll, enchainant les titres longs, non formatés, où on prend le temps de jouer, de rire, comme le \"Tenth Avenue\" de 16 minutes, avec une longue impro comique, les 11 minutes de \"The river\" reformatée. Le E Street Band est gonflé à bloc, retrouve sa puissance de frappe d'antan, le mix des trois guitares est subtile, et la voix de Springsteen n'a jamais été aussi puissante qu'aujourd'hui. Epaulé par l'indéfectible Steve van Zandt (à la seconde voix) Springsteen chante de mieux en mieux en vieillissant, donnant à ses interprétations une tournure plus soul, retrouvant ainsi les accents de ses dbuts. Sur scène il s'amuse, cabriole, cabotine, dans un double souci : divertir et faire danser, autant que dénoncer et faire réfléchir sur notre époque. Elvis et Dylan réunis en un seul !     Une remarque pour finir : l'album comporte un titre caché, et six titres rajoutés sur le CD deux. Pourquoi ne pas avoir mixé le tout de manière plus cohérente ? Ce concert existe aussi en double DVD, en version intégrale.
translated_review: Since the Quintuple Live Album released in 1988, Springsteen had not officially recorded a concert disc. It's done, with this New York concert, recorded with a reformed e street band, for a just tour for the pleasure of playing old pieces. The result exceeds our expectations. The CD format allows the boss to account for the atmosphere of its concerts, with long beaches, and this way of chaining the pieces without blowing. The Set List surpasses everything we were waiting for. The intact classics (\ "born to run \", \ "jungleland \", \ "badlands \") or revisited (\ "the river \", \ "born in the usa \" in a memorable solo acoustic version) of Pieces from \ "Nebraska \" rearranged rock'n'roll. Springsteen Spring Surrends Peeling That He Dodeshop Clothes (\ "Lost in Flood \" to fall, \ "Out In The Street \" Juvenile and Jumping, \ "Murder Incorporated \" Rager, Explosive, \ "Ramrod \" daily and brothel). And most importantly, Springsteen offers us two unpublished: \ "Land of Hope years Dreams \" Long incantation close to Gospel, and \ "American Skin \" probably his most beautiful song for 20 years, where the Boss screams his disarray and anger before the murder of a kid by police officers. To cry so much it's beautiful. In short, once again, the boss gives itself thoroughly, in a pure rock 'n' roll album, chaining long, unformatted titles, where we take the time to play, laugh, like the \ "Tenth Avenue \ "16 minutes, with a long impro comic, the 11 minutes of \" The River \ "reformaté. The e Street Band is inflated to block, finds its struck power of yesteryear, the mix of the three guitars is subtle, and the voice of Springsteen has never been so powerful as today. Updated by the indefectible Steve van Zandt (in the second voice) Springsteen sings better and better as they get older, giving his interpretations a plus soul turn, thus finding the accents of his dbuts. On stage he has fun, cabriole, cabotine, in a double concern: entertain and make dance, as much as denounce and make reflect on our time. Elvis and Dylan gathered in one! A remark to finish: The album has a hidden title, and six titles added on the two CD. Why not have mixed everything more coherently? This concert also exists in duplicate DVD, in full version.

review_body: Overall, I enjoyed this film and the plot was good. According to other reviews this was the best one out of the 3 and although I didn't see the others, I bought the film because of the type of film as enjoyed the originals and when you see the cast list you think it must be good but have learned that you shouldn't be swayed by the cast rather the plot. On the plus side, you do not need to see the other films to watch this as story stands on it's own but if you need to know how relationships work with characters in sequels then really you still don't need to see the others either as the script and voiceover by Clooney will explain the reasons behind the heist and the buddy system. On the negative side, colouring of this film was annoying as it was sepiaesque with colour ! Overall, good film, same old acting from Clooney (boring!) but worth the money.

product_title: Band of Brothers - Frères d'armes - Coffret intégral [Blu-ray]
review_headline: Image excellente, son des doublages à revoir.......
review_body: Livraison Amazon impeccable. Packaging identique au boitier métal de l'édition DVD, rien à redire là-dessus.    Comme pour presque tout les blu-ray l'image est au top, ce qui est plutôt normal après tout. Mais comme pas tous les blu-ray (sauf les vieux films où il faut se méfier) le français et les autres langues restent en retrait avec du son 5.1 à 600 Kbps (en gros ce qu'on trouve sur un DVD) là où l'unique piste DTS HD en anglais tourne à 2100Kbps environ.    Pour une série qui n'est quand même pas si vieille que ça je trouve que c'est un gros manque de respect du client. Quitte à proposer des blu-ray de qualité autant proposer maintenant 2 pistes audio, la langue nationale et l'anglais directement en master HD avec une réelle qualité.  A quoi bon avoir une image HD si le son ne suit pas.    Espérons au moins que les blu-ray de tous les films qui sortiront maintenant possèderont toujours un master audio HD dans la langue du pays de vente.  Grosse déception vis-à-vis du français, une série aussi exceptionnelle méritait le même traitement pour les doublages encore une fois les gros Warner/HBO/etc se contente du minimum syndical en s'occupant uniquement de l'anglais.    Autant ce n'est pas gênant pour moi et d'autres car on peut parfaitement le voir en VO ou VOSTFR. mais pour ceux qui l'écoutent en français ils n'entendront jamais les sons hautes qualités de cette série.    C'est pour ça qu'à mes yeux cette édition blu-ray perd une étoile alors que la version DVD mérite ses 5 étoiles.
translated_review: Impeccable Amazon Delivery. Packaging identical to the metal box of the DVD editing, nothing to complain about on it. As for almost all the Blu-ray the image is at the top, which is rather normal after all. But as not all the Blu-ray (except the old movies where you have to be wary) French and other languages ​​remain behind with sound 5.1 to 600 kbps (basically what we find on a DVD) where the 'Unique DTS HD track in English runs at about 2100Kbps. For a series that is not so old so I think it's a big lack of respect for the customer. Leaving to offer quality Blu-ray as much to offer 2 audio tracks, the national language and English directly in Master HD with real quality. What good to have an HD image if the sound does not follow. Let's hope at least that the Blu-ray of all movies that will come out now will always have an HD Audio Master in the language of the country of sale. Big disappointment vis-à-vis French, a series also exceptional deserved the same treatment for dubbing again the big Warner / HBO / etc. is content with the minimum union by dealing with only English. So much it is not embarrassing for me and others because you can perfectly see it in VO or VOSTFR. But for those who listen to it in French they will never hear the high quality sounds of this series. That's why this edition Blu-ray loses a star while the DVD version deserves its 5 stars.

product_title: Bridget Jones's Diary: Picador Classic (Bridget Jones series Book 1)
review_body: I think it is always tricky to read a book when there is such a successful film adaptation and I have to admit, I always pictured the actors who played the characters from the film. That being said, if you have seen the film then I urge you not to by-pass this book because it is quite different, with more escapades from Bridget.  I love how Helen Fielding has drawn so many parallels with Austen's Mr Darcy and her own Mark Darcy. Right from the start I was rooting for Bridget to move on from Daniel Cleaver and find her love for Mark, and desperately wanted her to realise how much of a bad boy Cleaver really is! You know that Mark is really Bridget's knight in shining armour but I do think that there was opportunity for Fielding to go into more detail about why Mark and Daniel don't like each other (yes, like in the film).  There are plenty of laugh-out-loud moments, such as the diary entry where Bridget is desperately trying to program her video player. You can't help but laugh at Bridget and her misfortunes, and Fielding has created a loveable character that I think all readers can relate to. So much so, I really wanted to give Bridget a big hug, particularly when she wrote about how down she was feeling.  This is a really good book to read and I am keen to read more books by Helen Fielding. Charming and witty, Bridget Jones has many character traits that can be seen in all of us and I think this is why the book has such timeless humour. It might have been first published in 1996, but there is still so much that Fielding's readers can relate to.

review_body: This is a really good album, most of the negative reviews I have read are talking about everything but the music.  Upon first listen I was not completely sold but this album has grown on me massively. I'll breakdown each song-    1. Four Letter Word  What a great opener to an album, this tune is really rocking. Great guitars, lyrics and Liams voice sounds great. Really sets the scene. One of my favs on the album    2. Millionaire  Nice song with great sliding guitar sounds, acoustic style. Really good melody with another great vocal.    3. The Roller  First official single. I was not keen on this when I first heard it but I really like it now. I think Four Letter Wor should have been the first single though.    4. Beatles and Stones  Decent track, sounds a bit like 'My Generation'. Fast rocking track, Liam saying he will stand the test of time like Beatles and Stones. Not bad but the weakest so far.    5. Wind Up Dream  I love this track! This tune has such a great groove to it and Liams voice is awsome here. A harmonica comes in later in the track which sounds great and adds that little bit extra to it. A seriously good song.    6. Bring the Light  Good fun tune. It got a lot of negative reviews but its fast and fun and I love the piano. Got a 50's style rock about it. Only issue is that it goes on for way too long but overall a decent track    7. For Anyone  Very nice acoustic number, upbeat, short and sweet. Simple lyrics but effective. Liams voice sounds really nice here.    8. Kill for a Dream  This track is killer. Great lyrics and great guitar. Towards the end female vocalist come in and it sounds so great.    9. Standing on the Edge of the Noise  This is ok. Its dissapointing as it could of been so much better. The production sounds wrong to me and Liams voice is too drowned out. Its decent but could be better.    10. Wigwam  Great tuune great lyrics. Later in the song after a little drum solo Liam comes back in and his voice is completely different to anything he has done before. He sounds fantastic. The end is really epic, could have been the end of the album.    11. Three Ring Circus  Nice rocking tune, bluesy guitar riffs. Chorus sounds good.    12. The Beat Goes On.  Ok so this song is brilliant! The lyrics are so good, Liam sounds better than ever. A really nice upbeat song, I really think it is something special.    13. The Morning Son  The album ends with a song written by Liam. This is such a great ways to end the album, its starts slow and acoustic and builds up into an epic ending. Really nice lyrics and again Liam sounds great. A really good song.    Overall this album is fantasic. Liam sounds better than ever, the songs are fun, rocking, haunting and touching. A real rocking album that shows versatility. It grows on you the more you listen and for me its easily better than any other 'new' music out at the moment    Cant wait to see them live!

review_headline: in the court of the crimson king...suite et fin.
review_body: il aura fallu 44 ans pour que je découvre cet album! et oui, durant toutes ces années, je ne connaissais que "in the court of the crimson king",starless and bible black" & "red"! quelle erreur! depuis ce matin j'écoute le disque en boucle ,  .bien sur , ce deuxième album est , soit un plagiat, un copié collé, une redite,etc,etc,etc, du premier album .mais il a ce coté brut et rock que n'a pas le premier. écoutez pictures of the city qui effectivement a un petit air de  "l'homme schizophrène du XXI ème siécle"  , the devi's triangle ressemble  au morceau a "la cour du roi crimson" et puis c'est tout! le reste de l'album amorce les idées que fripp  se faisait de la musique et qu'il "couchera" sur les deux derniers disques du groupe en 1974! bref que du bonheur , mais néanmoins ,je conseillerais a ceux qui ne connaissent pas le groupe de commencer par le premier qui a mon avis est le plus abordable.
translated_review: It took 44 years for me to discover this album!And yes, during all these years, I knew only "in the Court of the Crimson King", Starless and Bible Black "&" Red "! What an error! Since this morning I listen to the disc in a loop, .bien on,This second album is, a plagiarism, a copied pasted, a redit, etc., etc, etc., from the first album. But he takes on this raw and rock that does not have the first. Listen pictures of the city who actually hasA little air of "the schizophrenic man of the 21st century", The Devi's Triangle looks like the song A "The court of King Crimson" and then that's all! The rest of the album begins the ideas that Fripp was doingThe music and that "will" on the last two records of the group in 1974! In short, happiness, but nevertheless, I would advise those who do not know the group to start with the first who in my opinion is the most affordable.

review_headline: A Bond on about a Bond Film...
review_body: A classic Bond film, and the biggest grossing film of the series so far, packs a punch in line with its budget.  The film picks up a, for once, properly knocked down Bond and puts him back on tail of a megalomaniac former MI6 Agent hell bent on revenge.  The film is excellently narrated with the Adele theme, which itself sums the film up far better than I ever could here. \"Skyfall is where we start. Let the Skyfall, when it crumbles, he will stand tall, together let the Skyfall\".  Indulgent with the Bond techno-gadgetry, but reintroducing two newly cast regulars, Q and Miss Moneypenny, the film also does an excellent job of what feel like extraordinarily well executed scenes in \"normal\" life, such as the gun fight at the government hearing.  Punctuated with trips to stunning foreign climes and some classic Bond chase sequences.  I feel this film has a better feel than Quantum of Solace, a better script also it weighs into the franchise for me as an equal to Daniel Craigs' premier outing in Casino Royal, but with a more British based plot and British Theme this film brings Bond back to where his heart is and then tears it out for him.  Filming locations in London and the spectacularly stark Scottish Highlands stands so well against the techno-gloss of the far east.  The film ends with a satisfactory nod to many of the older films, notably with Ralph Fienne's office being a definite homage to that as used in earlier Bond films by the late Bernard Lee.  As well as the very nearly incongruous appearance, and atomisation, of a certain Aston Martin - ejector seat still present.

The film picks up a, for once, properly knocked down Bond and puts him back on tail of a megalomaniac former MI6 Agent hell bent on revenge.  The film is excellently narrated with the Adele theme, which itself sums the film up far better than I ever could here. \"Skyfall is where we start. Punctuated with trips to stunning foreign climes and some classic Bond chase sequences. Filming locations in London and the spectacularly stark Scottish Highlands stands so well against the techno-gloss of the far east. As well as the very nearly incongruous appearance, and atomisation, of a certain Aston Martin - ejector seat still present.

review_body: Intéressant voyage musical dans la Russie Tsariste gouvernée successivement par trois femmes d'exception qui ont marqué fortement leur époque, spécialement Catherine la Grande, et ont permis l'ouverture  à l'art Italien  et l'arrivée de l'opéra. Présentation luxueuse et très enrichissante.
translated_review: Interesting musical travel in Tsarist Russia successively governed by three exceptional women who strongly marked their time, especially Catherine La Grande, and allowed the opening to Italian art and the arrival of the opera.Luxurious presentation and very rewarding.

review_body: Von vielen Kritikern als schwaches Elektro-Pop-Album abgestempelt, muss ich sagen, dass mir die Scheibe fantastisch gut gefällt. Natürlich ist der Song \"Believe\" der einzigartige Höhepunkt der gesamten CD - auch wenn viele es abstreiten: Cher's Stimme ist noch immer fabelhaft und da ändert auch der Vocoder-Effekt überhaupt nichts daran. Außerdem singt Cher bei so gut wie allen anderen Songs ohne diverse Effekte - in \"Strong enough\" hört man ihr Timbre, welches immer noch klar und kräftig ist - wie einst in den 60ern, 70ern und 80ern. Warum also dieses Werk so kritisiert wurde und wird, verstehe ich nicht - schließlich ist Cher schon Jahrzehnte lang höchst erfolgreich und um einiges glaubwürdiger als zB Jennifer Lopez, die No Angels und Robbie Williams.
translated_review: From many critics as a weak electric pop album stamped, I have to say that I like the slice fantastic well.Of course, the song \ "Believe \" is the unique climax of the entire CD - even though many exaggerate it: Cher's voice is still fabulous and the vocoder effect also does not change it at all.In addition, Cher sings as well as all other songs without various effects - in "Strong Enough \" one hears her timbre, which is still clear and strong - as once in the 60s, 70s and 80s.So why this work was criticized and becomes so criticized, I do not understand - after all decades, it is highly successful and a lot more credible than, for example, Jennifer Lopez, the No Angels and Robbie Williams.

review_body: When I first saw this in the store, I was doubtful that I would it, it sounded a little romantic for me, but it was part of a 3for2 deal, and I was intrigued, so picked it up anyway. How wrong I was! It was a wonderful read, with brilliant dialogue, realistic characters and a brilliant storytelling device which takes the reader through twenty years in the character's lives.    I've never finished a book before and had a list of so many people I want to force it upon. You won't regret buying this book.
translated_review: When I first saw this in the store, I was doubtful that I would it, it sounded a little romantic for me, but it was part of a 3for2 deal, and I was intrigued, so picked it up anyway. How wrong I was! It was a wonderful read, with brilliant dialogue, realistic characters and a brilliant storytelling device which takes the reader through twenty years in the character's lives.    I've never finished a book before and had a list of so many people I want to force it upon. You won't regret buying this book.

product_title: Proof of Heaven: A Neurosurgeon's Journey into the Afterlife
review_headline: A fascinating story of a Neurosurgeon's Near Death Experience in Heaven
review_body: What made this book great was that the author is a Neurosurgeon and was almost 100% dismissive of Heaven, God or anything spiritual.  The fact that he is now spreading his story about his Near Death Experience and the journey he went through in heaven is a great enough reason to recommend this book.

The fact that he is now spreading his story about his Near Death Experience and the journey he went through in heaven is a great enough reason to recommend this book.

review_headline: How many times have I watched this?
review_body: How many times have I watched this, have lost count now!  But it still kicks in on an emotional level and never fails to hold my interest even if I do know the script and storyline backwards!  And how were we all ever that young - it's like getting in the Tardis and going way, way back in time.  Every actor steps up to the mark, not a weak link anywhere, but my personal favourites are Jon Cryer as Duckie, Andie's best friend, and Harry Dean Stanton as Andie's father.  It's about being an outsider, it's about being true to yourself, the importance of love, friendship and family.  I just love the movie, it gets me every time!
translated_review: How many times have I watched this, have lost count now!  But it still kicks in on an emotional level and never fails to hold my interest even if I do know the script and storyline backwards!  And how were we all ever that young - it's like getting in the Tardis and going way, way back in time.  Every actor steps up to the mark, not a weak link anywhere, but my personal favourites are Jon Cryer as Duckie, Andie's best friend, and Harry Dean Stanton as Andie's father.  It's about being an outsider, it's about being true to yourself, the importance of love, friendship and family.  I just love the movie, it gets me every time!

review_headline: Une puissante épopée écologiste et humaniste
review_body: Avatar est un film qui m'a marqué à sa sortie, un film que j'adore et un film que je classe parmi mes préférés. Je me moque qu'on le critique parfois avec impudence. Si je ne comprend pas pourquoi des gens le critiquent comme si ils préféraient voir un film de drogués ou de truands à la noix complètement lourd ou ennuyeux, je pense que la majorité le critique parce que tout simplement ils sont jaloux et énervés du succès et de la popularité du film et donc cherche à casser l'enthousiasme en jouant à ceux qui savent tout. Twilight, Star Wars ou même le Seigneur des Anneaux connaissent ce genre d'hostilité mal venue. Bien sûr, ce n'est pas parce qu'un film connaît un immense succès que forcément, il est bon. Ce n'est pas non plus forcément le même cas s'il est couronnée de récompenses ou si les critiques sont bonnes. Des films peuvent avoir eu de mauvaises critiques tout en étant de superbes films, mieux que d'autres films ayant été bien critiqués. Cela dépend évidemment du public, des goûts des gens.  Je me moque éperdument que l'histoire soit simple ou non comme certains le disent. Et puis, sincérement, je préfère voir un film avec une histoire simple, facile à suivre que de voir un film à l'histoire longue, compliquée devant laquelle on s'ennuie, on s'endort fatigué de suivre détails et discussions traînantes. Je ne comprend pas ces gens qui recherchent la complication au cinéma.  Qu'on dise ce qu'on veut, qu'on dise les mots les plus insultants ou les critiques les plus détaillés, peu m'importe, Avatar est une formidable épopée écologique d'une étourdissante inventivité visuelle. Un défi technologique hautement réussi. Plus qu'un conte, un film magique au demeurant profondément humain qui nous fait évader de ce monde triste, grisâtre et cynique. Malgré le déluge d'images de synthèses, on est littéralement happé à la fois par l'atmosphère exotique et par la surprenante poésie des images de ce monde coloré et surnaturel. Du début à la fin on reste impressionné. Mais le morceau de bravoure reste sans aucun doute l'extraordinaire bataille finale. Une scène qui fait vibrer tant elle est épique.   En conclusion, Avatar demeure un incontestable chef-d'oeuvre à voir sans attendre.
translated_review: Avatar is a movie that marked me at his exit, a movie that I love and a movie that I class from among my favorites. I make fun of being criticized with impudence. If I do not understand why people criticize it as if they preferred to see a film of drug addicts or trunks with a completely heavy or boring nut, I think the majority criticism because simply they are jealous and annoyed for success and The popularity of the film and therefore seeks to break the enthusiasm playing those who know everything. Twilight, Star Wars or even the Lord of the Rings know this kind of hostility badly. Of course, it's not because a movie is experiencing a huge success as necessarily, it's good. It is also not necessarily the same case if it is crowned with rewards or if the critics are good. Films may have had bad reviews while being great films, better than other films that have been criticized. It obviously depends on the public, the tastes of people. I do not care that the story is simple or not like some say. And since, sincerely, I prefer to see a movie with a simple story, easy to keep up to see a movie in long history, complicated in front of which we are bored, we fall off tired of following details and trailing discussions. I do not understand these people looking for cinema complication. As we say what we want, that we say the most insulting words or the most detailed critics, I do not care, avatar is a great ecological epic of a stunning visual inventiveness. A highly successful technological challenge. More than a tale, a magic movie with deeply human who makes us escape from this sad, greyish and cynical world. Despite the flood of synthetic images, one is literally caught at once by the exotic atmosphere and by the surprising poetry of the images of this colorful and supernatural world. From beginning to finish we remain impressed. But the piece of bravery remains undoubtedly the extraordinary final battle. A scene that makes it vibrate as it is epic. In conclusion, Avatar remains an undeniable masterpiece to see without waiting.

And the next day make nothing - the film has to be processed really and is therefore not suitable for a relaxed DVD evening with friends, popcorn and sugary soft drinks.

review_body: L'album commence de façon extraordinaire avec un 'Coming Up' au son 'Buggles' qu'on écoute encore aujourd'hui de manière intacte (mais parfaitement trouvable sur les compis de Macca). Le reste est inutile, franchement, à l'exception de Waterfalls, splendide (que l'on retrouve sur la compi Wingspan). Bon.autre chose à dire ? non, si ce n'est que je pense que l'album etait sûrement une recréation apres la fin des Wings en 80, peut-etre un peu 'traumatisante' pour Paulo. L'album suivant sera bien meilleur bien sûr (dès qu'il est le dos au mur, notre homme se reprend, c'est systématique.) mais Tug of war, avec du recul, lui sera de bien mauvais conseil, car cet album sera 'le père' de toutes les balades les plus sirupeuses et mégalomanes que Paul produira dans les années 80.jusqu'au reveil de 'Flowers in the Dirt' (enfin !).
translated_review: The album starts extraordinary with a 'coming up' to the 'buggles' that we are still listening today in an intact way (but perfectly found on the Comps de Macca).The rest is useless, frankly, with the exception of Waterfalls, splendid (found on the Wingspan compi).Good.Other thing to say?No, if not that I think the album was surely a recreation after the end of the Wings in 80, maybe a little 'trauma' for Paulo.The following album will be much better (as soon as it's back to the wall, our man gets back, it's systematic.) But Tug of War, with hindsight, will be very advice, because this albumwill be 'the father' of all the most sirupy and megalomanic walks that Paul will produce in the 80s.

review_body: Comme dit dans un autre commentaire, ce concert est vraiment à posséder pour les fans du boss qui n'aurait pas déjà le bootleg car c'est exactement le même concert que le boot \"you can't trust your car to the man who wears the star\".  Je me suis fais avoir et du coup je l'ai en double et franchement je préfère, personnellement, le bootleg.  Mais ça reste un excellent concert. ne vous attendez pas à un son hors du commun, ça reste du bootleg pseudo-officiel.  Mais vous prendrez plaisir à entendre le début de la gloire du boss et de son e street band.
translated_review: As said in another comment, this concert is really to own for the fans of the boss that would not already have the bootleg because it is exactly the same concert as the boot \ "You can't Trust your car to the man whoWears the Star \ ".I made myself having and so I have doubled it and frankly I prefer, personally, the bootleg.But it remains an excellent concert.Do not expect an extraordinary sound, it's still from the pseudo-official bootleg.But you will enjoy hearing the beginning of the glory of the boss and its e street band.

product_title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
review_headline: J.K. Rowling has turned out yet another magical creation!
review_body: I recieved this book on July 8, the day it came out, andplanned to take a few days to read it. Well, I read it in 1 day, 8hours to be exact. It was that good. While the book is undoubtedly scary, it is hardly gruesome. Rowling also continues to provide her fans with more information about the Wizarding World under the influence of Lord Voldermort. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire has a plot full of twists and turns that Harry fans will not have expected, and the ending will leave you astonished and eagerly waiting for the fith book!
translated_review: I recieved this book on July 8, the day it came out, andplanned to take a few days to read it. Well, I read it in 1 day, 8hours to be exact. It was that good. While the book is undoubtedly scary, it is hardly gruesome. Rowling also continues to provide her fans with more information about the Wizarding World under the influence of Lord Voldermort. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire has a plot full of twists and turns that Harry fans will not have expected, and the ending will leave you astonished and eagerly waiting for the fith book!

product_title: The Walking Dead - L'intégrale de la saison 4

review_headline: Niedlich, ehrlich und sympathisch, aber nur was für Kinder
review_body: Keine Spoiler, ich verrate nichts.  Als Animationsfilmfan habe ich mich riesig auf "Hotel Transsilvanien" gefreut, wurde aber schnell enttäuscht. Das rührt daher, dass eine gewisse Erwartungshaltung vorlag. Niemand kann vorher wissen, dass es bloß ein einziges, wildes, kindliches Herumgehampel ist. Außerdem wird derart überzogen gestikuliert, dass man glaubt in einer pardodistischen Seifenoper gelandet zu sein. Eine Story gibt es leider nicht. Alles dreht sich nur um eine Geburtstagsparty und die erste Jugendliebe. Tiefgründigkeit fehlt nahezu komplett. Es gibt nur einen einzigen ruhigen Moment. Dabei hätte die Idee von einer Zufluchtsstätte für Monster unendlich viel Potential geboten. Wichtige Themen wie Vorurteile, Ausgrenzung, Anderssein, Akzeptanz, Verständnis usw. hätten angesprochen und vertieft werden können. Gerade für Kinder sind das bedeutende Aspekte im Umgang mit Mitmenschen und anderen Geschöpfen. Nein, stattdessen ist der Film bloß eine einzige, alberne Party. Andere Animationsfilme z. B. von Pixar beweisen doch, dass auch anspruchsvollere Filme Kindern gefallen. Selbst andere Werke von Sony Pictures Animation, die die tollen Filme "Könige der Wellen", "Jagdfieber" und "Wolkig mit Aussicht auf Fleischbällchen" herausgebracht haben, beiweisen, dass sie es besser können. Schade!  Die Synchronstimmen ärgern gewaltig. Bis auf zwei Nebenfiguren sind unüberhörbar amateurhafte Promis und andere Anfänger genommen worden, was dementsprechend passabel bis mies klingt. Die Stimme des Grafen Dracula ist neben der seiner Tochter die Schlimmste. Dialoge sind wegen seiner Nuschelei oft schwer zu verstehen.  Wirklich klasse sind nicht nur die vielen kreativen Ideen, auch die unzähligen Film- und Alltagszitate sowie Wortspiele, die nur Erwachsene verstehen können. Selbst "Ratatouille" wird zitiert! Highlight ist ganz klar die gesamte Flugzeugszene. Das macht richtig Laune. Ich frage mich aber wirklich, warum derart viel für Erwachsene zitiert wird, wo der Film doch auf Kinder abzielt. Wahrscheinlich wollte er beide bedienen, schafft dies aber nicht. Erwachsene haben an dem kindlichen, völlig überzogenen Party-Herumgealber wahrscheinlich weniger Spaß. Manchmal schämt man sich richtig fremd!  --------------------------------  Fazit: Trotz der vielen Zitate und Einfälle ist "Hotel Transsilavnien" nichts für Erwachsene oder Jugendliche. Eine Story existiert nicht, Potential wird verschenkt und die miesen Synchronstimmen ärgern gewaltig. Zwar wird versucht beide Seiten zu bedienen, nur gelingt das nicht. Es ist ein Film für jüngere Kinder und die werden am harmlosen, oberflächlichen, albernen Partygehampel ihre helle Freude haben.rum derart viel für Erwachsene zitiert wird, wo der Film doch auf Kinder abzielt. review_body: Thought it would come as 8 separate DVD cases but actually came in 4.  Pleased with purchase.
translated_review: Thought it would come as 8 separate DVD cases but actually came in 4.  Pleased with purchase.

review_body: Der Film ist für eine Disney Produktion ziemlich untypisch düster.  Als Kind war der Film für mich einer meiner absoluten Lieblingsfilme, und das ist er immer noch. Er hat bis heute nichts von seiner Faszination verloren. Die fantastische Effekttechnik gewinnt sogar noch mehr an Charme.    Die Stars für mich sind die schön designten bösen Roboter und natürlich Maximilian Schell als den besessenen Dr. Reinhardt. Er spielt ihn sehr überzeugend diabolisch.  Seine Leibwache ist der schwebende Roboter Maximilian. Sehr interessant ist das Maximilian Schell und der Roboter denselben Namen haben, weil am Ende des Films Dr. Reinhardt und Maximilian verschmelzen.  Das lustige Design der guten Roboter passt leider nicht so ganz zu dem Rest des Films, weil dieser ja sehr kühl geworden ist. Hier scheint der einzige Anhaltspunkt einer Disney Produktion durch.  Die Musik ist genial komponiert und passt gut zu jeder Szene.    Die Bildqualität schwankt leider von Szene zu Szene zwischen gut und ausreichend. Vom Ton her kann man nicht meckern, dieser ist ordentlich gelungen.    Sehr interessant wäre auch eine Neuverfilmung des Stoffs, am besten wieder mit Maximilian Schell.    Bleibt nur zu sagen, dass dieser Film ein Science Fiktion Juwel ist und natürlich in jede Sammlung gehört.
translated_review: The film is pretty untypically gloomy for Disney production. As a child, the film was one of my absolute favorite movies for me, and he is still. He has not lost anything of his fascination until today. The fantastic effect technology even gains even more charm. The stars for me are the beautifully designed evil robots and of course Maximilian Schell as the obsessed Dr. med. Reinhardt. He plays him very convincingly Diabolic. His bodyguard is the floating robot Maximilian. Very interesting is the Maximilian Schell and the robot have the same name, because at the end of the movie Dr. Reinhardt and Maximilian merge. Unfortunately, the funny design of the good robots fits so completely to the rest of the movie because he has become very cool. Here the only clue of a Disney production seems. The music is brilliantly composed and fits well with every scene. The picture quality unfortunately fluctuates from scene to scene between good and sufficient. From the sound you can not complain, this one has succeeded. Very interesting would also be a new filming of the fabric, best again with Maximilian Schell. Remains only to say that this movie is a science fiction gem and of course belongs to any collection.

review_body: Possibly my favourite album of all time. It's impossible to say that any album is the best album ever, but this would come close.  In my opinion Metallica's best album,this album is near Metallica's perfect balance. Ride the lightning possibly has some better individual songs on their own but as an album this beats it. Unfortunately Cliff Burton's last album, his creativity can be seen here, especially in Orion.  Get this album, you'll never ever get tired of it.

Unfortunately Cliff Burton's last album, his creativity can be seen here, especially in Orion.  Get this album, you'll never ever get tired of it.

review_body: restrained, refined and restricted. The musicians are of a high calibre but they sound like they are playing under strict instructions to be reverential and not too excited. Very little dynamic range is shown throughout. Guest vocals sound like a 'chat show' selection. Norah Jones follows Joni's inflections and Tina Turner throttles back her voice. if you haven't got them already, hunt out the originals. This does little to enhance or develop the original work.  Leonard Cohen's overblown and pompous oration on 'The Jungle Line' is laugh-out-loud ludicrous.   An album less than the sum of its parts.

review_headline: Die erste Regel: "Rede niemals über den 'Fight Club'...
review_body:
Also als ich von dem Film hörte, habe ich mich gefragt: \"Hey? Habe ich da wirklich einen Kultfilm im Kino verpasst\" Aber als der Film bei uns in der Gegend in den Kinos lief war der Hype noch gar nicht so groß. Erst die vielen privaten \"Filmabende im kleineren Kreis\" haben den Film zum Kult gemacht! Also habe ich mir den Film ausgeliehen und angeschaut. Nachdem mir mehrmals ein Kribbeln über den Rücken gelaufen war und der Film dann sein furioses Ende hatte, habe ich mich wieder etwas gefragt:
\"WAS zum Teufel war das jetzt\"
Also. Film nochmal eingeworfen und nochmal geschaut! Erst beim zweiten oder dritten Mal kapiert man die volle Tragweite dieses Films und wenn man den Ausgang des Films kennt, sieht man den ganzen Film und jede einzelne Szene mit ganz anderen Augen! So etwas in dieser Form hatte ich zuvor noch nie erlebt. Also wer beim ersten mal enttäuscht sein sollte (kaum vorstellbar).
NOCHMAL SCHAUEN ! Die schauspielerische Leistung von Brad Pitt und Edward Norton haut einen echt vom Hocker! Insbesondere Edward Norton hat hier sein volles Können ausgespielt. Wenn man ihn sieht, mit zerschlagenem Gesicht und dieser absolut grimmigen Mimik, dann muß einem ein Schauer den Rücken runter laufen. Brad Pitt als \"Gründer\" des Fight Club ist einfach nur klasse! Ein Hauch von Diabolik und Verschlagenheit und ab der Mitte des Films die Gewissheit, daß da noch mehr kommen MUSS, daß irgendein völlig abgedrehter Plan im Hintergrund läuft. Zur Story will ich nichts schreiben, denn.

review_body: One of the best suspense/thriller novels that I have ever read.  This book is gripping, enthralling, exciting & narrated in a very clever, intertwining way.  I hate using cliches but this is one of the very few, genuine 'page turners' that I have come across: read in one afternoon, I couldn't put it down, I just had to get to the next stage. If you can match this again, Paula, I look forward to your next book.
translated_review: One of the best suspense/thriller novels that I have ever read.  This book is gripping, enthralling, exciting & narrated in a very clever, intertwining way.  I hate using cliches but this is one of the very few, genuine 'page turners' that I have come across: read in one afternoon, I couldn't put it down, I just had to get to the next stage. If you can match this again, Paula, I look forward to your next book.

review_body: I couldn't put this book down. JK Rowling's brilliantly descriptive language and deep understanding of people, their motives, feelings and the human psyche had me absolutely gripped from the start.  This is not a book with a happy ending but it portrays and honest picture of how parts of modern society exist and there is a beauty in that.

This is not a book with a happy ending but it portrays and honest picture of how parts of modern society exist and there is a beauty in that.

product_title: Ultimate Hits: Rock and Roll Never Forgets
review_body: Klar hat Bog Seeger eine Menge Songs geschrieben, die auf dieser Zusammenstellung Ihren Platz verdient gehabt hätten und es dann doch nicht geschafft haben. Das man es nicht allen Recht machen kann, ist auch völlig klar. Aber das ausgerechnet das überragende \"The Fire Inside\" fehlt, ist für mich völlig unverständlich und nicht zu verzeihen. Alleine aus diesem Grund gebe ich 2 Punkte Abzug! Ớbwohl ich die \"Greatest Hits 1 + 2\" besitze, hätte ich mir ansonsten diese Doppel-CD gegönnt. Aber so? Kann ich gut darauf verzichten!
translated_review: Of course, Bog Seeger wrote a lot of songs that had earned their place on this compilation and then did not make it.That you can not do it all right, is also completely clear.But that does not miss the outstanding \ "The Fire Inside \", is completely incomprehensible to me, not to forgive me.Alone for this reason I give 2 points withdrawal!Although I have the \ "Greatest Hits 1 + 2 \", I would otherwise considered this double CD.But as?I can do without it!

Im not a massive fan of t-pain but he suits this track and complements Kanye's style. Once again Kanye you did the business and buried the competition, although 50's album is ok its not a patch on this album, enjoy.

product_title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage Of Harold Fry
review_body: The first thing I fell I should point out is that this isn't my usual \"type\" of read I purchased it based on all the fab reviews it had.  For me, this is an ok read nothing more,  I found it quite predictable and part-way through it seemed to lose its way and I really wondered how anyone could give it 5 stars! But it did get back on track and I happily read on.  Its a lovely plodding book, nothing really happens in it and its more of a long short story than a novel in my opinion but please don't be put off its a nice curl up on the sofa book that you can pick up and put down and not really have to think too mch about what happened on the previous page!

For me, this is an ok read nothing more,  I found it quite predictable and part-way through it seemed to lose its way and I really wondered how anyone could give it 5 stars! review_body: Lorsque j'ai acheté ce dessin animé, je ne le connaissais pas, je ne l'avais jamais vu avant mon achat. Je peux dire que je n'ai pas été déçu. Film d'animation ayant comme morale le respect de la nature et plus précisément le respect des fourmis car elle explique d'un point de vue très basique la vie hiérarchique de ces insectes ainsi que leurs intelligences. Tout cela est bien beau mais si autant le nid de fourmi se trouve dans notre jardin et que cela ne nous dérange pas, cela diffère lorsque le nid se trouve dans notre maison. Que faire pour les chasser au lieu de les tuer.Soit, même si c'est bien entendu de la fiction de communiquer avec les fourmis, cela reste tout de même un dessin animé agréable pour la famille.    D'un point de vue technique Blu-ray : L'image est superbe, d'ailleurs que dire, on est rarement déçu d'un film d'animation 3D en image de synthèse sur le support blu-ray par contre au niveau son on peut regretter l'absence de la piste DTS. Le son est principalement du Dolby Digital si ce n'est qu'une piste PCM en anglais. C'est la raison pour laquelle j'ai mis 4 étoiles sur  5.
translated_review: When I bought this cartoon, I did not know him, I had never seen him before my purchase. I can say that I was not disappointed. Animation film having as morality respect for nature and more precisely respect for ants because it explains from a very basic point of view the hierarchical life of these insects as well as their intelligences. All this is beautiful but if the nest of ant is in our garden and it does not bother us, it differs when the nest is in our house. What to do to hunt them instead of killing them. If it is, of course, fiction to communicate with the ants, it still remains a nice cartoon for the family. From a technical point of view Blu-ray: the image is superb, besides than saying, we are rarely disappointed with a 3D animation film in the image of synthesis on the Blu-ray support on the ground level We can regret the absence of the DTS track. The sound is mainly from Dolby Digital if only one PCM track in English. That's why I put 4 out of 5 stars.

review_headline: Can anybody write as good as George R R Martin.
review_body: I have read many books and fantasy series in my life but I have yet too read anything close to the originality and inspiration of this series. Martin is a genius who can write like nobody else, each page is is totally unpredictable and at times can make you stagger with the events that occur. With a series like A Song of Ice and Fire, how can anybody write any better.
translated_review: I have read many books and fantasy series in my life but I have yet too read anything close to the originality and inspiration of this series. Martin is a genius who can write like nobody else, each page is is totally unpredictable and at times can make you stagger with the events that occur. With a series like A Song of Ice and Fire, how can anybody write any better.

review_body: Pacino & De Niro should be a great combo. They were electric in Heat and there are some occasional moments in this latest offering where their immense talent seeps through. However the story is only so so, with a rather predictable ending.  The supporting actors are credible and the film is not completely devoid of atmosphere. Unfortunately the considerable talent of the two main protagonists is a little wasted overall.  I found myself drifting off several times through the movie. Not a good sign.

review_body: So stell ich es mir vor in Würde zu altern: ein Haus im Grünen, einen  Schaukelstuhl auf der Veranda, und Gitarre spielen können wie JJ Cale.      Sein Debütalbum \"Naturally\" enthält bereits alle Elemente des typischen Cale-Sounds - eine Mischung aus Oklahoma-Lässigkeit und der gelösten, vollkommenen Spielsicherheit eines Nashville-Studiomusikers - der sich im Laufe der Jahre zwar kaum verändert hat, aber dafür immer unverkennbar geblieben ist. Scheinbar mühelos verbindet er unterkühlten Sprechgesang, sparsame Begleit-Instrumentals und diverse Countryblues-Muster zu faszinierender Understatement-Musik. Cale's teilweise brüchige Vokals fügen sich so unauffällig in die Song-Arrangements ein, daß sie ein Teil der Instrumentierung zu sein scheinen.    Alle paar Jahre sammelte er einige hochkarätige Studiomusiker aus der Nashville-Szene um sich, um heimlich, still und leise eine Platte aufzunehmen, aus deren Songs dann andere Musiker ihr Hitpotential schöpften. Eric Clapton machte aus \"After Midnight\" und \"Cocaine\" Hits, Carlos Santana aus \"Sensitive Kind\"; Mark Knopfler von den DIRE STRAITS kopierte ihn ebenfalls erfolgreich. \"Ich hoffe daß Mark Knopfler auch mal einen meiner Songs aufnimmt, anstatt nur so zu klingen\" ist eins der wenigen Zitate die sich Cale entlocken ließ, aber ansonsten dürfte ihn die Tatsache, daß andere Musiker seinen Stil zu Geld machten, nie besonders gestört haben.     Alle seine Alben, und insbesondere diese Platte mit Songperlen wie \"Crazy Mama\", \"After Midnight\", \"Magnolia\", \"Don't go to strangers\", \"Call the doctor\" oder \"Crying Eyes\" strotzen geradezu vor Lässigkeit & Zurückgelehntheit, und sind die perfekten Begleiter für laue Sommerabende. Das Cover ist zwar trashig (man meint es könnte sich um ein Märchen-Hörspiel handeln), aber lasst euch davon nicht täuschen und kauft euch dieses Meisterwerk.
translated_review: So I imagine I agree with me: A house in the countryside, a rocking chair on the veranda, and play guitar like JJ Cale. His debut album \ "Naturally \" already contains all elements of the typical Cale sound - a mixture of Oklahoma casualness and the dissolved, perfect playfast of a Nashville studio musician - which has hardly changed over the years, but always remained unmistakable is. Apparently effortlessly, he combines supercooled speech singing, economical accompanying instrumental and various Countryblues patterns to fascinating understatement music. Cale's partly brittle vocals join so inconspicuously into the song arrangements that they seem to be part of the instrumentation. Every few years he gathered some top-class studio musicians from the Nashville scene to herself secretly to record a record, quietly and quietly, from whose songs other musicians were drawn their hit potential. Eric Clapton made out of \ "After Midnight \" and \ "Cocaine \" Hits, Carlos Santana from \ "Sensitive Child \"; Mark Knopfler from the Dire Straits also copied him successfully. "I hope Mark Knopfler also takes one of my songs, rather than sounding only like that," is one of the few quotes that elicited Cale, but otherwise the fact that other musicians made his style to money, never especially have disturbed. All his albums, and especially this plate with song beads like \ "Crazy Mama \", \ "After Midnight \", \ "Magnolia \", \ "Do not Go to Strangers \", \ "Call the Doctor \", "Crying Eyes \" strugto before resilience & rejectedness, and are the perfect companions for all-round summer evenings. Although the cover is trashy (you mean it could be a fairytale radio play), but do not be fooled by it and buy this masterpiece.

review_body: Difficile de succéder au monumental\"blood,sugar,sex,magic\"qui révéla les piments à la face du monde.encore plus quand un guitariste aussi génial que john frusciante décide de quitter le groupe,éffrayé par le succés du groupe.ajoutez à ça,les addictions diverses du groupes qui atteignent leurs apogées au sein du groupe,et vous comprendrez mieux que ce\"one hot minute\"est de trés loin l'album le plus sombre que les californiens onts sortis!L'ambiance donc,se veus plus metal que funk/rock par rapport à leurs précédentes productions,épaulé par dave navarro qui se charge à merveille de remplacer frusciante.cet album est remplis de riffs bien lourds,heavy ou tous simplement rock de chez rock,de ci-de là,vous retrouverez quelques ambiances funky\"aeroplane\",des morceaux électro-accoustiques,comme le sublime\"my friends\".qui précéde le terrible\"coffe shop\"(we can dance like iggy pop!),que suit\"pea\",morceau éxcéllent uniquement joué et chanté par flea,qui enchaine des lyrics tous plus\"poétiques\"les uns que les autres!Voilà pour les morceaux les plus connus du disque,mais le reste(13titres,62minutes de musique),n'est pas en reste,de longues narrations d'anthony en début,ou en milieu de morceaux qui ne sonts pas sans rappeller,celle d'un certain iguane.sonts absoluments prenantes et glauques!Pour conclure,je dirais ceci,cet album qui aurait pus marquer une transition dans la carriére de rhcp,est indispensable,musicalement parfait,tant au niveau des musiciens,qu'au niveau de la voie(kiedis n'a jamais crié de cette maniére sur aucun autre album du groupe!).il nous montre la facette la plus noir et heavy du groupe.et il est absolument génial!Bravo aussi pour la pochette,que n'aurait pas renié un certain korn!Pas un classique,mais culte ça c'est sur!16sur20!
translated_review: Difficult to succeed the monumental \ "Blood, Sugar, Sex, Magic \" Who revealed the peppers at the face of the world.Encore more when a guitarist as great as John frusciant decides to leave the group, fruitfully by the success of the group. To that, the various addictions of the groups that reach their climax within the group, and you will understand better than this \ "One Hot Minute \" is very far the darkest album as the Californians Onts out! The atmosphere so , even more metal than funk / rock compared to their previous productions, shoulder by Dave Navarro who takes care to wonder of replacing frusciating.This album is filled with heavy, heavy or simply rock Rock from Rock, from CI- From there, you will find some funky \ "aeroplane \" atmospheres, electro-accoustic pieces, like the sublime \ "My Friends \". who precedes the terrible \ "Coffe Shop \" (We Can Dance Like Iggy Pop!), What follows \ "PEA \", Piece Excellent only played and sung by Flea, which chains lyrics all more \ "poetics \" one that others! Here for the most famous pieces of the disc, but the rest (13tres, 62minutes of music), is not left out, long narrations of Anthony at the beginning, or in the middle pieces that do not interfere without reminding, that of a certain iguana.sonds absolutely stakeholders and glauques! To conclude, I would say this, this album that would have made a transition in the HRCP career, is indispensable, musically perfect, so much At the level of the musicians, that at the road level (Kiedis never shouted from this way to any other group album!). He shows us the most black and heavy facet of the group. It is absolutely great! Bravo also for the cover, that a certain Korn did not have denied! Not a classic, but worship it's on! 16SUR20!

product_title: Fidèle au livre et parfaitement interprêté
review_body: J'ai beaucoup aimé le film, qui d'ailleurs m'a fait découvrir Jane Austen et j'ai donc ensuite lu son livre.  Quand j'ai vu la série, j'ai comparé les personnages à ceux du film et étais un peu déçue mais finalement après avoir vu toute la série, je trouve que les personnages collent parfaitement à ceux du livre.  La série retrace à la lettre toute l'histoire, presque au mot près. Les émotions et sentiments qui agitent les deux principaux personnages sont parfaitement rendus. Colin Firth est magnifique et très séduisant en Darcy.  J'ai admiré les costumes de l'époque ainsi que les intérieurs des demeures anglaises et leurs jardins : so British !  J'ai adoré.
translated_review: I loved the movie, which made me discover Jane Austen and so I read his book.When I saw the series, I compared the characters with those of the film and was a little disappointed but finally after having seen the whole series, I find that the characters stick perfectly to those of the book.The series traces the whole story, almost at the word.The emotions and feelings that agitate the two main characters are perfectly rendered.Colin Firth is beautiful and very seductive in Darcy.I admired the costumes of the time as well as the interiors of the English mansions and their gardens: So British!I loved.

product_title: American on Purpose: The Improbable Adventures of an Unlikely Patriot
review_body: Loved this book. If you love Craig Ferguson, you will like this book a lot. He's as forthcoming, dry and irreverent as ever. You gain a lot of insight into his background, upbringing, troubles and emergence from the dark episodes of his youth with a lot of wisdom, humility and humor. I recommend it.
translated_review: Loved this book. If you love Craig Ferguson, you will like this book a lot. He's as forthcoming, dry and irreverent as ever. You gain a lot of insight into his background, upbringing, troubles and emergence from the dark episodes of his youth with a lot of wisdom, humility and humor. I recommend it.

product_title: Bad Science: Quacks, Hacks, and Big Pharma Flacks
review_body: Die ersten Kapitel, wo es um dunkle Materie und dunkle Energie geht, sind aus meiner Sicht hervorragend und beleuchten mögliche Lösungsansätze im Licht früherer Ungereimtheiten. Wenn es aber um kalte Fusion, Homöopathie und solche Dinge mit schwacher Evidenz geht, wird mir die Darstellung des Problems doch arg vage. Da bin ich mehr auf der Linie von Ben Goldacre (Bad Science), der die vorhandenen Studien zur Homöopathie gründlich ausgewertet hat und zu ganz anderen Schlüssen kommt
translated_review: The first chapters, where it comes to dark matter and dark energy, are outstanding and illuminate possible solutions in the light of former inconsistencies in my view.But when it comes to cold fusion, homeopathy and such things with weak evidence, I will be the representation of the problem arg vague.Since I am more on the line of Ben Goldacre (Bad Science), which has thoroughly evaluated the existing homeopathy studies and comes to a very different conclusion
