review_body: Ich bin schon ein Moonwalker seit ich 11 bin, also seit 7 Jahren. Michaels Musik ist einfach Zeitlos, er ist und bleibt der King und der  beste Künstler aller Zeiten. Deshalb musste ich diese Collection haben denn es sind einige Musikvideos drauf die ich noch nicht habe. Die Collection ist sehr hochwertig und schön gestaltet und beinhaltet ein Artbook das ebenfalls sehr hochwertig ist. Die Musikvideos wurden nochmal etwas Remastered, die Farben sind kräftiger und das Bild ist klarer und schärfer aber da hätte mehr gemacht werden können. Die Musikvideos sind fast alle nur in 4:3 mit balken links und rechts obwohl auf der Hülle Widescreen steht und daran lässt sich nichts ändern. Falls diese Collection nochmal vernünftig Remastered wird und auf Blu ray erscheint würde ich sie mir sofort kaufen. Dennoch kann ich diese Collection jedem Fan wie mich empfehlen.
translated_review: I am already a Moonwalker since I am 11, so for 7 years.Michael's music is simply timeless, he is and remains the King and the best artist of all time.That's why I had to have this collection because there are some music videos on it that I have not yet.The Collection is very high quality and beautifully designed and includes a style book that is also very high quality.The music videos became something remastered again, the colors are stronger and the picture is clearer and sharper but there could have been done more.The music videos are almost all only in 4: 3 with bars left and right though on the cover Widescreen stands and nothing can change.If this collection is again reasonably remastered and appears on Blu Ray I would buy it immediately.Nevertheless, I can recommend this Collection to any fan like me.

review_headline: Garner at his best - a true genius
review_body: I orginally just gave this CD a cursory listen, not expecting anything special, however I was blown away and just had to keep on listening and listening. Garner had an unbeliveable talent, both for his instrument, and the art of performance. He uses an endless variety of styles that he seamlessly flits between mid solo, from puncuating staccato of individual notes to full on orchestral rolling chords. He is truely a showman of the highest order as well, constantly generating interest and drama in the music, and creating a huge sense of fun. The recording quality is a bit dodgy, but this is quickly forgotten when listening. His other major album 'Contrasts' is also excellent, though not in quite the same league as this legendary concert.
translated_review: I orginally just gave this CD a cursory listen, not expecting anything special, however I was blown away and just had to keep on listening and listening. Garner had an unbeliveable talent, both for his instrument, and the art of performance. He uses an endless variety of styles that he seamlessly flits between mid solo, from puncuating staccato of individual notes to full on orchestral rolling chords. The recording quality is a bit dodgy, but this is quickly forgotten when listening. His other major album 'Contrasts' is also excellent, though not in quite the same league as this legendary concert.

Rob Flemming, Anfang 30, Plattenladenbesitzer, aber damit nicht gerade erfolgreich. So schlägt er sich mehr oder weniger schlecht durchs Leben. Den absoluten Tiefpunkt erreicht er, als er von seiner Freundin Laura verlassen wird.
In eine tiefe Krise fallend, versucht Rob sein Verhältnis zum weiblichen Geschlecht aufzuarbeiten. Er macht dies, indem er die Top 5 seiner ehemaligen Beziehungen der Reihe nach besucht, oder es versucht.
Nick Hornby schafft es, den Mann so darzustellen, wie er wirklich ist und nicht, wie er gerne sein will.
Absolut entlarvend und jeder Frau zu empfehlen. Supersarkastisch!

review_body: Alors là quelle surprise !  Megadeth et moi c'est l'amour de loin depuis longtemps.  Pourtant ce fut intense quand j'ai découvert \"Countdown to Extinction\", \"Rust un Peace\" ou encore \"So Far So Good\"  Ensuite, j'ai suivi le groupe pendant quelques années, mais mon intérêt allait décroissant.  Tous les derniers, même s'ils ont leur lot de bonnes chansons, me laissent assez froids, car une fois les deux trois morceaux forts passés, je n'entends que du remplissage réchauffé.    C'est donc sans grand enthousiasme que je me suis mis \"endgame\" dans les esgourdes, et la surpise fut d'autant plus forte :  ça envoie et ça rejoue ENFIN vite !  Une intro instrumentale épique, et un \"This Day we fight\" d'ouverture, qui déboule comme à la grande époque de 'Take no Prisonners' ! Plein de soli partout, de la double grosse caisse, des vocaux rageurs et des riffs purement thrash, on n'avait pas entendu ça depuis longtemps !  On revient en terrain plus connu avec 44 minutes, une mid temp mélodique bien sentie, mais dotée de rythmiques bien plombées.  1320 balance bien aussi, tandis que \"The hardest part\" nous montre une facette mélancolique de Megadeth assez originale et rarement exploitée par le groupe.  'Endgame' assure bien le spectacle elle aussi, avec une super progression, de méchants relents thrash, et 26 soli.  Enfin, Headcrusher, que tout le monde connait maintenant, est juste le titre le plus aggressif que Megadeth ait écrit depuis presque 20 ans !    Bon, passé la surprise de la patate (non pas que les précédents étaient mous, mais on sent vraiment ici plus de rage et de hargne que par le passé), le renouveau n'est pas non plus fantastique, on est en terrain connu la plupart du temps, mais le soin apporté aux mélodies et le côté moins \"écriture automatique\" des chansons que sur les derniers opus fait mouche.  Je ne sais pas ce qui a poussé Mustaine a sortir un peu de ses stéréotypes et de ses tics de composition, mais ça fait unbien fou ! Il est revenu à un format 'metal 80's' de 40 et quelques minutes, ce qui rend l'album digeste et attractif.    Evidemment les plus grands albums de Megadeth sont loin derrière eux, comme tous les titans du metal, mais je ne m'attendais pas à écouter un album de ce groupe aussi inspiré et agréable.
translated_review: So what surprise! Megadeth and I have been far away for a long time. Yet it was intense when I discovered \ "Countdown to extinction \", \ "Rust a Peace \" or \ "So Far So Good \" Then I followed the group for a few years, but my interest was going descending. All the last, even if they have their lot of good songs, leave me cold enough, because once the two three past pieces have been, I only hear from heated filling. It is therefore without great enthusiasm that I put myself \ "Endgame \" in the Esgourdes, and the surcharge was all the stronger: it sends and it finally repletes quickly! An Epic Instrumental Intro, and a "This Day We Fight" opening, which depends like at the great time of 'Take No prisoners'! Full of soil everywhere, double bass drum, reager vocals and purely thrash riffs, we had not heard that for a long time! We come back in a better known ground with 44 minutes, a very felt Mid Melodic Temp, but endowed with well-gasped rhythms. 1320 Balance good too, while \ "The Hardest Part \" shows us a melancholy facet of Megadeth pretty original and rarely exploited by the group. "Endgame 'ensures the show too, with a great progression, from wicked thrash, and 26 soli. Finally, Headcrusher, that everyone knows now, is just the most aggressive title that Megadeth has written for almost 20 years! Good, past the surprise of the potato (not that the precedents were soft, but we really feel here more rage and bend than in the past), the renewal is not fantastic either, we are in ground known the Most of the time, but the care brought to the melodies and the side less \ "automatic writing \" songs than on the last opus fly. I do not know what has pushed Mustaine to come out a bit of his stereotypes and composition tics, but it's unbien crazy! He returned to a 'Metal 80's' format of 40 and a few minutes, which makes the album digestible and attractive. Obviously the biggest albums of Megadeth are far behind them, like all the Titans of the Metal, but I did not expect to listen to this group album also inspired and enjoyable.

product_title: World War Z: An Oral History of the Zombie War
review_headline: Wanted to read it before I saw the film...
review_body: .and was blown away by the quality of the writing. I love books that use more than one character viewpoint, and this was no exception - a meticulously detailed and logical account of the inevitable zombie apocalypse. From social to political opinions, as well as some more personal storylines, this book has it all.  All I can say is, I hope this book gets a film made one day based on it's actual plot - that would be worth seeing.

I love books that use more than one character viewpoint, and this was no exception - a meticulously detailed and logical account of the inevitable zombie apocalypse. review_body:
Il ne s'agit peut être pas du meilleur Saxon. Ce n'est sans doute pas le plus mature. Mais cet album reste excellent et est devenu une référence dans le domaine du métal.
Cependant on sent que le groupe à encore du mal à se détacher de ses influences blues et motorhead, mais cela n'est pas pour nous déplaire ! Il ne s'agit donc pas de la meilleure introduction possible au monde de Saxon, mais tous les fans de hard trouveront leur compte.
translated_review:
It is not a question of the best Saxon.This is probably not the most mature.But this album remains excellent and has become a reference in the field of metal.
You feel that the group is still struggling to come off from its blues and motorhead influences, but it is not to displease us!It is therefore not the best possible introduction to the world of Saxon, but all hard fans will find their account.

product_title: Abattoir Blues / The Lyre Of Orpheus
review_body: Ok.ich weiß, ich steh' hier recht einsam mit meiner Meinung.aber, dass bin ich gewöhnt! Früher stand ich da.mit einem Tape oder einer LP von Nick Cave: \"hör' mal, das ist der Black King Of Roll, der Meister des ausgehenden Jahrhunderts\"und bin skeptisch beäugt worden. Heute sag' ich :\"handwerklich prima, sauber, fast steril(!)\".und daher für Freunde der etwas anderen, inovativen, experimentellen Musik, überflüssig gewordenes Album! Alle Alben nenne ich die meinen und sehe mit Entsetzen, mit Abattoir Blues / The Lyre Of Orpheus wird der Abwärtstrend im neuen Jahrtausend perfektioniert. Kritiker werden mir vorhalten: Cave hätte sich entwickelt.und ich wäre von gestern!-Pustekuchen.als ob er sich zwischen den frühen 80ern und späten 90ern nicht entwickelt hätte! und er hätte sich privat verändert (runter von Droge) und da sollte ich Rücksicht drauf nehmen!- Super, habe mich eh erschrocken, wie elend Cave später aussah, aber er ist Künstler.und ich nicht sein Sozialarbeiter!-und nur das bewerte ich! Die Atmosphäre, die er in früheren Alben (z.B. let love in) aufbaute und von denen seine Fans provitierten, fehlt gänzlich. Nun hatte er sich dazu noch von seinem alten Weggefährten Blixa getrennt, damit fiel ein besonders großes kreatives Potential weg, was deutlichst zu hören ist! Mein aufrichtig trauriges Resüme: Wer gut arangierte(Pop)Musik mag, wird voll auf seine Kosten kommen, wer Nick Cave für das andersARTige liebte, sollte die Finger davon lassen! Wirklich Schade, denn wer Cohen&Cash hören will, könnte auf das Original zurückgreifen (und das wäre weniger steril).für uns alte Cave-fans bleibt eine Lücke zurück!
translated_review: Ok.I knows, I'm quite lonely with my opinion. But that's what I'm used to! I used to stand there. With a tape or a LP of Nick Cave: \ "listen, that's the Black King of Roll, the Master of the Outbound Century \" and was skeptically eyed. Today I say: \ "Crafted great, clean, almost sterile (!) \". And therefore for friends of some other, inovative, experimental music, superfluously become album! All albums I call my mine and see horror, with Abattoir Blues / The Lyre of Orpheus the downward trend in the new millennium is perfected. Critics will hold me: Cave would have developed. And I would be from yesterday! -Pust cake. As if he had not developed between the early 80s and late 90s! And he would have changed privately (down drug) and there I should take care of it! - Great, I was scared of how miserably Cave looked like later, but he is artist. And I do not have his social worker! -And only Being! The atmosphere he built in earlier albums (e.g., Let Love in) and of which his fans provited is missing completely. Now he had been separated from his old companion Blixa, so that a particularly great creative potential fell away, which clearly heard! My sincere sad resumes: Anyone who likes (Pop) Music likes, will be fully on his expense, who loved Nick Cave for the other like, should keep their hands off! Really a pity, because who wants to hear Cohen & Cash, could rely on the original (and that would be less sterile). For the old Cave fans stay back a gap!

review_body: Adepte des romans policiers quand j'étais ado, j'étais un peu lassée des intrigues trop faciles ou des fins bâclées. Là, je tire mon chapeau. Absolument tout est inédit. Les idées fusent autant que les rebondissements et plongent le lecteur dans un malaise délicieux. L'auteur joue avec nos nerfs, titille notre curiosité, puis nous met sur des charbons ardents selon l'avancée de l'enquête. Qui est vraiment coupable ? On suit les indices comme des petits cailloux qui nous font changer d'avis toutes les 10 pages. Pour être honnête, la fin de la deuxième partie sonnait comme la fin de l'histoire et j'ai eu peur que la suite ne soit qu'une synthèse longuette. PAS DU TOUT. L'auteur est fourbe et ménage notre déception pour nous asséner vrai coup de massue à la fin ! Un retournement de situation menée avec brio, un choc, une révélation. Le scénario est plus complexe qu'il n'y paraît, mais expliqué avec des termes simples et une écriture fluide. Il m'a bluffée, soufflée, je me suis surprise à lâcher un "exceptionnel" à voix haute. Je suis définitivement et totalement fan de cet auteur.
translated_review: Follower of the police novels when I was teen, I was a little tired of the intrigues too easy or sluggled. There, I pull my hat. Absolutely everything is unpublished. Ideas fuse as much as the twists and plunge the reader into a delicious malaise. The author plays with our nerves, tits our curiosity, then puts us on ardent coals according to the progress of the investigation. Who is really guilty? We follow the clues like small pebbles that make us change my opinions every 10 pages. To be honest, the end of the second part belonged like the end of the story and I was afraid that the continuation is only a long sum synthesis. NOT AT ALL. The author is ants and housekeeping our disappointment to worry true shot at the end! A rollover with brilliance, a shock, a revelation. The scenario is more complex than it seems, but explained with simple terms and fluid writing. He bluffed me, blown, I surprised myself to let go "exceptional" aloud. I am definitely and totally fan of this author.

review_body: For those who love Maria Callas, this superb collection is a must. It sets out all her recordings in chronological order which one can compare as her career developed. The full opera recordings are all very fine,and the collections of arias are superb - some of which I was not aware of before. The booklet notes by Tony Locantro are excellent, perceptive and well written. The presentation of the box set is excellent. It is obviously a labour of love by those in EMI who know and appreciate her music. We are very lucky this superb collection exists.
translated_review: For those who love Maria Callas, this superb collection is a must. It sets out all her recordings in chronological order which one can compare as her career developed. The full opera recordings are all very fine,and the collections of arias are superb - some of which I was not aware of before. The booklet notes by Tony Locantro are excellent, perceptive and well written. The presentation of the box set is excellent. It is obviously a labour of love by those in EMI who know and appreciate her music. We are very lucky this superb collection exists.

review_body: Rappel des faits : à la fin des années 1970 et au début des années 1980, Decca, l'Orchestre philharmonique de Vienne et Charles Mackerras s'associent pour enregistrer les cinq principaux opéras de Leos Janacek, cinq chefs-d'œuvre de l'art lyrique du vingtième siècle. Dans les cinq cas, la réussite est éclatante au point de se placer à chaque fois aux tout premiers rangs de la discographie. La maîtrise du chef, l'aisance de l'orchestre, la beauté sonore, ainsi que l'excellence des solistes, parmi lesquels il convient de distinguer Elisabeth Söderström (Jenufa, Katia, Marty), Lucia Popp (Renarde), Dalibor Jedlicka ou encore Petr Dvorsky, sont confondantes. Il est à peine utile de détailler les immenses mérites et les infimes carences de chaque opéra (d'autant que la concurrence est tout sauf abondante), alors quand ils sont réunis en un seul coffret.
translated_review: Recall of the facts: In the late 1970s and in the early 1980s, Decca, the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra and Charles Macerras team up to register the top five Leos Janacek operas, five masterpieces of theLyrical art of the twentieth century.In the five cases, success is brilliant to the point of being able to place each time at the very first ranks of the discography.The control of the chief, the ease of the orchestra, the sound beauty, as well as the excellence of the soloists, among whom it is necessary to distinguish Elisabeth Söderström (Jenufa, Katia, Marty), Lucia Popp (VIENARD), Dalibor Jedlicka orStill Petr Dvorsky, are confusing.It is barely useful to detail the immense merits and the tiny deficiencies of each opera (especially since the competition is anything but abundant), then when they are gathered in a single box.

product_title: The Good Earth (Contemporary Classics (Washington Square Press))
review_headline: The Good Earth: Lives filled with tragedies and triumphs
review_body: Buck takes the reader back in time to another country where she traces the life of a peasant farmer named Wang Lung.  The scene is the northern part of China during the nineteenth century; emperors have lived in the  Forbidden City for centuries and have ruled over an agrarian society that  has existed longer than the dynasties.  The book opens with the wedding day  of Wang Lung.  From the beginning, the reader is introduced to the various  Confucian customs that have kept the country stable for over a millennium.   Buck, however, also examines the deleterious effects of Confucianism in the  form of government corruption, the enslavement of women, and in the form of  the exploitation of peasants by and the decadence of the powerful  landed-gentry families.    This novel rightly deserves its name as Wang  Lung's livelihood and that of many of his countrymen depend on agriculture.   Up to Wang Lung's time the Chinese civilization rested on the backs and  shoulders of farmers, who provided the basic necessity for life.  Small,  farming families like that of Wang Lung's have lived and cultivated their  lands for generations.  Their lives are simple, with practicality being  their primary concern; although Wang Lung hopes his wife-to-be isn't  physically deformed, he wants a woman who can work in the fields, cook, and  rear children.  The women of the cities are not for him because he is a  lowly farmer and because they live a luxurious life.    The title of the  novel also refers to O-lan.  Although O-lan rarely speaks, is formerly a  lowly kitchen maid of a wealthy landed family, and is unattractive, she  remains loyal to her husband and sacrifices for her family during times of  hardship and prosperity.  From her former life, she is knowledgeable about  the habits of the wealthy and can easily indulge herself during the latter  times.  However, it is Wang Lung who succumbs to the desires that afflict  the wealthy, whilst O-lan remains faithful to the simplelifestyle of a  farmer.    It is hard to denounce Wang Lung.  He is the product of his  environment.  He remains faithful to the Confucian ethic despite being  exploited by relatives.  He doesn't regard O-lan highly as a woman or as a  person but he doesn't abuse her either.  He shows sympathy to his children  by allowing his sons to acquire a Confucian education in the hope that they  may someday obtain a government position.  And when he becomes a wealthy  landowner, he yields to temptations of the flesh and of material wealth.   However, no matter how far he strays, Wang Lung does not forget that his  life and that of his family are ultimately rooted in the productiveness of  his fields.    The Good Earth is a masterpiece.  Covering a period  between the partition of China by the West and the republican era, Buck  weaves into her novel China's political and social upheavals and how these  dramatic changes aid and hinder the life of Wang Lung, culminating in her  foreshadowing of the demise of the Lung estate.

review_body: Ca avait l'air étrange, et ça l'est dès les premières minutes lors de la présentation des mousquetaires. Les combats à l'épée ne sont pas réalisés par des radins et font vraiment plaisir à voir. L'histoire est un mélange du roman avec des idées nouvelles. Quelle idée d'avoir descendu un film aussi généreux parce qu'il introduit une dose de fantastique dans une histoire adaptée d'un roman. Il existe déjà d'autres adaptations sympathiques des trois mousquetaires et celle-ci est juste différente. Les acteurs s'éclatent tous et nous aussi. Le boitier du Blu-Ray est à l'image du film : un peu bizarre mais avec la volonté de faire quelque chose de différent.
translated_review: It looked strange, and it is in the first minutes when the musketeers presentation.The sword fights are not realized by radins and really enjoy see.The story is a mix of the novel with new ideas.What an idea of getting down a movie as generous because it introduces a dose of fantastic in a suitable story of a novel.There are already other sympathetic adaptations of the three musketeers and this is just different.The actors disappear all and us too.The Blu-ray case is like the movie: a little weird but with the will to do something different.

review_body: This has to be by far the best Pink Floyd album ever, closely followed by Momentary Lapse of Reason. It ceratinly goes to show that PF don't need Walters; in fact they are better without him. I think that in the past far too much emphasis has been given to his input when in actual fact Gilmour is at least as responsible for the overall PF sound. Thankfully, RW has gone and Dave Gilmour is left to take PF to another level.  The song writing is excellent - good meaningful lyrics with a true Floyd edge to them (check out the title track in particular). None of the rubbish lyrics that mar albums such as Piper at the Gates of Dawn. The music, particularly Gilmour's guitar work, is sublime, rolling you along from track to track and ultimately leaving you breathless but wanting more. All in all this is an album that no \"true\" Pink Floyd fan should be without.
translated_review: This has to be by far the best Pink Floyd album ever, closely followed by Momentary Lapse of Reason. It ceratinly goes to show that PF don't need Walters; in fact they are better without him. I think that in the past far too much emphasis has been given to his input when in actual fact Gilmour is at least as responsible for the overall PF sound. Thankfully, RW has gone and Dave Gilmour is left to take PF to another level.  The song writing is excellent - good meaningful lyrics with a true Floyd edge to them (check out the title track in particular). None of the rubbish lyrics that mar albums such as Piper at the Gates of Dawn. The music, particularly Gilmour's guitar work, is sublime, rolling you along from track to track and ultimately leaving you breathless but wanting more. All in all this is an album that no \"true\" Pink Floyd fan should be without.

review_body: Fairport's third album was released in 1969 only a few months after `What we did on our Holidays.' It sees Sandy Denny, Richard Thompson et al joined for the first time by long-term fairporter Dave Swarbrick on violin.  The overall sound is essentially similar to that of WWdooH: a melding of re-visited English folk songs with some fine self-penned compositions by Denny and Thompson in the folk idiom, and a couple of Bob Dylan covers thrown in for good measure.  Some of these songs would have been at home on the follow-up and genre-defining `Liege and Lief': the opener `Genesis Hall' is one such, `A Sailor's Life' is another (though the `tail' of this song is maybe too long for a studio album), and Sandy Denny's singing on `Who knows where the Time goes?' is one of the band's career-defining moments and without doubt the highlight of the collection.  `Unhalfbricking' (did any album of music ever have a more quirky title?) is one of only three Fairport albums to have Denny singing, all of which were released in 1969. In some ways it's the weakest of the three because it lacks a coherent theme, but contains a couple of gems - especially the aforementioned `Who knows where the Time goes?' Though uneven, this album wears the years well because the music itself doesn't sound like anything else in popular music from the 60s/70s era, but has a timeless quality.
translated_review: Fairport's third album was released in 1969 only a few months after `What we did on our Holidays.' It sees Sandy Denny, Richard Thompson et al joined for the first time by long-term fairporter Dave Swarbrick on violin.  The overall sound is essentially similar to that of WWdooH: a melding of re-visited English folk songs with some fine self-penned compositions by Denny and Thompson in the folk idiom, and a couple of Bob Dylan covers thrown in for good measure.  Some of these songs would have been at home on the follow-up and genre-defining `Liege and Lief': the opener `Genesis Hall' is one such, `A Sailor's Life' is another (though the `tail' of this song is maybe too long for a studio album), and Sandy Denny's singing on `Who knows where the Time goes?' is one of the band's career-defining moments and without doubt the highlight of the collection.  `Unhalfbricking' (did any album of music ever have a more quirky title?) is one of only three Fairport albums to have Denny singing, all of which were released in 1969. In some ways it's the weakest of the three because it lacks a coherent theme, but contains a couple of gems - especially the aforementioned `Who knows where the Time goes?' Though uneven, this album wears the years well because the music itself doesn't sound like anything else in popular music from the 60s/70s era, but has a timeless quality.

product_title: Intel 7260.HMWWB.R Dual Band Wireless-AC 7260-PCIe WLAN / 802.11AC, Bluetooth 4.0 Mini-PCI-Karten
review_body: Einbau und Treiber waren in einem fujitsu S710 kinderleicht. Nachdem ich vor Einbau die Intel Software aktualisierte, ging das Wlan nach Neueingabe des Keys problemlos und auch Bluetooth war sofort verfügbar. Tipp:  Intel detect utility vor Einbau runterladen, nach Einbau bei Problemen ans LAN und mit dem utility aktualisieren. Wenn möglich auf der Karte ( falls der Router das kann) 5ghz bevorzugt einstellen.
translated_review: Installation and drivers were easy in a Fujitsu S710.After I updated the Intel Software before installation, the Wi-Fi went to the new entry of the Keys easily and Bluetooth was immediately available.Tip: Download Intel Detect Utility before installing, after installation on problems on the LAN and update the Utility.If possible on the card (if the router that can) adjust 5GHz preferred.

review_headline: It's a long way to the top....
review_body: .if you wanna Rock and Roll!    Der Film an sich ist ja für jeden Liebhaber der Rockmusik, egal, welchen Genres, ein Muss.    Der Soundtrack wartet mit einer kleinen Abhandlung der verschiedenen Stadien des Rock auf.  Von den Siebzigern bis zur Neuzeit macht das Album eine kleine Zeitreise, ähnlich so, wie die Kids im Film Stück für Stück einen Schritt weiter gehen, bis sie schließlich ihrern eigenen Stil finden.    Es sind ein paar Leckerbissen darauf, vom \"Immigrant-Song\" von LedZeppelin bis zu \"Growing on me\" von The Darkness und nicht zu vergessen die mit den Kids eingespielten Songs! Wobei man anmerken muss, dass die Kids aus dem Film tatsächlich ihre Instrumente selber spielen. Und die ham's echt verdammt drauf.  Wirklich bemerkenswert!    Toller Soundtrack, aber auch empfehlenswert für die, die den Film gar nicht kennen.    Um als eingefleischter AC/DC Fan noch ein Schluss-Zitat zu bringen:    For those about to rock:    I SALUTE YOU ! ! ! !
translated_review: .if You Wanna Rock and Roll!The film itself is for every lover of rock music, no matter which genres, a must.The soundtrack is waiting with a small treatise of the different stages of the skirt.From the seventies to modern times, the album makes a little time travel, similarly as the kids in the movie go a step further, until they finally find their own style.There are a few treats on it, from the "Immigrant Song \" from Ledzeppelin to \ "Growing on me \" by the Darkness and not to forget the songs introduced with the kids!Whereby one must say that the kids from the film actually play their own instruments.And the ham's really damn it.Really remarkable!Great soundtrack, but also recommended for those who do not know the movie.To bring a final quote as a diehard AC / DC fan: for Those About To Rock: I Salute You!Being!Being!Being!

The other tracks she sings more normally but always differently than in the 1st album, it is more arguing less young and pass everywhere more Star. review_body: Voilà une très jolie histoire, à voir et à revoir. Pleine  de tendresse et  d'émotion. Ce film aborde le sujet de l'homosexualité tout en douceur, à l'image du premier câlin de Zach et Shaun,  mais aussi les problèmes de famille, d'enfant,  de responsabilités.  Zach est touchant à la fois si jeune et si mûr, à prendre soin de son père malade, de son irresponsable et égoïste sœur (que vous allez adorer détester !) ,  et de son adorable neveux Cody. Pas facile de tracer son chemin et décider de son avenir quand tant de chaînes vous retiennent. Le personnage de Shaun est un peu plus en retrait, mais il est craquant. Bref, un joli film, plein de lumière, un happy end comme on en rêve, et une superbe bande son. 4,5/5
translated_review: This is a very nice story, seeing and seeing again.Full of tenderness and emotion.This film addresses the subject of even smooth homosexuality, like the first hug of Zach and Shaun, but also the problems of family, children, responsibilities.Zach is touching at once so young and so ripe, to take care of his sick father, his irresponsible and sister selfish (that you will love to hate!), And his adorable nephew cody.Not easy to trace his way and decide on his future when so many channels hold you.The character of Shaun is a little more down, but he is cute.In short, a nice film, full of light, a happy end as one dreams, and a superb soundtrack.4.5 / 5

product_title: Harry Potter Boxed Set. Adult Edition. 7 Volumes
review_body: Die Rezension bezieht sich auf die 7 Taschenbücher - englisch, Erwachsenenausgabe, Sammelbox. Zum Inhalt muss nichts mehr gesagt werden, da bin ich mir sicher ;-)  Die Box ist optisch sehr schön, bietet mehr als genug Platz für die enthaltenen Bücher und enthält die britische Ớriginalausgabe. Was mich stört, sind die Bücher selbst. Sehr billiges, dünnes Papier, ein Geruch nach Chemie (vllt der Kleber?)usw. Der erste Band sieht nach dem ersten Lesen schon \"eindeutig gelesen\" aus. Dabei handelt es sich dabei um den dünnsten Band und ich möchte mir kaum vorstellen, wie \"The Ớrder of the Phoenix\" später aussieht.  Ich habe die Box bei einem anderen Anbieter für 50€ gekauft, mehr ist sie meiner Meinung nach auch nicht wert. Die bei Amazon fälligen 86€ wären zuviel gewesen und ich hätte die Box nach der ersten Ansicht der Bücher wieder zurück gegeben.
translated_review: The review refers to the 7 bags - English, adult edition, collecting box.The content does not have to be said, because I'm sure ;-) The box is visually very beautiful, offers more than enough space for the contained bergen and containing the British ớriginal issue.What me is, are the books themselves. Very cheap, dinnes paper, a smell of chemistry (maybe the adhesive?) Etc.The first volume looks after the first reading already \ "clearly read \".These are the dungal band and I can hardly imagine how \ "The ớrder of the Phoenix" looks like a spurt.I bought the box with another supplier for 50 €, more is not she worth in my opinion.The available at Amazon for 86 € www.umbles, and I added the box to the first view of the beterm again.

product_title: The Luck Factor: The Scientific Study of the Lucky Mind
review_body: I think this is an interesting study on luck, what part it may play in one's life, and whether one can become more lucky. It was easy to read, and seemed to be backed up by serious psychological studies published by Richard Wiseman and others. Afterwards I bought a couple of other books by Richard Wiseman, so this is an indication of the interest/quality of his writing. I would definitely recommend this book if this subject interests you.
translated_review: I think this is an interesting study on luck, what part it may play in one's life, and whether one can become more lucky. It was easy to read, and seemed to be backed up by serious psychological studies published by Richard Wiseman and others. Afterwards I bought a couple of other books by Richard Wiseman, so this is an indication of the interest/quality of his writing. I would definitely recommend this book if this subject interests you.

review_body: Ich habe mir den Film trotz der schlechten Kritiken, die dieser von Anfang an bekommen hat, angesehen. Bin durchaus eher überrascht. Mag nicht der beste Film sein, aber fand ich durchaus gut. Sehr schön geschnitten der Film, obwohl vielleicht mit den Animationen ein bisschen übertrieben wurde. Aber schön gemacht mit den Rückblenden, um die Beziehung zwischen Vater und Sohn zu erklären. Zudem recht kurzlebig. Will Smith hat mich dieses Mal in der Rolle nicht überzeugt, aber sein Sohn Jaiden hingegen war sehr gut, wie ich finde. Durchaus empfehlenswert.
translated_review: I looked at the film despite the bad reviews that he got from the beginning.Am quite rather surprised.Do not like the best movie, but I found quite well.Very nice cut the movie, although perhaps a bit exaggerated with the animations.But beautiful with the flashbacks to explain the relationship between father and son.In addition, quite short-lived.Will Smith did not convince me this time in the role, but his son Jaiden, however, was very good as I find.Well recommended.

review_body: Fan de Richard Matheson, j'avais, comme chaque fois en ce cas, quelques réticences à découvrir cette adaptation de ce classique de la littérature  fantastique. Or, bonne surprise, le film est globalement réussi et propose un vrai bon moment de cinéma à condition, comme chaque fois, d'oublier le livre.  Les séquences sont certes inégales et on aurait aimé (comme le disent d'autres amazonautes critiques) que le film dure un peu plus. Mais certaines scènes sont d'anthologie, et foutent la frousse sans jamais tomber dans le gore.   Will Smith est parfait, comme d'habitude. Une énorme présence à l'écran, une vraie finesse dans l'expression.  Bref, de \"l'entertainment\" digne et regardable. C'est assez rare pour être signalé. Ne nous en privons pas.

Die Songs laufen in meinem MP3 Player rauf und runter. Die Songs sind einfühlsam und zugleich kraftvoll. Adele hat eine wahnsinns Stimme, und die setzt sie eindrucksvoll bei jedem Track ein. Wir werden vermutlich noch mehr tolle Songs von ihr bekommen. Mir gefallen besonders die Tracks \"I'll be Waiting\" und \"Set Fire to the Rain\". Aber überzeugt euch doch selbst. :-)

review_headline: Chopin : 19 Nocturnes - The Rubinstein Collection, vol.49
review_body: Bien que les Nocturnes ne soient pas les compositions de prédilection des grands interprètes, certains enregistrements, comme ceux de Claudio Arrau , Vlado Perlemutter ou encore Maurizio Pollini sont à relever pour la diversité qu'ils offrent dans l’interprétation : Arrau pour la profondeur et l’introspection à laquelle il se plie systématiquement, Perlemutter pour le raffinement classique, et Pollini pour la précision d’exécution. Arthur Rubinstein reste une référence car il ne fait qu'un avec son instrument.Plus intéressante encore est l’interprétation de Vladimir Horowitz mais la qualité des enregistrements (restitution) est plus discutable (où alors il faut revenir au vynil). Cet enregistrement produit par Sony/BMGG est tout en souplesse avec un brin de souffle qu'un ampli à tube gommera ! Pour les concertos n°1et n°2 j'ai une préférence pour Krystian Zimerman et l'enregistrement proposé par la Deutsche Grammophon (édition 2003).
translated_review: Although nocturnes are not the predilection compositions of the great performers, some recordings, such as those of Claudio Arrau, Vlado Perlemutter or Maurizio Pollini are to be found for the diversity they offer in the interpretation: Arrau for depth andThe introspection to which it folds systematically, perlemutter for conventional refinement, and pollini for execution accuracy.Arthur Rubinstein remains a reference because it only makes one with its instrument.More interesting still is the interpretation of Vladimir Horowitz but the quality of the recordings (restitution) is more debatable (where then you have to return to the vynil).This recording produced by Sony / BMGG is flexible with a bit of breath that a Gommera tube amp!For concertos No. 1 and N ° 2 I have a preference for Krystian Zimerman and the registration proposed by Deutsche Grammophon (2003 edition).

review_body: Cet album acquis il y a quelques années, me fait toujours le même effet : cette voix, grave, profonde, à la fois caverneuse et veloutée. ce n'est pas seulement l'ouie qui est flattée, mais une vibration qui chatouille les sens et réveille l'amoureuse qui sommeille en chacune de nous ! Ce n'est pas pour son physique que j'appréciais cet artiste, trop tôt disparu, mais pour cette voix reconnaissable dès les premières notes. pour moi, il manque une 6è étoile à ce classement !

review_body: Après leur brillant premier album de blues décharné incroyable d'intensité (\"Keep On Your Mean Side\") le duo Hotel/VV revient avec un \"No Wow\" encore plus sombre et engagé. Comparés sans imagination aux White Stripes, autre duo blues-rock, en 2003 les Kills de 2005 évoluent dans un registre différent comme tend à prouver cet excellent album qui affirme un \"son\" Kills. Les guitares saturées et l'ambiance claustrophobe - due à l'aspect tribal des chansons aux paroles répétées avec insistance - trahissent l'admiration du duo pour le Velvet Underground de \"White Light/White Heat\". D'autre part, les Kills poussent les limites de leur formation (guitare/voix/boite à rythmes) dans leurs derniers retranchements.ceux qui les ont vu sur scène ont pu être surpris, voire déçus, de la présence de beats pré-enregistrés; les Kills en font ici une arme, leur atout principal. On sent poindre l'influence de la musique électronique des années 70 - Kraftwerk, Moroder - dans la rythmique cheap de morceaux comme No Wow, Love Is A Deserter, The Good Ones - les meilleurs de l'album. En 40 minutes les Kills réussissent à convaincre sans se compromettre, confirmant leur extraordinaire potentiel, et, mieux encore, se construisent une identité. Hotel, guitar héro minimaliste, et VV, chanteuse au charisme extraordinaire, entrent dans la cour des grands. No Wow, grand album de 2005.
translated_review: After their brilliant album of glowing blues incredible intensity (\ "Keep on your mean side \") The duo Hotel / VV returns with a \ "no wow \" even darker and engaged. Compared without imagination at White Stripes, Other Duo Blues-Rock, in 2003 Kills 2005 evolve in a different register as tends to prove this excellent album that affirms a \ "sound \" kills. Saturated guitars and claustrophobe atmosphere - due to the tribal appearance of songs to repeated lyrics with insistence - betray the admiration of the duo for the Velvet Underground of \ "White Light / White Heat \". On the other hand, the kills push the limits of their training (guitar / voice / box) in their last entrenches.Ceux who saw them on stage could be surprised or even disappointed with the presence of pre-recorded Beats ; The kills make it a weapon here, their main asset. We feel the influence of electronic music from the 70s - Kraftwerk, Moroder - in the cheap rhythm of pieces like no wow, love is a deerter, the good ones - the best of the album. In 40 minutes the Kills manage to convince without compromising, confirming their extraordinary potential, and, better yet, are built an identity. Hotel, Guitar Héro Minimalist, and VV, singer with extraordinary charisma, enter the great courtyard. No Wow, 2005 Big Album.

product_title: Senna - Genie, Draufgänger, Legende [Special Edition] [2 DVDs]
review_headline: Ayrton Senna - herausragender Rennfahrer und Mensch
review_body: In diesem Jahr nähert sich der Todestag von Ayrton Senna bereits zum 20 Mal und ich habe die Szenen vom 1. Mai 1994 immer noch im Kopf, als wären sie gestern gewesen. Der Film ist daher ein klasse Werk, um das Leben dieses außergewöhnlichen Rennfahrers und Menschen, der neben der Strecke auch viel für sein Land Brasilien getan hat, nochmal zu würdigen. Klar wird im Film hauptsächlich auf seine Rivalität zu Alain Prost eingegangen und Personen wie Nigel Mansell, Gerhard Berger und Michael Schumacher werden nicht, oder nur zum Teil erwähnt, aber sein Duell gegen Prost war nun mal das Duell schlechthin zu Ende der 80er, bzw. zu Beginn der 90er Jahre. Richtig gut rausgestellt wird, welche Bedeutung Sennas Tod für die Formel 1, aber auch für die Menschen in seiner Heimat Brasilien hatte, denn wie schon vorab erwähnt, er war nicht nur der beste Rennfahrer seiner Zeit, er war auch ein Identifikationsfigur für viele Brasilianer. In diesem Sinne, unbedingte Kaufempfehlung und das nicht nur zwingend für Senna, oder Formel 1 Fans. Die Legende Ayrton Senna wird immer weiterleben!
translated_review: This year, the death day of Ayrton Senna is already approaching 20 times and I still have the scenes from 1 May 1994 in mind, as if they had been yesterday. The film is therefore a class work to honor the life of this extraordinary race driver and people who have done next to the route a lot for his land of Brazil. Of course, in the film, mainly on its rivalry to Alain Prost, and people like Nigel Mansell, Gerhard Berger and Michael Schumacher are not mentioned, or only partially mentioned, but his duel against Prost was now the duel at the end of the 80s, or At the beginning of the 90s. It is really well out which importance Senna's death for Formula 1, but also for the people in his homeland of Brazil had, because as mentioned in advance, he was not only the best racing driver of his time, he was also an identification figure for many Brazilians. In this sense, unconditional purchase recommendation and not only mandatory for Senna, or Formula 1 fans. The legend Ayrton Senna will always live on!

product_title: Greatest Hits Volume I & Volume II
review_body: This collection really is fantastic.  I really don't understand why Billy Joel isn't given the critical acclaim he so obviously deserves.  His songs have everything.  Ballads: Just The Way You Are, Honesty; Excellent melodies: My Life, The Longest Time; Heartfelt lyrics: Captain Jack, Allentown.   He's a great singer, songwriter and pianist too!  Perhaps one day he'll get the respect he's due, but in the mean time buy this collection.  It will open your eyes to a true American talent from the last century.

Auch in der digitalen Welt war anno 2006 Schluss, NFS Carbon und Import Tuner Challenge, sowie das F&F-Videospiel sind gewissermaßen auch hier der Abschluss, etwa zeitgleich zu Toyko Drift eben. Hier endet gewissermaßen das, was F&F für mich immer auszeichnete: Straßenphilosophie.

product_title: The Take Off And Landing Of Everything
review_body: Diese CD zu beurteilen, sollte einem jedem wirklich selbst überlassen sein. Ich für meinen Teil bin überwältigt, da Elbow es immer wieder schaffen, sich bei maximaler Weiterentwicklung absolut treu zu bleiben. Wer sehr anspruchsvolle Rock-Pop-Musik mit großen progressiven Anteilen so gefühlvoll und spannend umsetzt, ohne dabei dem Stadionpomp (siehe leider Coldplay) zu verfallen, verdient größten Respekt! Dass sie in England Superstars sind und große Hallen füllen, wundert mich nicht. Dass sie hier in relativ kleinen Clubs/Hallen spielen (von Festivals mal abgesehen) wundert mich auch nicht, kann aber gerne so bleiben!
translated_review: To judge this CD should really be left to anyone.I am overwhelmed for my part, as Elbow creates it again and again to remain completely faithful at maximum development.If you are very sophisticated rock pop music with big progressive proportions as soulful and exciting, without falling to the stadium pomp (see unfortunately coldplay) deserves great respect!That they are superstars in England and fill great halls, not surprises me.That you play here in relatively small clubs / halls (apart from festivals times) does not surprise me either, but you can stay that way!

review_body: The old expression is 'if it 'aint bust don't fix it' - in my opinion this certainly applies to TAAB 2. The 1972 and first version released by Jethro Tull is far superior. However, this version has never been performed in its entirety. Anderson promises to tour with the second version with his 'new' band - messrs O'Hara, Goodier, Opahle and Hammond. The DVD shows how frustrated Anderson becomes when the new boys cannot master his demands. So why bother? - he cannot need the money. if you are a dedicated Tull fan who has followed their music since the creation, pass on this edition - put on TAAB 1 and listen to class.

review_headline: Himmel, Hölle und Liebe - Bewegender Fantasyfilm mit einem eindrucksvollen Robin Williams
review_body: Oscar-Preisträger Robin Williams (1951-2014) liefert in diesem bildgewaltigen, wie bewegenden Fantasystreifen einen großen emotionalen Auftritt.  Handlung Der Arzt Chris Nielsen begegnet in der Schweiz die Künsterlin Annie Collins. Die beiden verlieben sich, heiraten und eine innige Seelenverwandtschaft entwickelt sich. Sie werden Eltern zweier Kinder, die jedoch als Teenager bei Autounfällen ums Leben kommen. Später kommt Chris bei einem Autounfall ums Leben und findet sich in seinem Himmel wieder, wo er alles mit seiner Fantasie erschaffen kann. Er trifft dort auf Albert, seinem einstigen Vorgesetzten und Freund, der ihm die Grundzüge dieser jenseitigen Welt erklärt. Doch so fantastisch sein Himmel ist, so sehnt sich Chris nach seiner Frau, die in schwere Depressionen fällt. Als Annie sich das Leben nimmt erfährt Chris zu seinem Entsetzen, dass sie als Selbstmörderin in die Hölle gelandet ist. Chris ist bereit in die albtraumhafte Unterwelt zu reisen, um Annie aus ihrer Verdammnis zu erlösen.  Dieser Film zieht seine Zuschauer mit seinen effektvollen Darstellungen von Himmel und Hölle. Ausgezeichnet mit dem Oscar für Beste Visuelle Effekte. Robin Williams bewegt einfach in seiner Rolle als liebender Ehemann, der bereit ist sein Paradies zu verlassen, um zu versuchen seine Frau aus der Hölle zu befreien. Das ist eine der Rollen, in der ich ihn in Erinnerung behalten möchte.  Obwohl der Film Unterschiede zur Romanvorlage von Richard Matheson (1926-2013) vorweist, kann man ihn einfach nur sehen und sich mitreißen lassen.  Ein Film für alle Liebhaber von bildgewaltiger, wie emotionaler Fantasy.
translated_review: Oscar prize winner Robin Williams (1951-2014) delivers a great emotional appearance in this image-resistant, as moving fantasy strips. The doctor Chris Nielsen encounters the Künsterlin Annie Collins in Switzerland. The two fall in love, marry and an intimate moulder conveyance develops. They become parents of two children, but who come as teenagers in car accidents. Later, Chris is coming to a car accident and finds himself in his sky, where he can create everything with his imagination. He meets there on Albert, his former supervisor and friend who explains the basic features of this other side world. But so fantastic is his sky, Chris longs for his wife, which falls in severe depression. When Annie takes on life learns Chris to his horror that she landed as a suicide in hell. Chris is ready to travel to the nightmare underworld to redeem Annie from her damnation. This movie draws his spectators with his effective representations of heaven and hell. Excellent with the Oscar for best visual effects. Robin Williams simply moves in his role as a loving husband who is ready to leave his paradise to free his wife out of hell. That's one of the roles I want to remember him. Although the movie demonstrates differences to the novel template of Richard Matheson (1926-2013), one can just see him and let himself be carried away. A movie for all lovers of pictorial, like emotional fantasy.

review_headline: What's the worst thing about being old, Alvin?
review_body: Asks one of a group of cyclists of the central character in this quiet, classy film. 'Being able to remember when you were young' answers Alvin wryly.  Alvin, whose health is failing, dispenses small, simple nuggets of wisdom throughout the film, but they never come across as cloying or corny.      I am not a fan of David Lynch films at all, and recorded this to watch if I had nothing better to do.  Come a cold, rainy November day, I settled down to watch and, like most other reviewers here, saw two hours of a slow-paced, somewhat melancholy, yet deeply heartwarming and gentle-humoured film whizz by, and wished there were more of it.     You'll read a synopsis of the plot elsewhere, and it's not a complicated plot (based on a real life story), so the brilliant acting and cinematography are what will make this film stay with you and make you want to see it again. Every performance, even the very minor characters, rings true, and there are deeply moving moments when Alvin reflects out loud on his life and swaps war experiences with another veteran of WWII.     Visually, the film is like a little love poem to the rural upper Midwest; incredible sunsets, lightening storms, golden wheatfields stretching in every direction, night skies full of stars, lovely small towns set amongst autumn foliage.    I don't know what David Lynch fans would make of this untypical film, but those, like me, who find his films too 'out there' will be very pleasantly surprised.  I only wish I could award it more than five stars.  Absolutely superb.

review_headline: Good, but not THE BENDS, Part 2
review_body: HAIL TO THE THIEF, Radiohead's sixth album continues the bands progression from the seminal THE BENDS, through the fantastic OK COMPUTER, and the several- listenings-needed KID A and AMNESIAC, with the general feel more towards these latter works. Forget what you've heard - this isn't another THE BENDS - and although Johnny Greenwood's guitars make a welcome return, the overall emphasis is still on mood and electronic atmosphere. Not to say this isn't good - \"2+2=5\", \"There, There\" and \"Sail to the Moon\" are the standout tracks, with the former promoting imagery of early Pearl Jam work and the latter moving on nicely from OK COMPUTER. This album will take several repeat plays to get the general message across, but it's more accessible on early listenings than their previous two longplayers. But, despite what you've been told, this isn't THE BENDS, Part Deux. Which is a shame.

Not to say this isn't good - \"2+2=5\", \"There, There\" and \"Sail to the Moon\" are the standout tracks, with the former promoting imagery of early Pearl Jam work and the latter moving on nicely from OK COMPUTER. This album will take several repeat plays to get the general message across, but it's more accessible on early listenings than their previous two longplayers. But, despite what you've been told, this isn't THE BENDS, Part Deux. Which is a shame.

product_title: Er ist wieder da: Der Roman
review_body: Zum ersten Mal seit langem habe ich die Geburt eines Hypes verschlafen. Weder wurde ich durch Werbemails diverser Onlinebuchhändler, noch durch reale oder virtuelle Mundpropaganda auf dieses Juwel aufmerksam gemacht. Ich fand es als Neurscheinung in meiner Lieblingsbuchhandlung, nahezu versteckt in einem rustikalen, fast uneinsehbaren Holzregal. Und als ich das Cover des Buches sah, wusste ich wo der Hase lang läuft.  Der Titel “Er ist wieder da” als bekannt schnittiges Oberlippenbärtchen einer ebenfalls bekannten, schwarzen Sillouette, der Rest des Buches im nüchternen weiß. Ein Eyecatcher, ohne groß Fragen aufzuwerfen. Es war klar: hier geht es um Adolf Hitler. Und die Art der Präsentation ließ vermuten: es ist keine Neuauflage einer historisch fundierten Dokumentation, sondern wohl eher was zum lachen. Und da bin ich doch Teil der Zielgruppe!  Beginnen wir mit dem Klappentext: “Sommer 2011. Adolf Hitler erwacht auf einem leeren Grundstück in Berlin-Mitte. Ohne Krieg, ohne Partei, ohne Eva. Im tiefsten Frieden, unter tausenden von Ausländern und Angela Merkel. 66 Jahre nach seinem vermeintlichen Ende strandet der Gröfaz in der Gegenwart und startet gegen jede Wahrscheinlichkeit eine neue Karriere – im Fernsehen. Dieser Hitler ist keine Witzfigur und grade deshalb erschreckend real. Und das Land, auf das es trifft, ist es auch: zynisch, hemmungslos erfolgsgeil und auch nach Jahrzehnten deutscher Demokratie vollkommen chancenlos gegenüber dem Demagogen und der Sucht nach Quoten, Klicks und “Gefällt mir”-Buttons.(…)”  Klingt bitterböse, ist es auch, allerdings sicherlich nicht so, wie es manch einer erwartet hätte.  Timur Vermes ist eine Satire gelungen, zweifelsfrei eine sehr gute. Aber keine, die sich zu Weißwein und Crackern mal so nebenher konsumieren lässt. Aus der Ich-Perspektive erzählt Hitler von seinem Wirken und Handeln nach Ankunft im aufgeklärten 21. Jahrhundert. Dabei begleitet der Leser jeden noch so grenzwertigen, abstrusen, menschenverachtenden oder fanatischen Gedanken des selbsternannten Führers, und schmunzelt über jedes Missverständnis und jeden Fettnapf, den Hitler auf seinem Weg mitnimmt. Man lernt ihn kennen, den Adolf. Man erfährt wie er denkt, wie bizarr er argumentiert, wie redegewandt und charmant er ist. Es ist nicht nur der wahnsinnige Massenmörder, der sich hier preisgibt. Es ist der tier- und kinderliebe Mann Mitte 50, der sich seinen Prinzipien verpflichtet fühlt, der fleissig, bescheiden und heimatliebend seine Weltanschauung in geschickter Rhetorik zum Besten gibt. Das sind alles höchst erfreuliche Attribute, bis man den Namen dahinter liest: Adolf Hitler. Darf man manchen Dingen zustimmen, die ein fiktiver Adolf Hitler zum Besten gibt? Ja? Nein? Und was, wenn eben dieser Hitler bei manchen Dingen aber den Nagel auf den Kopf trifft? Ist eine ausgesprochene Wahrheit weniger wahr, wenn sie aus dem Munde des größten Massenmörders der europäischen Geschichte kommt?  Das sind Fragen, die sich der Leser stellt. Beim lesen, beim lachen, beim Kopfnicken an manchen Passagen. Dann wieder macht es uns der fiktive Adolf leicht, ihn zu hassen. Beispielsweise wenn er über die Notwendigkeit der Judenvernichtung schwadroniert. Oder über seine Sicht der Dinge bei der Rassenfrage.  Der Leser steht hier auf dem Prüfstand. Ich für meinen Teil habe dies schnell verstanden, verinnerlicht, und dennoch gelacht. Oder gerade deshalb. Hitler -also der echte jetzt- war ein Mensch, kein Monster. Er war intelligent, redegewandt und sogar emphatisch genug, um die Massen hinter sich zu scharen. Wäre er das Monster gewesen, welches wir heute in ihm sehen, wäre ihm nicht gelungen, was ihm schließlich gelang. Das Tabu, einem Adolf Hitler das Mensch-sein absprechen zu wollen, bricht der Leser während seiner Lektüre. Das wird ihm klar. Er schluckt schwer, liest weiter, schmunzelt, lacht, schluckt wieder schwer, usw. usf.  Was Timur Vermes da zu Papier gebracht hat, ist Gesellschafts- und Politsatire auf höchstem Niveau. Weder die Medienbranche, das Kleinbürgertum noch der Politzirkus werden verschont. Letztlich lässt Vermes seinen Hitler so manchen Dampf aussprechen, der wohl bei den meisten für Druck im Kessel sorgt.  Wer Wahrheit und Witz schätzt, wird an diesem Buch seine wahre Freude haben. Wer in dieser Thematik eher zart besaitet ist, lässt besser die Finger davon. Ich kann es jedenfalls nur weiter empfehlen. Ganz im Sinne der guten alten Propaganda. Ähm, Mundpropaganda, natürlich!

review_body: I am fed up of people slagging off the band for having "bland lyrics", while these people have probably only heard the band played on the radio.  Do not judge this album if you have only heard "Buck Rogers" and "Seven Days In the Sun".  While these are great (if overplayed) tunes, the real strength of this album is in the likes of the haunting "Piece by Piece" and the superb "Turn".  There is so much diversity on offer here, that this really is an essential purchase.

review_headline: Un très bon film qui fait peur!
review_body: J'ai vu ce film évidemment au ciné puisqu'il n'est pas encore sorti en dvd et je dois dire que je suis sortie époustouflée par la qualité du scénario, la réalisation impeccable qui procure une angoisse qui s'accentue au fur et à mesure et surtout pour la prestation des acteurs avec au premier rang évidemment un Leonardo Di Caprio et une Michelle Williams tout simplement incroyables! Leonardo Di Caprio aurait d'ailleurs mérité un oscar pour cette prestation  car il est convaincant dans tous les domaines, le flic sûr de lui et l'homme qui laisse transparaître une folie qui ne fait que se révéler de plus en plus au fil du film. Il faut savoir quand même que c'est un film dur, choc mais aussi très émouvant et il faut être prêt(e) à passer par certaines émotions fortes. On en ressort bousculés, essorés et touchés par cette histoire grandement réalisée par le maître Scorcese! Je ne vous en dis pas plus pour ne pas vous déflorer le secret du film mais c'est sans conteste un film à voir!
translated_review: I saw this movie obviously in the Ciné since it is not yet released on DVD and I must say that I am outbreakdown by the quality of the scenario, the impeccable realization which provides an anxiety that increases as and at Measurement and especially for the provision of actors with the first rank obviously a Leonardo di Caprio and a Michelle Williams simply incredible! Leonardo di Caprio would have earned an Oscar for this benefit because it is convincing in all areas, the safe cop of it and the man who lets it show a madness that only proves to be more and more over the film . You have to know anyway that it is a hard movie, shock but also very moving and you have to be ready to go through some strong emotions. We spring up, wrung out and affected by this story greatly made by the master scorce! I do not tell you more so as not to deflower the secret of the movie but it is undoubtedly a movie to see!

review_headline: Ich hätte den Film nicht 2 sondern 5 Sterne gegeben.
review_body: Die Handlung ist Super und sehr Düster, die  Düstere Atmosphäre wird auch sehr gut eingefangen!    Ich habe mir den Film angesehen aber war doch etwas verwundert, über die schlechte Quali des Films im Netz fand ich dann meine Bestätigung der ganze Film Endstand am Computer und sehr wenig war echt!    Sorry aber wo ich erfuhr das man so ziemlich alles per Computer Hergestellt hatte, Weizen Felder und Berge die keine sind sondern nur Plastik Hügel die maximal 5 Meter Hoch waren, und die ewig selbige Himmelsfarbe Grau blau und Braun, war ich doch sehr enttäuscht darüber und hoffe man besinnt sich wieder auf Richtige Landschaft Aufnahmen!    Diese Art Movie Filme finde ich Klasse, nur bitte mit realer Kulisse wie in Pathfinder wo man richtige Landschafts  Aufnahmen benutzte!     Deshalb die 2 Sterne!
translated_review: The plot is super and very gloomy, the gloomy atmosphere is also very well captained!I looked at the movie but was a bit surprised, about the bad qualifier of the movie on the net, I found my confirmation of the whole film final score on the computer and very little was real!Sorry but where I learned that you had made quite everything by computer, wheat fields and mountains that are none but only plastic hills were the maximum 5 meters high, and the eternally selfy sky color gray blue and brown, I was very disappointed andHope you keep compressed back to real landscape!This type of movie movies I find great, just please with real scenery as in Pathfinder where you used correct landscape shots!That's why the 2 stars!

product_title: Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde - Extended Edition [dt./OV]
review_body: Die vielen erzählerischen Lücken und erahnten Links zu der großen Geschichte des Herrn der Ringe wurde hier filmerisch perfekt umgesetzt. Sollen sie doch alle schimpfen,über Erfindungen und Ausschmückungen, ich finde es großartig und ganz im Sinne der Geschichte zusammengedichtet. Ab und an wäre es natürlich fein, wenn die Kommentare von Gandalf etwas abwechslungsreicher und zauberischer wären, aber das auch so findet sich im Gesamtkonzept des Filmes alles an seinem Platz. Toller Film!
translated_review: The many narrative gaps and retrieved links to the great history of the Lord of the Rings was perfectly implemented here.Should they all scold, through inventions and events, I find it great and coincided in the spirit of history.From time to time it would be fine, of course, if the comments of Gandalf would be a bit varied and wizard, but that's how it is in the overall concept of the film everything in its place.Great movie!

review_body: Comment peut on faire un film si beau ? Je me suis trouvée bête à pleurer devant un film pou enfants ( mais l'est-il vraiment?) mais on ne peut pas s'en empecher. C'est tellement beau qu'on a du mal à se retenir. Cette petite fille qui joue sara nous fait croire à ses bonheurs et à ses malheurs, à son chagrin qu'on partage, à ses rêves. Il y a une scène magnifique, pleine de poésie où elle irradie le bonheur. Pour ceux qui comme moi suivait assidument \"princesse sara\", le dessin animé nippon, ils auraont la joie de retrouver tous les personnages, jusqu'au chat. La fin est différente, mais toute la même magie se retrouve. Quel bonheur que ces larmes là. Toute la force de l'amour et de l'amitié.

But we can not emcate it.It's so beautiful that we have trouble remembering.This little girl who plays Sara makes us believe in his happiness and misfortunes, to his sorrow that one shares, to his dreams.There is a beautiful scene, full of poetry where she radiates happiness.For those who like me followed assidimate \ "Princess Sara \", the Cartoon Nippon, they will have the joy of finding all the characters, to the cat.The end is different, but all the same magic is found.What a pleasure that these tears there.All the strength of love and friendship.

review_body: An outstanding and sensitively written thriller with a twist.  In a small town in Sydney, Cecelia’s well ordered life is turned upside down as her husband’s secret derails her. Tess is sent into a spin when her husband and cousin reveal their devastating secret. Rachel has lived with the pain of losing her daughter for longer than she can remember, her suspicions that a local man is responsible lead to catastrophic events that leave you thinking what if?  Not just simply a whodunit, a truly outstanding book.

Die Ausführung der Borderline-Persönlichkeit mit ihren depressiven und psychotischen Phasen und dazugehörigen Halluzinationen, allzumal unter dem Einfluss von Drogen, war dann eher schwach und sehr vorhersehbar. Ich habe mich streckenweise sehr gelangweilt. Es gibt bessere Ballettfilme - und bessere Borderline-Filme!

review_body: Fox in Socks is a book I read as a child and one I never forgot, so I purchased it for my son with the CD. It's wonderful. We read it aloud together and my son laughs at how some of the phrases are real tongue twisters. The CD is a plus as sometimes he'll play it and read along without me. The book is not a hardcover and there is no hard plastic case for the CD, but both come in a soft plastic envelope for protective storage.

product_title: Time Killer (Max Larkin Detective Series Book 1)
review_body: I'm a big fan of crime thrillers and grabbed this one after reading all the excellent reviews. I wasn't disappointed.  The premise is very unusual and scarily plausible. It is very graphic which I enjoyed. All too often it seems writers in this genre distance themselves from the crimes they are writing about, almost as if they don't want to upset their readers. This is not the case here and it's refreshing to find a writer who is not afraid to explore the violence they are writing about in detail.  The relationship between the detectives is great and their characters are explored fully. Often character development is neglected in favour of the plot and I'm happy to say that is not the case here.  This is the work of a talented author and one I will certainly be watching out for.  Be warned though, it will stay with you!

The relationship between the detectives is great and their characters are explored fully. Often character development is neglected in favour of the plot and I'm happy to say that is not the case here.  This is the work of a talented author and one I will certainly be watching out for.  Be warned though, it will stay with you!

review_body: Twisted Sister. Aujourd'hui, ce nom est connu de tous les amateurs de musique musclée. Le groupe est même carrément devenu culte. Mais il n'en a pas toujours été ainsi.  Car, on le sait moins, Twisted Sister a connu des débuts bien difficiles. C'est sous le nom de Silver Star que ce qui va devenir Twisted Sister voit le jour en 1972. L'année suivante, les musiciens qui le composent accueillent en tant que guitariste un nouveau membre, John Segall (alias Jay Jay French). Celui-ci venait d'auditionner pour un certain Wicked Lester, un autre petit groupe new-yorkais, qui connaîtra un certain succès l'année suivante sous le nom de Kiss. C'est à ce moment que Silver Star change de nom pour Twisted Sister. Après de multiples changements de musiciens, Jay Jay se retrouve également en charge des vocaux. En 1975, c'est Eddie Ojeda, un ami de longue date de Jay Jay, qui rejoint le groupe en tant que second guitariste et second chanteur. Le groupe est alors surtout influencé par le Glam Rock (Slade, Mott The Hoople, David Bowie, New York Dolls). C'est en 1976 qu'est engagé Daniel \"Dee\" Snider en tant que chanteur. Avec lui, Twisted Sister prend une direction plus heavy (AC/DC, Led Zeppelin, Alice Cooper sont alors les influences principales), tout en restant fan du mouvement Glam. Le groupe commence à pas mal tourner aux States et se fait connaître. Ce n'est qu'en 1982 que le line-up définitif voit le jour avec l'arrivée de AJ Pero à la batterie et Mark Mendoza à la basse. C'est à cette époque aussi que le groupe travaille son image avec des maquillages outranciers, rappelant les groupes de glam mais en plus moche.  Et c'est donc seulement en 1982, soit dix ans après la création du groupe, que paraît leur premier album, \"Under The Blade\". L'album est produit par Pete Way de UFO mais possède un son assez faiblard, défaut qui sera corrigé sur la seconde version de l'album, réédité en 1985 par Atlantic Records et qui comprend un titre en plus, \"I'll Never Grow Up Now\", un morceau datant de 1979. Cet album, intitulé \"Under The Blade\" (un de leurs plus vieux titres) sert donc de carte de visite aux soeurs tordues. Et malgré les apparences dues au look des musiciens, il ne fallait pas s'attendre à écouter un album de Glam. Le premier morceau, \"What You Don't Know (Sure Can Hurt You)\", sorte de croisement entre AC/DC et Judas Priest fin années soixante-dix/début années quatre-vingt, montre un groupe bien plus heavy que l'image qu'il donne. La voix de Dee Snider ne manque pas d'agressivité et les deux guitaristes envoient des duels de guitares sur les solos, assez typiques de la NWOBHM. L'influence AC/DC devient flagrante sur le riff qui mène \"Shoot `Em Down\" et dans une moindre mesure sur \"Day Of The Rocker\". Si bien que quand le groupe reprendra du AC/DC (\"Sin City\"), on ne verra pas une si grande différence. Certains riffs, plus heavy, (\"Bad Boys\", \"Under The Blade\") ne sont pas sans rappeler le Priest de \"Point Of Entry\" (l'album le plus américanisé des Anglais à l'époque). Bien lourds sont des titres comme \"Run For Your Life\", \"Day Of The Rocker\" ou \"Destroyer\". Le groupe aime aussi le tempo un peu speed comme le prouvent \"Sin After Sin\" et surtout \"Tear It Lose\" où un invité de marque, Fast Eddie Clarke (Motörhead), vient poser un solo. Non vraiment, ces soeurs-là aiment le Metal, le vrai ! Un mot sur le morceau rajouté sur la seconde édition, \"I'll Never Grow Up Now\", plus léger avec refrain hyper fédérateur (un genre de \"We're Not Gonna Take It avant l'heure\"), à se demander pourquoi il n'avait pas été ajouté à l'album dès sa première édition.  Si à sa sortie cet album n'a pas connu un succès foudroyant, il s'est bien rattrapé trois ans plus tard lors de sa réédition, profitant du succès du tout récent \"Stay Hungry\". \"Under The Blade\", comme presque tous les albums du groupe (du moins, tous du premier au quatrième inclus) est un incontournable du Hard Rock américain. translated_review: Twisted sister. Today, this name is known to all muscular music lovers. The group is even downright becoming worship. But it has not always been so. Because, we know less, Twisted Sister has experienced very difficult beginnings. It is under the name of Silver Star that what will become Twisted Sister was born in 1972. The following year, the musicians who compose it welcome as a guitarist a new member, John Segall (aka Jay Jay French). This one had to audition for a certain Wicked Lester, another small New York group, which will experience a certain success the following year under the name of Kiss. That's when Silver Star changes name for Twisted Sister. After multiple musicians changes, Jay Jay is also in charge of vocals. In 1975, Eddie Ojeda, a long-standing friend of Jay Jay, who joins the group as a second guitarist and second singer. The group is especially influenced by Glam Rock (Slade, Mott The Hoople, David Bowie, New York Dolls). In 1976, Daniel \ "Dee \" Snider as a singer. With him, Twisted Sister takes a plus Heavy direction (AC / DC, Led Zeppelin, Alice Cooper are then the main influences), while remaining a fan of the Glam movement. The group begins to turn wrong to the states and makes themselves known. It was not until 1982 that the final line-up is born with the arrival of AJ Pero to the battery and Mark Mendoza at the bass. It was also at that time that the group works its image with outstanding makeup makers, reminiscent of Glam groups but ugly. And it is only in 1982, ten years after the group's creation, what their first album appears, \ "Under the Blade \". The album is produced by Pete Way of UFO but has a fairly failed sound, default that will be corrected on the second version of the album, reissued in 1985 by Atlantic Records and which includes a title in addition, "I'll Never Grow Up Now \ ", a piece dating from 1979. This album, entitled \" Under the Blade \ "(one of their oldest titles) serves as a business card to the twisted sisters. And despite appearances due to the look of musicians, we had to expect listening to glam album. The first piece, \ "What You Do not Know (Sure Can Hurt You) \", kind of crossing between AC / DC and Judas Priest for the seventy-ten / early eighties, shows a much more heavy group than the image it gives. Dee Snider's voice does not lack aggression and the two guitarists send guitar duels on the solos, typical of the NWOBHM. The AC / DC influence becomes blatant on the riff that leads \ "Shoot \ Down \" and to a lesser extent on \ "Day of the Rocker \". So that when the group will resume AC / DC (\ "Sin City \"), we will not see such a big difference. Some Riffs, more Heavy, (\ "Bad Boys \", \ "Under the Blade \") are reminiscent of the Priest of \ "point of entry \" (the most American album of the English at the time ) Very heavy are titles like \ "Run for Your Life \", \ "Day of the Rocker \" or \ "destroyer \". The group also likes the tempo a little speed as proven \ "Sin After Sin \" and especially \ "tear it lose \" where a brand guest, Fast Eddie Clarke (Motörhead), puts a solo. Not really, these sisters love the metal, the truth! A word on the song added on the second edition, \ "I'll Never Grow Up Now \", Lighter with Hyper Federator Chorus (a kind of \ "We're NOT Gonna Take it before the hour \"), To wonder why he had not been added to the album from his first edition. If at his exit this album did not have a tough success, he cleared well three years later when he was remediated, taking advantage of the success of the very recent \ "Stay Hungry \". \ "Under the Blade \", like almost all the group's albums (at least all of the first to the fourth inclusive) is a must of the Hard Rock American. product_title: Bridgman's: Complete Guide to Drawing from Life
review_body: Dans des styles tout à fait différents, HOGARTH, BRIDGMAN et LOOMIS sont trois grands maîtres nord-américains de dessin du corps humain. LOOMIS est le plus léger, délicat, un tantinet désuet mais toujours parfait. Quelques uns de ses livres viennent d'être réédités. C'est plus agréable qu'en e-books ! BRIDGMAN fut un grand professeur d'anatomie artistique et ses travaux montrent des formes massives, structurées, magnifiques de force et de conviction. On peut acquérir cet ouvrage (résumé suffisant de ses divers travaux) ou la totale. Le prix n'est pas excessif et le résultat sera, soyez en sûrs impressionnant.
translated_review: In quite different styles, Hogarth, Bridgman and Loomis are three great North American masters of human body drawing.Loomis is the lightest, delicate, a Tantine outdoors but always perfect.Some of his books have just been reissued.It's more enjoyable than e-books!Bridgman was a great professor of artistic anatomy and his work shows massive, structured, magnificent forms of strength and conviction.This book can be acquired (sufficient summary of its various works) or total.The price is not excessive and the result will be, be sure impressive.

review_headline: Hinreissender Film, aber die Ausstattung der DVD ist eine Frechheit!
review_body: Zum Film wurde ja bereits alles gesagt, der ist absolut sehens- und hörenswert.  Was aber nun den DVD-Release betrifft, so muss man Universal mal fragen, ob die da den Schuß nicht gehört haben oder die Musicalfans mit aller Gewalt gegen sich aufbringen wollen. Kein einziges lausiges Extra ist auf der DVD zu finden. Kein Making-Of, keine Biographien, keine Trailer, kein gar nichts. Jeder Ramsch-Film aus der Grabbelkiste ist besser ausgestattet, als diese DVD-Frechheit von Universal! Einzig ein paar Werbetrailer darf man sich ansehen, bevor man zum Hauptmenü gelangt. Ach ja, und ein Faltblättchen mit noch mehr Werbung liegt der DVD dann auch noch bei.  Einen so tollen Film auf DVD ohne jede Ausstattung zu verhökern ist eine Sauerei von Universal und setzt damit einen weiteren traurigen Höhepunkt in der Kette der Dreistigkeiten, die uns Universal mit diesem Film serviert hat. Was mit der katastrophalen Kinostart-Planung begann, sich in lausigen Untertiteln und einer völlig deplatzierten Synchro - die man sich hätte schenken können - fortsetze, gipfelt nun in einer nur als armseelig zu bezeichnenden DVD-Veröffentlichung, die der Größe und der Kraft dieses Films in keinster Weise gerecht wird.  Mein Fazit: Das war definitiv die letzte DVD aus dem Hause Universal für die ich Geld verschwendet habe. Da kann ich gleich auf die TV-Premiere warten und diese mit einem HD-Recorder aufzeichnen. Kommt aufs Selbe raus.  Wertung: Film 5 Sterne Ausstattung 1 Stern (weniger geht ja nicht)  Macht Gesamt: 3 Sterne

My conclusion: That was definitely the last DVD from the universal for whom I wasted money. Since I can wait right onto the TV premiere and record it with an HD recorder. Comes out on the same.
