product_title: La Belle et le clochard [Combo Blu-ray + DVD]
review_body: "La Belle et le Clochard", sorti en 1954 et réalisé par Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimo et Wilfred Jackson (Les réalisateurs de "Les 101 Dalmatiens", "Peter Pan", "Alice au pays des merveilles", "Cendrillon", "Fantasia", "Pinocchio", et "Dumbo" entre autres.), est l'un des plus grands chefs d’œuvre des studios Disney et fait parti des dessins animés de la firme à regarder impérativement au moins une fois, et ce, quel que soit l'âge! Un film d'animation magnifique et très réussi qui a remporté un franc succès lors de sa sortie au cinéma. Le film nous raconte les aventures de Lady, une jolie chienne qui vit dans une petite ville tranquille de la Nouvelle-Angleterre avec ses deux maîtres, Jim et et sa femme Darling. Un beau jour, Darling met un enfant au monde et la vie quotidienne de Lady va basculer. Quelques jours plus tard, ses maîtres s'absentent quelques temps et voit arriver la vieille tante Sarah accompagnée de ses deux terribles chats siamois, Si et Am, à son domicile. Lady va se retrouver injustement dans la rue et fait la connaissance d'un chien errant nommé Clochard qui va lui faire vivre des aventures extraordinaires. L'histoire est très intéressante à suivre et ne manque pas d'humour ni d'émotion. Graphiquement, "La Belle et le Clochard" est magnifique avec des décors détaillés et colorés ainsi qu'une animation sans faille. Le film possède un rythme soutenu, on ne s'ennuie jamais. Les morceaux de bravoure sont nombreux, efficaces et spectaculaires et les personnages sont tous très charismatiques et attachants, en particulier notre couple de héros, issu de deux mondes différents, ce qui ne les empêchent pas de s'aimer malgré tout, une belle leçon de morale. Les personnes secondaires qu'ils vont rencontrer durant leur périple sont complètements déjantés et drôles. Les musiques et chansons sont très sympathiques et entraînantes. Bref, "La Belle et le Clochard" est un film d'animation magnifique et intemporel qui plaira à toute la famille. Un chef d’œuvre divertissant, drôle et spectaculaire, à voir absolument!  Le blu-ray offre une superbe qualité d'image, digne du support HD. Les couleurs sont belles et l'image est très propre et nette. Rien à dire, c'est bien mieux que le DVD, qui est fourni avec le blu-ray, et impressionnant pour un film de 60 ans! Disney a fait un très bon travail sur la restauration de l'image de ce film. A noter que le film est au format 16/9 (Donc plein écran). Au niveau du son, la VF est proposée en 7.1 DTS-HD HR. Un son de très bonne qualité même si la VO, qui est proposée en 7.1 DTS-HD MA, est un peu meilleure. En revanche, on ne peut que déplorer que le doublage français ne soit pas celui de la VHS des années 80. Ce nouveau doublage, qui date de 1997, est très loin d'être au niveau du précédent de 1989 (Le Clochard avait par exemple la voix française de Bruce Willis). Ceux qui ont connu ce film avec les anciennes VHS me comprendront. Du coup, le film perd un peu de son charme, c'est bien dommage.  En bref, "La Belle et le Clochard" est un dessin animé culte et intemporel, qui possède toujours aujourd'hui un charme indéniable! Un véritable chef d’œuvre qui a su marquer plusieurs générations d'enfants. Il contient tout ce qu'il faut pour passer un agréable moment en famille devant la télévision : Une histoire très belle et intéressante à suivre, des dessins et animations superbes, un rythme soutenu, des morceaux de bravoure efficaces et spectaculaires, des personnages attachants, de superbes musiques, de l'humour et de l'émotion. Un excellent divertissement qui comblera un large public. Le blu-ray est exempt de tout reproche si ce n'est cette nouvelle VF qui fait perdre du charme au film par rapport à la VHS de 1989. Un achat sûr.
translated_review: "The beautiful and the tramp", released in 1954 and directed by Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimo and Wilfred Jackson (the directors of "the 101 Dalmatians", "Peter Pan", "Alice in Wonderland", "Cinderella", " Fantasia "," Pinocchio ", and" Dumbo "among others.), Is one of the greatest masterpieces of Disney studios and is part of the cartoons of the firm to look at least once, and this, Whatever age! A magnificent and very successful animation film that has won a great success when leaving the cinema. The film tells us the adventures of Lady, a pretty female dog who lives in a quiet little town of New England with its two masters, Jim and and his darling wife. A beautiful day, Darling puts a child in the world and the daily life of Lady will switch. A few days later, his masters abstain some time and sees the old Aunt Sarah accompanied by his two terrible Siamese cats, if and AM, at his home. Lady will find ourselves unfairly in the street and meets a stray dog ​​named CloChar who will make him live extraordinary adventures. The story is very interesting to follow and does not lack humor or emotion. Graphically, "The beautiful and the tramp" is beautiful with detailed and colorful decors as well as a faultless animation. The film has a steady pace, we never get bored. The pieces of bravery are numerous, efficient and spectacular and the characters are all very charismatic and endearing, especially our couple of hero, from two different worlds, which do not prevent them from loving themselves nevertheless, a beautiful lesson of moral. The secondary people they will encounter during their journey are crazy and funny completely. Music and songs are very friendly and trainer. In short, "the beautiful and the tramp" is a beautiful and timeless animation movie that will appeal to the whole family. An entertaining, funny and spectacular masterpiece to see absolutely! The Blu-ray offers superb image quality, worthy of HD support. The colors are beautiful and the image is very clean and clear. Nothing to say, it's much better than the DVD, which comes with the Blu-ray, and impressive for a 60-year-old movie! Disney did a very good job on the restoration of the image of this movie. Note that the film is in 16/9 format (so full screen). At the sound, the VF is proposed in 7.1 DTS-HD HR. A sound of very good quality even if the VO, which is proposed in 7.1 DTS-HD MA, is a little better. On the other hand, one can only deplore that the French dubbing is not that of the VHS of the 80s. This new dubbing, which dates from 1997, is far from being at the level of the previous 1989 (the tramp had for example. The French voice of Bruce Willis). Those who knew this film with the old VHS will understand me. As a result, the film loses a bit of its charm, it's a shame. In short, "the beautiful and the tramp" is a cartoon cult and timeless, which still has an undeniable charm today! A true masterpiece that has marked several generations of children. It contains everything you need to spend a pleasant time with family in front of the television: a very beautiful and interesting story to follow, superb drawings and animations, a steady pace, pieces of efficient and spectacular bravery, endearing characters, Beautiful music, humor and emotion. An excellent entertainment that will fill a wide audience. The Blu-ray is exempt from any reproach if this is this new VF that makes the charm of the film from the VHS of 1989. A safe purchase.

review_body:
Kann jemand ausschließlich zum Militär geboren sein? Wenn man diese Frage überhaupt mit \"Ja\" beantworten kann, dann im Falle von Patton, der in der Militär-Geschichte eine der, wenn nicht die umstrittenste Persönlichkeit überhaupt ist; das gilt interessanterweise auch heute noch für die US-Army.
Wie hat Robert E. Lee einmal gesagt? \"Um ein guter Soldat zu sein, muss man die Armee lieben. Um ein guter Kommandeur zu sein, muss man willens sein, den Tod dessen zu befehlen, was man liebt\" Patton war mit totaler militärischer Ratio in der Lage, ausschließlich strategisch-taktisch zu denken und alles andere auszuschließen. Das impliziert naturgemäß seine menschenverachtend zu nennende Führungsmethode, seine totale Rücksichtslosigkeit aber auch - in letzter Konsequenz - die unbestreitbare historische Tatsache, dass Patton als der beste, effektivste und gefährlichste Ớpponent seitens des Ớberkommandos der Wehrmacht eingeschätzt wurde. Dies ist insofern interessant, als dass Patton aufgrund seiner zahlreichen Fehltritte (er ohrfeigte Untergebene, verprellte diplomatisch die Verbündeten in Ớst und West usw. usf.) vom allierten Ớberkommando unter Eisenhower streckenweise kaltgestellt wurde. Seine militärischen Leistungen und Erfolge weit jenseits jeder militärakademischen Logik sprechen allerdings eine nicht wegzudiskutierende eigene Sprache. Ja, er war ein Choleriker. Ja, er war auch ein Legasteniker. Ja, er war naturwissenschaftlich und mathematisch total unbegabt und ungebildet. Ja, er glaubte an die Seelenwanderung und war überzeugt, schon in den Punischen Kriegen vor Karthago und als Marschall unter Napoleon I. gekämpft zu haben. Ja, seine Zeitgenossen haben ihn nicht verstanden. Genie und Wahnsinn liegen - bekanntermaßen - dicht beieinander. Eine große und beeindruckende filmische Biographie eines kontroversen Charakters mit einem George C. Scott in der Titelrolle, welcher der Figur Patton beinah erschreckend realistische Züge verleiht.
translated_review:
Can someone be born exclusively to the military? If you can answer this question at all with \ "yes \", then in the case of Patton, who is one of the military history, if not the most controversial personality at all; Interestingly, this is still true for the US Army today.
How did Robert E. Lee once said? \ "To be a good soldier, you have to love the army. To be a good commander, you have to be willing to order the death of what you love \" Patton was able to strategically with total military ratio Tactical to think and exclude everything else. Of course, this implies its illuminating leadership method, but its total consenseness but also - in the latter consequence - the undeniable historical fact that Patton was considered the best, most effective and most dangerous ớpponent on the part of the Wehrmacht's cross-command. This is interesting in that Patton because of its numerous mistrepiece (he earlapped subordinated, defrosted diplomatically, the allies in ớst and West etc., etc.) was coldly cold by the Allied Überkommando under Eisenhower. His military achievements and successes far beyond every military academic logic, however, speak a non-pathatory own language. Yes, he was a choleric. Yes, he was also a leaspoon. Yes, he was scientific and mathematically totally unbalanced and uneducated. Yes, he believed in the soul hike and was convinced to have fought in the Punic wars from Karthago and as Marshal under Napoleon I. Yes, his contemporaries did not understand him. Genie and madness are - known - close together. A large and impressive cinematic biography of a controversy character with a George C. Scott in the title role, which gives the figure Patton almost frightening realistic trains.

product_title: Keeper of the Seven Keys Part 1 (bonus track edition)
review_body: 1987, als der Metal am Höhepunkt seines Zeniths stand und vorallem die extremen Metalspielarten boomten, brachte Helloween ein Album heraus, das ein eignes Genre definieren sollte. \"Keeper Ớf The Seven Keys Part 1\" war deswegen so anders, da es nicht möglichst hart oder extrem sein wollte, sondern sich den melidiösen, ruhigen und technisch anspruchsvollen Metal der NWoBHM als Ớrientierungspunkt genommen und noch weiter beschleunigt hat. Herausgekommen ist ein Album, welches vorallem durch den extrem guten Sänger, der Unverbrauchtheit seiner Lieder und deren innovativen Aufbau punkten kann. Allein das melodische Intro und der darauffolgende Track \"I'm Alive\" dienen schon als Schablone für einen Powermetal-Song erster Klasse. \"A Little Time\" ist auch sehr genial und mein absoluter Favorit neben \"Future World\" auf der Platte. \"Twilight Ớf The Gods\" hat eine wirklich schöne Melodie, während die Über-Ballade \"A Tale That Wasn't Right\" im Power Metal Sektor jetzt schon seit über 20 Jahren unangetastet geblieben ist. Mit \"Future World\" war auf dem ersten Album dieser Musikrichtung wahrscheinlich auch gleich noch eines der stärksten Lieder dieser Stilrichtung vertreten. Hier passt einfach alles. \"Halloween\" ist für mich das stärkste der längeren Lieder der Band und vereint einfach alle wichtigen Merkmale von dieser in ihren frühen Tagen. Was zum Schluß folgt ist ein ruhiges, auf Instrumente fixiertes Ớutro, das ein musikalisches Meisterwerk abschließt.    \"Keeper Ớf The Seven Keys\" ist der Pflichtbesitz eines jeden Power Metal Fans und auch von Fans der nicht so extremen, eher melidiöseren Metalarten. Liebhaber der NWoBHM sollten ebenfalls unbedingt mal reinhören. Zwar bleibt Power Metal immer Geschmackssache und bedarf etwas Kitschresistenz, aber ansonsten ist dieses Doppelalbum mit seinem zweiten Teil eines der besten Metalalben überhaupt.
translated_review: In 1987, when Metal at the highlight of his Zenith stand and especially the extreme metal clearance types boomed, Helloween brought out an album that should define a good genre. "Keeper ớf The Seven Keys Part 1" was so different because it did not want to be as hard or extreme as much as possible, but the melidious, quiet and technically sophisticated metal of the NWOBHM has taken as an ớnishing point and further accelerated. The result is an album, which can score above all through the extremely good singer, the unusedness of his songs and their innovative construction. Alone the melodic intro and the subsequent track \ "I'm alive \" already serve as a template for a powermetal song first class. \ "A Little Time \" is also very awesome and my absolute favorite next to \ "Future World \" on the plate. \ "Twilight ớf The Gods \" has a really nice melody, while the over-ballad \ "A Tale That Wesn't Right \" has now remained untouched at the Power Metal Sector for over 20 years. With \ "Future World \" was probably one of the strongest songs of this style on the first album of this genre direction. Here everything fits everything. "Halloween \" is the strongest of the longer songs of the band for me and simply units all important characteristics of this in their early days. What follows is a calm, fixed on instruments, which concludes a musical masterpiece. \ "Keeper ớf The Seven Keys \" is the commitment of every Power Metal fans and also of fans who are not so extreme, rather melidious metal species. Lovers of NWOBHM should also be purely listening. Although Power Metal always remains a matter of taste and requires a little cheltress resistance, but otherwise this double album with its second part of one of the best metal albums is even.

review_body: Was soll man zu Breaking Bad noch sagen?  Einfach kaufen und selber beurteilen, ob es noch etwas besseres gibt. Ich möchte gar nicht darauf eingehen, ob diese Staffel oder eine andere nun besser oder schlecht ist. Jede Staffel hat seine Höhen und Tiefen aber in Summe eine sehr spannende Serie, in der sich die Charakter immerzu weiter entwickeln und ich nicht immer wusste, mit welchem Charakter ich nun sympathisiere oder nicht

review_body: WOW, was für ein Debut! Die in England heimische internationale Misch-Truppe löste auf mp3.com mit dem Demo zu \"Valley of the Damned\" einen Weltweiten melodic Metal Aufschrei aus; mit Highspeed und eingängigen Melodien, sowie genialer Gitarren-Arbeit konnten die Mannen um Saitenhexer Herman Li und Sänger ZP Theart auf sich aufmerksam machen; und das darauf folgende gleichnamige Debut-Album lässt keine True-Metal Wünsche offen.  Mit dem Titeltrack und Nummern wie \"Black Fire\", \"Starfire\", \"Black Winter Nights\", \"Heart of the Dragon\" haben die Herren ein paar ordentliche highspeed-Kracher am Start die durchaus überzeugen können. Persönlich gefiel mir das Nachfolgewerk \"Sonic Firestorm\" noch etwas besser, da die Instrumentalisierungen etwas differenzierter und der Sound druckvoller ist. Nichtsdestotrotz kann das Debut hier ebenfalls toll punkten, allein ZP's Stimme gefällt mir persönlich nicht so; sie kommt mir etwas zu dünn und wenig präsent rüber. Aber auch das trägt ja zum Flair der noch jungen Band bei. Kaufempfehlung für alle Melodic/Speed Metal Freunde, die werden hier und beim Nachfolger, auf dem sogar Blast Beats zum Einsatz kommen, ihre helle Freude haben. Beeindruckende Leistung gerade für die englische Szene, die ja gegenwärtig vor allem von diversen Black Metal Bands dominiert wird!
translated_review: Wow, what a debut! The International Mixed Troops in England triggered on MP3.com with the demo to \ "Valley of the damned \" a worldwide Melodic Metal outcry; With high-speed and catchy melodies, as well as ingenious guitar work, the men were able to draw attention to Saisthexer Herman Li and singer ZP Theart; And the following subparagrate debut album leaves no true metal. With the title track and numbers like \ "Black Fire \", \ "Starfire \", \ "Black Winter Nights \", \ "Heart of the Dragon \", the gentlemen have a few ordinary high-speed bangers at the start who can convince quite . Personally, I liked the successor "Sonic Firestorm \" a little better because the instrumentalization is slightly more differentiated and the sound more pressure. Nevertheless, the debut can also be great here, but I personally do not like ZP's voice; She seems to me something too thin and little present. But that too, contributes to the flair of the still young band. Buy recommendation for all Melodic / Speed ​​Metal friends who are here and the successor on which even blast beats are used have their bright pleasure. Impressive performance just for the English scene, which is currently dominated mainly by various Black Metal bands!

review_body: Attention danger de passer à coté de ce film réalisé par Howard Hawks. Après "Rio Bravo" en 1959,film que je considère comme LE meilleur western de tous les temps, Howard Hawks récidive avec ce film familial d'aventures sorti en 1962. Certes, ce n'est pas de la veine épique de "Rio Bravo" mais en plus d'une troupe d'acteurs de premier plan vous jouissez de la faune que l'on peut considérer comme une partie intégrante des acteurs et des merveilleux paysages du Tanganyika ou "Hatari" à été tourné. De quoi passer une soirée ou un dimanche agréable en famille! J'oubliait de vous dire que ce film m'a été livré dans les meilleurs délais comme toujours avec Amazon!

review_body: Victoria est une jeune adulte tout juste sortie d'un des nombreux foyers qu'elle a connu tout au long de sa vie. Orpheline proposée à l'adoption, elle est passée de famille en famille jusqu'à ce que plus personne ne veuille d'elle. Pourtant, les flash-back de ce roman  révèlent une période ou elle a vécu aimée auprès d'Elisabeth. Que s'est il donc passé pour que Victoria à 18 ans se retrouve livrée à elle même, dormant dans la rue, fuyant le contact humain pour ne se réfugier que dans sa passion pour les fleurs et leur langage?  Une écriture simple mais agréable à lire, une structure qui donne à la fois envie de savoir ce qui a provoqué ce tournant dans le passé, mais aussi de savoir ce que cette jeune adulte inadaptée va devenir.  Bien que les talents multiples et innés de Victoria ne soient pas vraisemblables, ce roman devrait plaire à tout lecteur aimant les romans sentimentaux. Lecture inoubliable? Je ne pense pas, loin de là, mais j'aurais appris certaines choses sur les fleurs.
translated_review: Victoria is a young adult just out of one of the many homes she has experienced throughout her life. Orphan proposed for adoption, she went from family to family until no one wants her. Yet the flashback of this novel reveals a period or has lived with Elisabeth. What happened so that Victoria to 18 years old is delivered to her even, sleeping in the street, fleeing human contact to take refuge only in his passion for flowers and their language? A simple but pleasant writing to read, a structure that gives both the desire to know what caused this turning point in the past, but also to know what this inadequate young adult will become. Although Victoria's multiple and innate talents are not likely, this novel should please any player loving sentimental novels. Unforgettable reading? I do not think, far from there, but I would have learned some things about the flowers.

review_body: I was so excited on hearing Raising Steam was coming out, and on finishing it this morning I was left feeling.well, disappointed and terribly sad.  The Discworld series contains books that are laugh-out-loud funny, poignant, insightful, and wildly imaginative.  This book is none of those things.  Many of the other reviewers say this better than me, but the book is flat, confusing, dull, and the characterisation is so bizarre and inconsistent that I found myself getting increasing annoyed as I struggled on to the end.  Yes, there are ups and downs in the series, but this book just doesn't sound like Pratchett.  It feels like it's been ghost written by someone who's never read the books, and they're not even a good writer.  I am sure that the difficulty for TP in putting a book together have contributed to this.  I think he is a brilliant and brave man and I have been given so many happy hours of reading from his books that frankly I would carry on buying them out of loyalty to the series, but I'm not sure I could read another discworld book.  And unlike his others which I come back to time and time again I won't be re-reading this.  I cried when I read Thud! (at work, in the coffee room) but I'm sad now for a totally different reason.  Thank-you Terry Pratchett for your body of fantastic work, but this book does not belong with the rest.

The Discworld series contains books that are laugh-out-loud funny, poignant, insightful, and wildly imaginative.  This book is none of those things.  Many of the other reviewers say this better than me, but the book is flat, confusing, dull, and the characterisation is so bizarre and inconsistent that I found myself getting increasing annoyed as I struggled on to the end.  Yes, there are ups and downs in the series, but this book just doesn't sound like Pratchett.  It feels like it's been ghost written by someone who's never read the books, and they're not even a good writer.  I am sure that the difficulty for TP in putting a book together have contributed to this.  I think he is a brilliant and brave man and I have been given so many happy hours of reading from his books that frankly I would carry on buying them out of loyalty to the series, but I'm not sure I could read another discworld book.  And unlike his others which I come back to time and time again I won't be re-reading this.  I cried when I read Thud! (at work, in the coffee room) but I'm sad now for a totally different reason.  Thank-you Terry Pratchett for your body of fantastic work, but this book does not belong with the rest.

review_body: Julia Quinn doing what she does at her best - an enjoyable, fast paced bodice-ripper - the heroine is the overlooked sister (who has a secret life as a gossip writer), the hero is the brother of her friend (also with hidden depths) who looks beneath the drab surface to find the diamond beneath.  If you're looking for historical accuracy or high literature this isn't for you, however it is escapism at it's best.

If you're looking for historical accuracy or high literature this isn't for you, however it is escapism at it's best.

review_body: Sometimes I forget that this film was made in 1985. The only thing that reminds me is seeing how young the cast are, and the fact that a small 1% of the special effects are now by modern standards a little worse for wear and also the fact that CGI has not been lavished on it. But honestly, this film, and in many ways it's predecessor too, could have been made last year, that is just how fresh and up to date they remain for me and it's many fans.  Alien took the film world by storm in 1979, straight of the back of Star Wars success. In fact, Ridley Scott, on seeing the great Star Wars, was so influenced that he thought to himself "I want to be making movies like that". And hence he made a masterpiece as influential, successful and as different as Star Wars that has lived on to become a corner stone in sci-fi horror history.  A young director called James Cameron who initially found fame with his debut movie "The Terminator" decided to take up the challenge of a sequel to Alien, but he did not want to copy the original. He had a grander vision that would see an army of these Alien creatures battling against the Human race. Cameron was aware that the Vietnam war was still a hot topic in the US at the time, so he took his influence from the nature of the two sides of the war, the US war machine with all of it's technology and equipment fighting and an enemy that was not technically advanced, that knew the land, how to use the environment, used basic weapons and tactics to their advantage, thus negating most of advanced technology and mobility the US army claimed was superior. He applied that idea to this film and it worked so very well in that it made the Alien race seem all that more dangerous and lethal by removing most of the technology that would have made us superior. He thankfully treated the Alien race just as they were seen in the first movie, extremely hostile and only concerned with survival and reproduction, it could have been so easy to have portrayed them evil in intent, for myself, this portrayal still leaves a little ambiguity as to whether they are or are not truly intelligent beings.  The making of this movie was not easy, there were many problems with the cast, Director and British crew clashing due to differences in the way the USA and UK workers did there job. Stories of sackings that ended in strikes until the sacked members were bought back onto set, a lighting director who correctly did his job on the atmosphere processor scenes but was heavily criticised by Cameron for not achieving the pitch black look he wanted. There are tales of Cameron being driven to distraction by the UK workers frequent tea breaks, Lance Henriksen's distaste of being called "Lovey" and "Darling" by a unit director that nearly ended in a fight, the need to find another actor to play Hicks after the original actor pulled out (thanks the lord the excellent Michael Bien took the role) and finally the hostility the main "Marine" cast members felt about having to go through 6 weeks of military training by Cameron who wanted his troops to look and work together like troops and finally Al Mathews, a retired Marine Sergeant and the real deal "disarming" a fellow actor who pointed a prop gun at him in jest.  The DVD comes in a very nice metal tin with clear plastic centre that holds both disks. The print is beautifully clear, and sound quality is great. You get two versions of the movie here, the original theatrical release and the extended version that includes scenes edited out of the original release simply to save time and you can choose either version on the initial menu. The special features disk, whilst not being as all encompassing as the Blu ray release, is packed with information for us geeky knowledge lovers.  So go on, have a treat, load up the pulse rifle, tune up the motion tracker and turn up the surround to watch the movie that was once described as such "Watching this movie was like driving 10 miles of rocky road". Enjoys once described as such "Watching this movie was like driving 10 miles of rocky road". Enjoy

review_headline: City of Heavenly Fire (The Mortal Instruments)
review_body: A very nice book and a wonderful series! Indeed, Cassandra Clare managed very well to have a series of books where each book differs considerably from the next one in regards to the story and a bit in the way that is written. I specially found this book different from the previous but equally interesting. The author is great in keeping the reader in suspense and making him/her crave to find out what is coming next and how is the story ending.
translated_review: A very nice book and a wonderful series! Indeed, Cassandra Clare managed very well to have a series of books where each book differs considerably from the next one in regards to the story and a bit in the way that is written. I specially found this book different from the previous but equally interesting. The author is great in keeping the reader in suspense and making him/her crave to find out what is coming next and how is the story ending.

review_body: Hut ab vor der filmischen Umsetzung des Romans von Elfriede Jelinek, und vor allem vor der schauspielerischen Glanz- und Höchstleistung und dem Mut von Isabelle Huppert! Es gelingt ihr, indem sie sich selbst bis fast zur Selbstaufgabe entblößt und preisgibt, den tiefsten Abgründen und der Zerrissenheit einer Menschenseele Ausdruck zu verleihen. Respekt! Welche Kraft muß sie diese Rolle gekostet haben?, welch eine Herausforderung muß diese dargestellt haben?  Daß ein solcher Stoff polarisieren muß, ist nicht verwunderlich, er stellt eine Provokation, eine Herausforderung und ein Wagnis dar, aber weshalb der Vertreiber des Films plakativ  und in Großbuchstaben mit \"OBSZÖN, SKANDALÖS, PERVERS\" auf dem Cover hausieren geht, will mir nicht in den Kopf. Soll hiermit eine bestimmte Käuferklientel geködert werden? Dieser Versuch ist zum Scheitern verurteilt; Spießbürger, die nicht zu ihren eigenen Schwächen und Seelenabgründen stehen können, diese vielleicht nicht einmal kennen, werden sowohl Buch als auch Film verreißen; es ist dies kein Stoff für die breite Masse, die nichts erwartet als billig unterhalten zu sein.  Buch und Film ergänzen sich auf spannende, intensive Weise, wobei es nicht einmal so sehr um Bilder geht, sondern um Töne. Wo das Buch mediumsbedingt stumm bleiben muß, hört man im Film all die klassischen Musikstücke, die eine doch so große Rolle spielen und eine ungeahnte Authentizität erzeugen.   In seiner Ausführlichkeit jedoch ist das Buch der filmischen Umsetzung überlegen; im Buch wird die wahre Intention von Klemmer (man beachte den Namen - nomen est omen) sehr deutlich gemacht, im Film hingegen könnte man glauben, er fühlte wirklich hehre Liebe für seine Klavierlehrerin. In der Tat ist es so, daß ich das Buch auf andere Weise interpretiere, als dies im Film getan wird, doch dies tut einem wahren Kunstwerk natürlich keinen Abbruch, und richtige Kunst hat immer kontrovers zu sein. Wer die Konfrontation mit den schwarzen Flecken auf der Landkarte der eigenen Seele nicht scheut, wer Drama und Dramatik sucht und bereit ist, sich auf eine Erfahrung einzulassen, die Denkmuster verändern kann, sollte sich diesen Film anschauen; der  Kaufpreis ist günstig bemessen. Allerdings halte ich die FSK-Einstufung von 16 Jahren für verfehlt; es scheint mir doch eher ein Film für ein deutlich älteres, gereifteres Publikum zu sein.  Fünf Sterne als von mir für den kolossalen Mut, den Isabelle Huppert hier auf DVD als \"Die Klavierspielerin\" beweist!
translated_review: Hat from the cinematic implementation of the novel of Elfriede Jelinek, and above all before the acting gloss and maximum performance and the courage of Isabelle Huppert! It succeeds in helping themselves until almost the self-presentation and priced to express the deepest abyss and the tearing of a human soul. Respect! What force must she have cost this role?, What a challenge must have represented these? That such a substance must polarize is not surprising, he represents a provocation, a challenge and a venture, which is why the distributor of the film is placant and in capital letters with \ "obscene, scandalous, pervers \" goes on the cover, wants to place on the cover I do not have my head. Should a specific buyer list be united? This attempt is sentenced to failure; Spicy citizens who can not stand their own weaknesses and soul forces, may not even know them, will tear both book and film; This is not a substance for the wide mass that does not expect anything expected to be cheap. Book and film complement each other at an exciting, intense manner, but not even so much about pictures, but about sounds. Where the book must remain silent due to medium, one hears in the film all the classical pieces of music, which play a big role and generate unimagined authenticity. In its detail, however, is superior to the book of cinematic implementation; In the book, the true intention of Klemmer (note the name - Nomen Est Omen) is made very clear, in the film, however, one could believe he felt really noble love for his piano teacher. In fact, it is so that I interpret the book in other ways than this is done in the movie, but this does not demolish a true artwork, and right art is always controversial. If you do not shy the confrontation with the black spots on the map of your own soul, who is looking for drama and drama and is ready to get involved in an experience that can change mind patterns, should look at this movie; The purchase price is designed favorable. However, I consider the FSK classification of 16 years for missing; It seems to me a movie for a significantly older, ripened audience. Five stars than from me for the colossal courage, the Isabelle Huppert here on DVD as \ "The Piano Player \" proves!

review_headline: Harry Potter und die Kammer des Schreckens
review_body:
\"19 zusätzliche/längere Szenen\"
Mit diesen Worten auf der Rückseite der Packung, erhoffte ich mir einen ähnlichen Directors Cut, den auch Herr der Ringe erleben durfte (die special extendet edition).
Doch leider wurden meine Erwartungen diesbezüglich Enttäuscht.
Zum Film selbst kann ich nur sagen, das er einfach genial ist.
Leider wurde aus mir unverständlichen Gründen auf der DVD veröffentlichung die gekürzte Kinofassung verwendet.
Natürlich fällt es jemandem, der nicht weiß was fehlen sollte, nicht im geringsten auf.
Wer unbedingt, die ungekürzte 2 bis 3 minuten längere Fassung sehen will, dem empfehle ich die DVD direkt aus denstaaten zu bestellen. Ich jedenfalls wünsche mir, genau wie bei dem ersten Teil, eine Art directors Cut, in dem die fehlenden Szenen enthalten sind. Und dabei meine ich nicht die 2 fehlenden minuten, sondern die 19 zusätzlichen, die man auf der Bonus DVD anschauen kann. (4 Sterne von 5)

\ "19 additional / longer scenes \"
With these words on the back of the pack, I hoped for a similar director Cut, which also Lord of the rings were allowed to experience (the Special Extend Edition).
Unfortunately, myExpands disappointed in this regard.
To the film itself, I can only say that he is simply ingenious.
Unfortunately, incomprehensible reasons on the DVD publishing the shortened theatrical version used.
Of course it falls it someone who does not knowWhat should be missing, not in the slightest.
Who necessarily wants to see the unabridged 2 to 3 minutes longer version, I recommend to order the DVD directly from the states.Anyway, I wish me, just like the first part, a kind of Directors Cut in which the missing scenes are included.And I do not mean the 2 missing minutes, but the 19 additional, which you can watch on the Bonus DVD.(4 stars out of 5)

review_headline: GasLand ou le nouveau NO MAN'S LAND
review_body: Arte sait choisir des reportages de qualité. Josh Fox, nous montre la réalité de l'exploitation du gaz de schiste aux USA et les catastrophes environnementales, économiques et humaines qu'elle entraîne. Niveau développement durable c'est 0 pointé ! A regarder avant de se faire une opinion sur le sujet. A noter que toutes les parties concernées ont reçues des demandes d'interview, mais que certaines d'entre elles n'ont jamais donné suite (on se demande qui hein ?).
translated_review: ARTE knows how to choose quality reports.Josh Fox shows us the reality of shale gas exploitation in the US and the environmental, economic and human disasters it entails.Sustainable development level It's 0 pointed!To watch before making an opinion on the subject.It should be noted that all parties involved have received requests for interview, but some of them have never responded (one wonders who huh?).

review_headline: Diamonds On The Inside - Copy control
review_body:
Ce Cd est tout bonnement merveilleux, meme si il m'a un peu moins plu que le précédent, Burn to shine, car il ya moins de verve, le rythme est plus calme.
Je salue au passage un tres bel hommage de ben a la France avec de l'accordéon sur l'un des titres. D'apres Ben, c'est edith piaf qui lui a inspiré cet hommage.
En tout cas achetez-le, il est indispensable et c'est surement l'album du mois, croyez-moi.
translated_review:
This CD is simply wonderful, even if it has a little less than the previous one, Burn to Shine, because there is less verve, the rhythm is quieter.
I salute a very beautiful tribute toBen in France with accordion on one of the titles.According to Ben, Edith Piaf inspired this tribute.
In any case buy it, it is essential and it is surely the album of the month, believe me.

review_headline: Best Monty Python film, one of the best slapstick films ever
review_body: Life of Brian is the story of an ordinary boy who keeps on getting confused with \"The Messiah\", and it is set in Jerusalem around the time of the birth of Jesus Christ. It is by far and away the best Monty Python film. It is intelligent, hilarious, has got some great acting, and the on-location scenery is wonderful. It is probably one of the best overall \"slapstick\" comedy films of the last 30 years. If you were to own only two \"slapstick\" films of the last 30 years, you'd probably want this DVD, and \"Airplane\". Most people are now aware of Monty Python-type humour, so I don't feel I need to go into too much detail here. But the film starts with the mother (played squeakily by a man) of Brian trying to throw the 3 Wise Men out of her house: \"Led by a star? Led by a bottle more like\". It has some other unforgettable scenes which would stand alone as Monty Python comedy sketches, and have passed into myth over the years: the graffiti scene, the Judean people's front scene, the stoning scene, and of course the sing-along climax of which I will say no more - you've _got_ to see that for yourself! A word of warning. If you are a Christian, you may find the film a little insulting to your faith. I am not, so I had no problem with the humour myself. Overall this is a DVD that is actually worth owning rather than just renting. Very funny and sophisticated.

product_title: Fisher-Price Go Baby Go Sit-To-Stand Giraffe Activity Tower
review_body: I bought this for my 8 month old son thinking this would help him in his standing and sitting phase. But despite the large paddles that look like they would keep giraffe stable, he is not able to haul himself up to stand on the \"ears\" as it tips onto him! There needs to be a weight in the base Fisher Price! So if you are looking to get this, be sure your child is competant at standing on their own.  We did manage to get all the parts in place and do not have problems with the balls rolling down it.

product_title: World War Z [Coffret Métal, Édition Limitée et Numérotée]
review_headline: Un film de zombies d'excellente facture, largement supérieur à la moyenne des blockbusters
review_body: Quand un film de genre démarre sur un excellent générique, cela est souvent le signe d’une qualité élevée. Jetez un œil à ceux de Seven, Négociateur, JCVD, Sacré Graal, Zombieland, etc. A contrario, ceux des Michael Bay, par exemple, sont soit sans intérêt, soit très limités (voire réduits au seul titre, genre Transformers). Celui de World war Z est visuellement très intéressant, et crée un parallèle inattendu entre l’épidémie de zombification et le (soi-disant) réchauffement climatique, sur un mode de malédiction de Cassandre (genre : je vous avais prévenu dit mais vous ne m’avez pas cru). Quoi qu’on pense du discours, le procédé est intéressant, en plus d’être visuellement très bien mis en valeur.  World war Z est donc un film de zombies. Oui, encore. Mais il y a Brad Pitt, qui choisit toujours ses films avec soin. Et il y a Marc Forster aux commandes, lui qui est plutôt habitué de films bons et originaux ([[ASIN:B00B1J9WJO Neverland]], [[ASIN:B000KIX6JE Stay]], [[ASIN:B001B0LYXU Les cerfs-volants de Kaboul]]). Le concept pourrait se résumer à un croisement, classique et réussi, entre [[ASIN:B00DRFJNKI 28 jours/semaines plus tard]] (pour l’épidémie, ses ravages et ses victimes) et [[ASIN:B00004VYMM Alerte!]] (pour l’intrigue et les bons acteurs). La tension est absolument permanente, mais résulte moins de la peur de se faire choper par les non-morts furieux que de l’urgence de la course au remède avant qu’il n’y ait plus personne à sauver. Les effets de surprise sont utilisés avec pertinence, et on nous épargne heureusement les faux suspenses clichés (genre le personnage secondaire qui avance lentement sur fond de musique stressante pour se retrouver face à un chat qui miaule et se fait soudain agresser par derrière). Au contraire, le spectateur sait en permanence d’où la menace peut venir, et c’est ce sentiment tragique d’inéluctabilité qui suscite la tension. C’est plus original qu’il n’y paraît, et mérite d’être remarqué.  Si l’intrigue est de facture très classique, le film repose plutôt sur son acteur principal qui nous évite les poncifs du héros-qui-sait-tout-mieux-que-les-autres (mais malheureusement pas ceux de ses improbables survies), ainsi que sur une série de visuels très forts (la colonne de morts qui grimpe aux murs est mémorable), servis par des effets spéciaux sans défaut. On notera quelques maquillages un peu outranciers, mais rien de rédhibitoire, et surtout on appréciera l’improbable quasi-absence de sang et de gore pendant tout le film (pas de gros plan de visage de zombie avec des viscères entre les dents, pas de tête qui explose après la douce caresse d’un fusil à pompe, etc).  World war Z est donc une nouvelle variation sur une épidémie de zombies, à l’intrigue aussi tendue que classique, portée par un agréable Brad Pitt, et réalisée avec beaucoup de soin et de sérieux, sans gore inutile. Sans être le film de l’année, c’est un blockbuster d’indéniable qualité.qu’il n’y paraît, et mérite d’être remarqué. World war Z est donc une nouvelle variation sur une épidémie de zombies, à l’intrigue aussi tendue que classique, portée par un agréable Brad Pitt, et réalisée avec beaucoup de soin et de sérieux, sans gore inutile. Sans être le film de l’année, c’est un blockbuster d’indéniable qualité.

That of World War Z is visually very interesting, and creates an unexpected parallel between the zombification epidemic and the (so-called) global warming, on a Cassandre mode of curse (kind: I warned you said but you do not 'have not believed). Whatever we think about speech, the process is interesting, in addition to being visually highly highlighted. World War Z is a zombie film. Yes again. But there is Brad Pitt, who always chooses his films carefully. And there is Marc Forster at the orders, which is rather used to good and original films ([Asin: B00B1J9WJO Neverland]], [[Asin: B000Kix6je Stay]], [[Asin: B001B0LYXU Kabul Kelfs] ]). The concept could be summed up at a cross, classic and successful, between [Asin: B00Drfjnki 28 days / weeks later]] (for the epidemic, its havoc and its victims) and [Asin: B00004Vymm alert!]] ( for the plot and good actors). The tension is absolutely permanent, but results less from the fear of being shocked by the unaware of the urgency of the race to the cure before there is no one to save. The effects of surprise are used with relevance, and we happily spare the false suspense clichés (genre the secondary character who slowly advances on a stressful music background to meet with a chat that meals and is suddenly attacking from behind). On the contrary, the viewer continuously knows where the threat can come, and it is this tragic feeling of ineluctability that arouses tension. It's more original than it seems, and deserves noticed. If the plot is very classic invoice, the film rests rather on its main actor who avoids the pundilate of the hero-quite-all-better-than-other (but unfortunately not those of his improbable survival), As well as on a series of very strong visuals (the dead column that climbs to the walls is memorable), served by special effects without defect. Note a few make-up a little outstanding, but nothing edriocious, and especially we will appreciate the unlikely almost no blood and gore throughout the film (no close-up of zombie face with viscera between the teeth, no Head exploding after the soft caress of a pump rifle, etc.). World War Z is therefore a new variation on an epidemic of zombies, in the intrigue as tense as classic, carried by a pleasant Brad Pitt, and realized with great care and serious, without unnecessary gore. World War Z is therefore a new variation on an epidemic of zombies, in the intrigue as tense as classic, carried by a pleasant Brad Pitt, and realized with great care and serious, without unnecessary gore. Without being the movie of the year, it's an undeniable quality blockbuster.

If it is the visual element of having the picture disc that you want, you won't be disappointed.

review_body:
Die CD TAMBU gehört mit zu den Höhepunken des mir bisher bekannten Schaffens dieser Band, weil sie den vielseitigen Bogen spannt zwischen sehr melodiösen und eingängigen - fast traurigen - Stücken und rockigen - in den Jazz hinein reichenden - Kompositionen.
Der msuikalische Bogen weist aber trotz aller Vielseitigkeit keinerlei Brüche auf.
Was mich bei dieser CD neben den musikalischen Qualitäten am meisten beeindruckt hat, war die Tontechnik mit ein Dynamik, die ich bei den vorangegangenen CD's dieser Band so noch nicht erlebt hatte.
Alleine schon von daher ist die CD auf einer guten HiFi-Anlage absolut hörenswert.
Im Verbund mit den musikalischen Qualitäten ist diese CD ein absolutes Muß für jeden Freund handwerklich excellent gemachter Arbeit von Musikern, die an ihren Instrumenten wissen, was sie tun - wo gibt es das noch in Zeiten von Britneys Spears & Co?
translated_review:
The CD Tambu belongs to the gravity of that known to me so far known to me so far, because it spans the versatile bow between very melodious and catchy - almost sad - pieces and rock - in the jazz - compositions.However, despite all versatility, the msuical bow has no fractions.
What impressed me in this CD next to the musical qualities most was the sound engineering with a dynamic, which I do not yet in the previous CD's this bandhad experienced.Alone alone therefore the CD is absolutely worth listening to a good hi-fi system.
In combination with the musical qualities, this CD is an absolute must for every friend craftsmanship excellent work of musicians who know about their instruments, what they do - where is it still in times of Britney Spears & Co?

review_body: This is Zeppelin's anti-matter album. When they recorded Physical Graffiti they were at the height of their dominance, kings of the world; here, only a year later, the band has been shaken by a series of problems and disenchantment is in the air. Cut to the root, Zeppelin grew back into an unfamiliar, Spartan shape: no acoustic numbers, no keyboards, shorter solos, a minimum of overdubs. Before, 'tight but loose' was the philosophy; here 'loose' has gone and they're almost all rhythm section, locked together in their intricate patterns as closely as a table football midfield. Plant, affected by illness, can no longer produce the flamethrower vocals of the early years - in fact he and Page sound almost like entirely different musicians - and his lyrics are sour and cynical about the very things that had made his the most fun life on the planet.  So, it doesn't give you the euphoric blues-rock Zep had patented, nor does it give you their full palate of moods and colours. What it gives you is intensity: it's angry, it's funky, it thrums with dark energy. It turned out to be the beginning of the end, but at this point they still justified Plant's comment: 'It's not just that we're the best band in the world. It's that we're so much better than whoever is supposed to be number two'.
translated_review: This is Zeppelin's anti-matter album. When they recorded Physical Graffiti they were at the height of their dominance, kings of the world; here, only a year later, the band has been shaken by a series of problems and disenchantment is in the air. Cut to the root, Zeppelin grew back into an unfamiliar, Spartan shape: no acoustic numbers, no keyboards, shorter solos, a minimum of overdubs. Before, 'tight but loose' was the philosophy; here 'loose' has gone and they're almost all rhythm section, locked together in their intricate patterns as closely as a table football midfield. Plant, affected by illness, can no longer produce the flamethrower vocals of the early years - in fact he and Page sound almost like entirely different musicians - and his lyrics are sour and cynical about the very things that had made his the most fun life on the planet.  So, it doesn't give you the euphoric blues-rock Zep had patented, nor does it give you their full palate of moods and colours. What it gives you is intensity: it's angry, it's funky, it thrums with dark energy. It turned out to be the beginning of the end, but at this point they still justified Plant's comment: 'It's not just that we're the best band in the world. It's that we're so much better than whoever is supposed to be number two'.

review_headline: An Explanation - Don't Read Before Viewing
review_body: Many people on here mark this film down because they didn't understand it, which seems pretty unfair.  The film does work, and there is a plausible explanation. There is a logic to it as the writer/director spent many years on it & all is intended.  The simple explanation is: they are all killed (except one) in the boat accident & this is Jess's hell.  We are told TWICE in the film the story of Sisyphus whose personal hell repeats forever and this is Jess's.  We come into the film well into the loop, with many iterations completed.  In the original time arc, Jess killed Tommy - that's why her earlier self distracts her later self & then rescues him.  But you don't escape hell that easily & so the cycle continues.  You may now say \"Well, watching this film was my idea of hell\" but I think it was a well-shot, well-crafted movie that tries to do something different.  The main influence I saw in it was a book by Flann O'Brien called \"The Third Policeman\" where someone commits a murder & so begins a surreal journey that is eventually revealed to be a repeating hell. Very different tone to this, but I'd recommend it, and it's well-priced on Amazon. And a film of another of his books is due for release in 2010 with Colin Farrell.

We are told TWICE in the film the story of Sisyphus whose personal hell repeats forever and this is Jess's.  We come into the film well into the loop, with many iterations completed.  In the original time arc, Jess killed Tommy - that's why her earlier self distracts her later self & then rescues him.  But you don't escape hell that easily & so the cycle continues.  You may now say \"Well, watching this film was my idea of hell\" but I think it was a well-shot, well-crafted movie that tries to do something different.  The main influence I saw in it was a book by Flann O'Brien called \"The Third Policeman\" where someone commits a murder & so begins a surreal journey that is eventually revealed to be a repeating hell. Very different tone to this, but I'd recommend it, and it's well-priced on Amazon. And a film of another of his books is due for release in 2010 with Colin Farrell.

review_body: This is a tour de force of Will Smith, as he shows yet again what a clever and subtle actor he is.    The story follows Chris Gardner as he tries to pull his life back together after a series of troubles, but the keys to why this is at least a 4 star movie lie in the characters. Will Smith is superb as Gardner, Smith's son is charming as Gardner's son Christopher, and the supporting cast are always believable. Without spoiling the plot I can't say anything except that there will be tears and smiles throughout from anyone with a heart! Well worth the money.

review_body: Das neue Album Biophilia ist für mich ihr bisher schlechtestes.  Zwar erspart sie den geneigten Hörer ganz extreme Totalausfälle, wie es auf Volta die \"Timbaland-Tracks\" waren, allerdings ist Biophilia nahezu durch die Bank hindurch langatmig, eintönig und simpel.  Zur Musik:  Die 10 Stücke (bzw. 13 in der Spec. Ed.) haben alle ungefähr das gleiche Tempo. Das wirkt auf die Dauer ermüdend. Packende, eingängige Melodien sucht man vergebens. Dafür findet man häufig simple, repetetive Loops und Beats.  Teilweise verläuft das Album an einem vorbei, ohne dass man sich erinnern kann, was man eigentlich gerade gehört hat.  Der Gesang:  Gesangstechnisch ist hier alles solide wie man es von Frau Gudmundsdottir gewohnt ist. Allerdings gibt es kaum Spielereien oder Experimente. Die Lautstärke und die Tonhöhen variieren bei diesem Album im Vergleich zu anderen Björk-Alben leider kaum.  Die Texte:  Thematisch geht es um das Entstehen von Materie, Leben, Existenz und Vergehen.  Das ganze verläuft aber so dermaßen Lehrbuchartig, dass man sich an laienhafte Unterrichtsstunden in Biologie, Physik und Chemie erinnert fühlt.  Die Glanzperlen:  Das einzige Stück was mich richtig fesselt ist \"Thunderbolt\". Es hat eine sehr starke bass-line und packt einen sofort mit. \"Thunderbolt\" ist ein Track der neu, frisch und gleichzeitig sehr gut ausgearbeitet klingt.  \"Virus\" und \"Moon\" sind auch noch recht gut hörbar.  Die Totalausfälle:  \"Hollow\" und \"Dark Matter\" sind zwei Stücke, die sich jeder musikalischen Zugänglichkeit entziehen und die mir persönlich keinerlei Hörgenuss bereiten.  An \"Cosmogony\" hingegen stört mich, dass es mich musikalisch sehr stark an das Stück \"When the body speaks\" (vom Album Exciter) von Depeche Mode erinnert.  Da ich ein großer Fan bin und bisher alle Alben (mit Einschränken Volta) sehr gut fand, ist Biophilia für mich eine große Enttäuschung.  Vielleicht sollte sich Björk in Zukunft wieder auf das wesentliche konzentrieren, nämlich auf die Musik und diesen ganzen Apple Application Irrsinn verwerfen.  Dann klappts auch vielleicht wieder mit der Musik.

Although she spares the inclined handset very extreme total losses, as it was on Volta the \ "Timbaland Tracks \", but Biophilia is almost through the bank long-breathy, monotonous and simple. To music: the 10 pieces (or 13 in the spec. Ed.) All about the same pace. That affects the duration tiring. Gripping, catchy melodies are awarded. For this you often find Simple, Repetential Loops and Beats. Partly the album runs past one without remembering what you have just heard. The vocals: vocal technology here is all solid as it is used by Mrs. Gudmundsdottir. However, there are hardly any gambling or experiments. The volume and the pitches are unfortunately hardly varied with this album compared to other Björk albums. The texts: Thematically it is about the emergence of matter, life, existence and offenses. However, the whole thing runs as so teaching that one feels reminded of laiahrous lessons in biology, physics and chemistry. The gloss pearls: the only bit that captivates me correctly \ "Thunderbolt \". It has a very strong bass line and packs an immediately. "Thunderbolt \" is a track of new, fresh and at the same time very well developed. "Virus \" and \ "Moon \" are still quite audible. The total losses: \ "Hollow \" and \ "Dark Matter \" are two pieces that escape any musical accessibility and who personally do not give me a listening pleasure personally. On the other hand, the "Cosmogony \" bothers me that it is musically very strongly reminiscent of the piece \ "When The Body Speaks \" (from the Album Exciter) by Depeche Mode. Since I'm a big fan and so far all albums (with restricting Volta) found very good, Biophilia is a great disappointment for me. Maybe in the future, Björk should focus on the essentials, namely the music and this whole Apple Application Irishes reject. Then maybe may work with the music again.

product_title: The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer
review_body: For all the glowing reviews this book has received, I expected something quite special. But the style is painfully long-winded and the science curiously patchy on this most important of subjects. The book is fairly typical of the current vogue of north American \"blockbuster\" scientific narrative - full of historical detail that gives the impression of genuine scholarship but which turns out on closer examination to be sometimes rather superficial and in places erroneous. For all its faults, however, there is quite a lot that can be learnt from it and for this it is to be commended. It's just a pity that it could have been so much better with a bit of well-informed editing.
translated_review: For all the glowing reviews this book has received, I expected something quite special. But the style is painfully long-winded and the science curiously patchy on this most important of subjects. The book is fairly typical of the current vogue of north American \"blockbuster\" scientific narrative - full of historical detail that gives the impression of genuine scholarship but which turns out on closer examination to be sometimes rather superficial and in places erroneous. For all its faults, however, there is quite a lot that can be learnt from it and for this it is to be commended. It's just a pity that it could have been so much better with a bit of well-informed editing.

On est toujours tenté de vouloir trouver le produit ayant un design sympa au meilleur prix. et qui remplit sa fonction sans tomber en panne au bout de qq jours. Ce chargeur a le mérite en tout cas de faire ce qu'on lui demande ! Il charge mon Lg G2, même avec le gps en fonctionnement, certes plus lentement mais au final c'est pareil que si vous utilisiez votre téléphone fortement (sur un jeu par exemple) et le chargeant sur secteur. Bref pas mécontent de cet achat, surtout à moitié prix !

product_title: Kisses on the Bottom - Édition Limitée (Digipack + 2 Titres Bonus)
review_body: J' ai écouté ce disque sur 3 système Sonores différents. Sur le phonemachin très couteux d'un ami et ma foi c'était agréable sans plus; Ensuite dans la voiture avec super sono d'un collègue; Et je découvre un excellent disque de McCartney, surprenant et sympa à écouter. Je me dis je vais l'acheter. Ma compagne me l'offre et je l'écoute sur un système Hifi de prestige astronomiquement coûteux et là.une super claque. Le travail de la voix de Paul, les inflexions, la diction très british, le mixage parfait et un son houlà là: tout en finesse en perfection. Ce disque est une merveille et en réécoutant d'autres disques de Paul avec Wings, puis en solo, puis le double blanc des Beatles j' ai immédiatement 2 évidences; Une super chaîne Hifi c'est cher mais quel régal incomparable et ensuite je comprends une fois encore pourquoi les Beatles et Paul sont tellement différents de tout ce qui se fait depuis 50 ans et la raison profonde. Le Nec Plus Ultra, le génie réel. Du coup en pop il ne reste pas grand chose aux autres créateurs sauf bien sûr un modèle parfait, intemporel, qui traverse les époques sans prendre une ride. Déjà classique et donc indémodable.

On the very expensive phonemachin of a friend and my faith was nice no more; Then in the car with super sono of a colleague; And I discover a great disk of McCartney, surprising and nice to listen. I tell myself I'll buy it. My companion offers me and I listen to an astronomically expensive prestige hi-fi system and there. A super slap. Paul's voice work, inflections, very British diction, the perfect mix and one houl at there: all finesse in perfection. This disc is a wonder and listening to other Paul's discs with Wings, then solo, then the double white of the Beatles I immediately have 2 evidences; A great HiFi chain it's expensive but what unparalleled treat and then I understand once again why the Beatles and Paul are so different from everything that has been done for 50 years and the deep reason. The ultimate, real engineering. From the blow to pop there is not much left to the other designers except of course a perfect, timeless, which crosses the epoch without taking a ride. Already classic and therefore timeless.

review_body: Ich finde es absolut erstaunlich, wie hier die Meinungen über diesen dritten Craig-Bond polarisieren. Da wird auf einmal über Logik gesprochen oder über fehlende Gadgets oder es wird der Quantum-Organisation hinterhergejammert. Fakt ist doch: In Bond-Filmen ging es noch nie um Logik, sondern um Action, schöne Frauen, schöne Spielorte und einen coolen Hauptdarsteller. Und, liebe Bond-Fans, ich kann Sie beruhigen: Das ist alles drin :-) Ich finde es gut, dass auch Bond sich entwickelt und nicht in der 60er Jahren hängengeblieben ist, wie sich manche zu wünschen scheinen. Ich mag die alten Bonds, aber würde ein Film heutzutage in diesem Stil gedreht werden, würde wahrscheinlich kein Mensch ins Kino gehen. Sollten Sie dieses Meisterwerk im Kino verpasst haben, dann schnappen Sie sich ein kühles Getränk und was zu knabbern, lehnen Sie sich zurück und genießen diesen Top-Film. Ein geniales Hybrid aus alt und neu mit Szenen, die einen mit Ihrer Bildgewalt völlig verzaubern und einem überragenden Daniel Craig, der zum ersten Mal die Gebrochenheit dieser Figur a la Flemming (ja, hab ich mal gelesen) verkörpert. Nur ein Tipp: Wenn Sie des Englischen mächtig sind, schauen Sie die Originalfassung, da Javier Bardem's deutsche Synchronstimme echt grauenvoll ist.
translated_review: I find it absolutely amazing how here the opinions about this third Craig-Bond polarize. There is talked about logic at once or about missing gadgets or the quantum organization is hidden behind. Fact is: In Bond films, it has never been logic, but action, beautiful women, beautiful venues and a cool leading actor. And, dear bond fans, I can reassure them: that's all in it :-) I think it's good that Bond is also developed and did not hurt in the 60s, as some seem to desire. I like the old bonds, but a movie would be shot in this style nowadays, would probably not go to the cinema. If you missed this masterpiece in the cinema, then grab a cool drink and what to nibble, lean back and enjoy this top movie. An ingenious hybrid from old and new with scenes that enchant a completely enchant with their image violence and a superior Daniel Craig, who for the first time the brokenness of this figure a la flemming (yes, I once read). Only one tip: If you are powerful to English, look at the original version, as Javier Bardem's German synchronous part is really horrible.

review_headline: Schändung eines Jahrhundertkunstwerks durch falsches Bildformat
review_body: Vorbemerkung: Diese Rezension bezieht sich auf die Blu-ray, die DVD-Ausgabe besitzt das richtige Bildformat und ist somit uneingeschränkt empfehlenswert.  Barry Lyndon ist ein Film von atemberaubender Schönheit. Er ist ein Kunstwerk im Bildformat 1-1:66, wie der Künstler ausdrücklich in einem Brief an die Filmvorführer geschrieben hat:  \"'Barry Lyndon' was photographed in 1-1:66 aspect ratio. Please be sure you project it at this ratio, and in no event at less than 1-1:75\" (Brief Stanley Kubricks von 1975, siehe z.B. unter [.])  Tatsache ist, dass diese Blu-Ray im Bildformat 1.77:1 vorliegt. Dies bedeutet, dass das Bild oben und unten abgeschnitten wurde, in der Folge fehlt zum einen Bildinhalt, zum anderen ist die Bildkomposition zerstört.  Zugegeben, bei vielen Filmen mag eine solches Tun nur unwesentliche Auswirkungen haben: Ob bei den Werken von Bunuel, Rohmer oder Godard das Bild etwas abgeschnitten wird oder nicht fällt überwiegend nicht auf - ist aber natürlich trotzdem absolut abzulehnen. Hier aber liegt der Fall fundamental anders: Kubrick zeigte sich mit unbeschreiblicher Sorgfalt für jeden nur denkbaren Aspekt seiner Filme wie Bild, Ton, Schnitt, Synchronfassungen oder Werbung endverantwortlich. Die Bilder in seinen Filmen und insbesondere in Barry Lyndon sind in ihrer Großartigkeit einzigartig in der Filmgeschichte. Sie zu verstümmeln bedeutet, einen wesentlichen Bestandteil dessen zu zerstören, was dieses Kunstwerk ausmacht, würde Kubrick noch leben würde er diesen Angriff auf seine künstlerische Integrität - nur um für den uninformierten Kunden mit 16:9 werben zu können (?) - niemals zulassen.  Es ist sehr bedauerlich, dass bei Warner neuerdings kein Respekt mehr vor der Kunstform Film vorhanden zu sein scheint. Barry Lyndon ist nämlich hierbei bei weitem kein Einzelfall, auch z.B. Shining ist genauso wie Eyes Wide Shut auf Blu-Ray nur verschnitten erhältlich. Und dies obwohl die DVD zu Eyes Wide Shut noch im korrekten 4:3-Format erhältlich war, für uninformierte Kunden blendete man einfach vor Filmstart die Meldung ein, dass dies dem Wunsch des Künstlers entsprach. Was ist seitdem bei Warner passiert, warum geht dies heutzutage nicht mehr?  Nicht besser wird dieser Umstand dadurch, dass auch andere Unternehmen derartige Untaten begehen: Bei einem anderen singulären Werk der Filmgeschichte, Josef von Sternbergs \"The Scarlet Empress\", dass visuell ebenfalls von allerhöchstem Rang ist, hat Universal auch das Bild verschnitten.wie Eyes Wide Shut auf Blu-Ray nur verschnitten erhältlich. Und dies obwohl die DVD zu Eyes Wide Shut noch im korrekten 4:3-Format erhältlich war, für uninformierte Kunden blendete man einfach vor Filmstart die Meldung ein, dass dies dem Wunsch des Künstlers entsprach. Was ist seitdem bei Warner passiert, warum geht dies heutzutage nicht mehr?  Nicht besser wird dieser Umstand dadurch, dass auch andere Unternehmen derartige Untaten begehen: Bei einem anderen singulären Werk der Filmgeschichte, Josef von Sternbergs \"The Scarlet Empress\", dass visuell ebenfalls von allerhöchstem Rang ist, hat Universal auch das Bild verschnitten.
translated_review: Preliminary remark: This review refers to the Blu-ray, the DVD output has the right image format and is therefore fully recommended. Barry Lyndon is a movie of breathtaking beauty. He is a work of art in the image format 1-1: 66, as the artist expressly wrote in a letter to the film compartments: \ "'Barry Lyndon' What photographed in 1-1: 66 ASPECT Ratio. Please be sure you project it at this RATIO, AND IN NO EVENT AT LESS THAN 1-1: 75 \ "(Brief Stanley Kubricks from 1975, see eg under [.]) Fact is that this Blu-ray is present in the picture format 1.77: 1. This means that the image was cut up and down, in the sequence is missing for a picture content, on the other hand, the image composition is destroyed. Granted, in many films may have such a doing only insignificant effects: whether in the works of Bunuel, Rohmer or Godard the picture is cut off a bit or does not precipitate predominantly not - but is still absolutely to reject. Here, however, the case is fundamentally different: Kubrick pointed with indescribable care for every conceivable aspect of his films such as image, sound, cut, synchronous detections or advertising end responsible. The pictures in his films and especially in Barry Lyndon are unique in their greatness in film history. Mutilating them means destroying an integral part of what this work of art makes up, Kubrick would still live, he would be able to advertise this attack on his artistic integrity - only to advertise for the uninformed customers with 16: 9 (?) - Never allow. It is very unfortunate that at Warner, no more respect for the art form film appears to be available. Barry Lyndon is far from no single case, e.g. Shining is just like Eyes Wide Shut on Blu-ray only mixed. And though the DVD to Eyes Wide Shut was still available in the correct 4: 3 format, for uninformed customers, you simply remove the message before the start of movie that this corresponded to the desire of the artist. What happened since Warner, why is this no longer possible today? This fact is not better in that other companies also commit such unatants: with another singular work of the film history, Josef von Sternbergs \ "The Scarlet Empress \" that is also visually from the highest rank, universal also has the picture blasted. How Eyes Wide Shut on Blu-ray only mixed. And though the DVD to Eyes Wide Shut was still available in the correct 4: 3 format, for uninformed customers, you simply remove the message before the start of movie that this corresponded to the desire of the artist. product_title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
review_headline: Deep as all the Seven Seas
review_body: Neil Gaiman is the Ted Hughes of story tellers. His work is dark and sinister but never without hope. This is his best book since American Gods, a conjuring trick of a book, so masterfully written you can't see how it's done. He has the ability to describe things that are not there, but which somehow are when you've read his words. Here we have a frighteningly accurate description of a child's view of the world, one whose innocence sees everything that only adult realisations can make sense of. Its not quite like anything else, but it rips reality apart like a hacksaw. I can't recommend it strongly enough.
translated_review: Neil Gaiman is the Ted Hughes of story tellers. His work is dark and sinister but never without hope. This is his best book since American Gods, a conjuring trick of a book, so masterfully written you can't see how it's done. He has the ability to describe things that are not there, but which somehow are when you've read his words. Here we have a frighteningly accurate description of a child's view of the world, one whose innocence sees everything that only adult realisations can make sense of. Its not quite like anything else, but it rips reality apart like a hacksaw. I can't recommend it strongly enough.

review_body: Wenn von bekannten Spielern der chromatischen Mundharmonika die Rede ist, dann fallen meistens die Namen Larry Adler, Toots Thielemans und Stevie Wonder. Hugo Diaz jedoch scheint nur wenigen bekannt zu sein, was wirklich sehr schade ist, denn von der Virtuosität her kann er es mit eben genannten Personen locker aufnehmen, wenn nicht sogar übertreffen. Ich persönlich habe noch nie eine variantenreichere Spielweise der chromatischen Mundharmonika erlebt. Allein das mehrstimmige Spiel treibt einem Freudentränen in die Augen. Und dann diese Leidenschaft, die einem Gänsehaut beschert und das Feeling des Tango bestens rüberbringt. Absolute Empfehlung !

product_title: Harry Potter und der Stein der Weisen
review_body: Ich habe dieses Buch jetzt schon mehrfach gelesen und bin immer noch von der Erzählweise verzaubert. J. K. Rowling beginnt hier mit der mehrteiligen Geschichte des verwaisten Harry, der von seiner Tante und Onkel mehr oder weniger \"großgezogen\" wird - sehr ungern, da Harrys Mutter und Vater Zauberer waren und er nichts davon wissen soll bzw. sie nichts von den Zauberern wissen wollen. Jedoch findet die Welt der Zauberer auch in Harrys Leben Einzug. Somit beginnt die ganze Geschichte der Schule für Zauberei \"Hoghwarts\". Harry lernt seine ersten richtigen Freunde kennen, die ihm später helfen werden und zur Seite stehen. Natürlich hat Harry auch Feinde, u. a. den Mörder seiner Eltern Lord Voldemort. Aber auch nicht alle Lehrer und Schüler machen ihm das Leben leicht.     Geschrieben ist dieses Buch richtig schön, witzig, - man kann sich bestens in die Charaktere versetzen. Dieses Buch ist eines der Besten - und vorallem - nicht nur für Kinder sondern auch für Erwachsene! Es lässt sich sehr schnell lesen. Liebevoll ist das Buch erzählt. Auf jeden Fall für Groß und Klein zu empfehlen. Es macht Neugier auf die nächsten Bücher.
translated_review: I have already read this book several times and am still enchanted by the narrative style. JK Rowling begins here with the multi-part history of the orphaned Harry, who becomes more or less "with his aunt and uncle - very reluctant because Harry's mother and father were wizards and he should not know about it or they none of the Want to know wizards. However, the world of the magicians also find in Harry's life. Thus, the whole story of the school for magic "Hoghwarts \" begins. Harry learns his first real friends who will help him later and stand by them. Of course Harry also has enemies, u. A. The murderer of his parents Lord Voldemort. But not all teachers and students make life easy for him. Written this book is really nice, funny, - you can get in the characters in the characters. This book is one of the best - and especially - not only for children but also for adults! It can be read very quickly. Lovingly, the book is told. In any case, recommended for big and small. It makes curiosity on the next books.

review_headline: Exodus : Gods and Kings [Blu-ray + Digital HD]
review_body: apres avoir vu une bande annonce d exodus , j'ai laissé sa chance à ce film, c est Ridley Scott aux commandes. L image 3D est magnifique christian Bâle convainquant.  Même plus que ça stop.je découvre rapidement que la plupart des scènes sont coupées , la réalité historique est absente, comme le personnage principal je doute. Le commentaire audio du réalisateur est instructif à ce moment décisif dans sa vie de créateur d histoire. Il fais l air de rien un bilan face à sa situation de réalisateur star, dommage ce film aurais du être autre chose. 4 longs métrages en 2 ans mr Scott en fais trop! Il resteras le côté technique ce n est pas suffisant pour faire voyager, rêver attendons son voyage sur mars et même si il ne réaliseras pas la suite de blade runner,Prometheus la suite? Est attendu!
translated_review: After seeing an Exodus trailer, I left this movie chance, it's Ridley Scott at the controls.The 3D image is beautiful Christian Basel convincing.Even more than it stop.I quickly discovers that most scenes are cut, the historical reality is absent, as the main character I doubt.The audio commentary of the director is instructive at this decisive moment in his life as a creator of history.It seems to be nothing a balance sheet facing its status director situation, too bad this movie should have been something else.4 feature films in 2 years Mr Scott made too much!It will remain the technical side it is not enough to travel, dream wait for your trip on Mars and even if it will not realize the rest of Blade Runner, Prometheus the Suite?Is expected!

product_title: Sur la route de Madison [Édition Spéciale]
review_body: Eastwood nous livre sans conteste un magnifique chef d'oeuvre.  Comme à l'accoutumée, le scénario et les acteurs sont parfaits (M Streep). S'y ajoute ici un magnifique rendu et ressenti d'une passion extraordinaire au travers d'un quotidien ordinaire. Le contraste en fait ressortir la simplicité, la profondeur, l'intensité et la grandeur.   Au final, le film nous fait toucher du doigt la fragilité et la beauté du lien humain, qui va bien au-delà de ce que nous pensons être la relation sociale et l'amour. Une lumineuse leçon de vie !
translated_review: Eastwood gives us unquestionably a magnificent masterpiece.As usual, the scenario and the actors are perfect (M Streep).Here adds a magnificent rendering and feeling of an extraordinary passion through an ordinary daily life.The contrast brings out simplicity, depth, intensity and magnitude.In the end, the film makes us touch the fragility and beauty of the human bond, which goes far beyond what we think is social relationship and love.A bright lesson of life!
